column3: The M365 Technical Platform Administrator is responsible for the design, implementation, maintenance, and optimisation of Microsoft 365 (M365)
column13: Employment status: Permanent Full-time Classification: Municipal Officer Level 4 Agreement: Hobart City Council Enterprise Agreement 2021 Salary range: $95,251 per annum + 13% superannuation.  About the role  The M365 Technical Platform Administrator is responsible for the design, implementation, maintenance, and optimisation of Microsoft 365 (M365) platform solutions within the organisation. This role involves managing the technical infrastructure, configurations, security policies, and user access within the M365 environment.  Key Responsibilities include:  Technical Platform Administration  Ensure M365 is moving towards the future state architecture. Address teams on the day-to-day technical operation of the M365 platform, including PowerShell script, site template update user management, license allocation, and solution  Design and Implementation  Collaborate with stakeholders to design and implement M365 solutions that meet business needs.   Security and Compliance  Make the most out of M365 compliance and champion of compliance, information lifecycle management and sensitivity labels.  Learn more about the role in the position description: M365 Technical Platform Administrator Position Description  About you  The desired applicant will have a Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field along with three or more years as a technical specialist or a similar role.  Join our team and take the helm of innovation as a Technical Platform Administrator! In this pivotal role, you'll be the backbone of our tech infrastructure, ensuring seamless operations and driving advancements. Your expertise will be the catalyst for transformation, as you manage, optimize, and secure our platforms. If you're passionate about technology and eager to shape the future of digital landscapes, we want you on board. Apply now and become the architect of our technological excellence!  About us  The City of Hobart offers something for everyone, with connections between nature, history, culture, businesses and each other. We are proud to provide a range of services and facilities that support the wellbeing, safety and participation of the community as well as continuously look to improve and embrace new approaches to achieve better outcomes for all. With an industrious and diversified economy, wherever your skills, talents and passions lie, we can offer you the opportunity to have a rewarding career with ongoing learning and development opportunities.  We recognise contributions to our workforce and offer:  Above Award wages and Employer Superannuation at 13% with salary sacrifice options. Flexible work arrangements including the option to apply for a nine-day fortnight. A wide range of paid leave entitlements. Health and Wellness programs, including onsite gyms. Discounted membership at Hobart Aquatic Centre. Ability to purchase additional leave after 12 months of service. An Employee Assistance Program that offers onsite visits. Corporate Health Plan discounts with BUPA, St. Lukes and Medibank.  Learn more about what the City of Hobart can offer you.  The City of Hobart is committed to building an inclusive community and workplace. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applications from people of all backgrounds, abilities, ages and identities.  City of Hobart has a strong commitment to health and safety. Appointment will be subject to satisfactory pre-employment background checks. These will include reference checks, National Police History record check, and Medical Assessment including drug and alcohol testing.  Learn more about our vision, mission and values.  How to apply  If you require any further information specific to this role please contact Sina Tarkesh (Lead Enterprise Architect) on 0431704003 or email sina.tarkesh@hobartcity.com.au  All applications must be made in the online portal, and you can save your application as you progress through the stages until you submit your final application. If you have any issues with submitting your application, please email details of the issue to recruitment@hobartcity.com.au. Please note that we do not accept applications via email or after the position has closed so if you have issues submitting your application, please contact us prior to the closing time.  Applications close 11:59 pm Sunday 18 August 2024.

column1: Level 1/2 Technical Support Specialist and MS 365 Administrator
column3: BMC is a family-owned company seeking a talented and customer-focused Level 1/2 Technical Support Specialist with a strong understanding of MS 365.
column10: $85,600 plus 13% super and NFP salary packaging
column13: Blue Mountains Computers is a family-owned company seeking a talented and customer-focused Level 1/2 Technical Support Specialist with a strong understanding of Microsoft Office 365.  Responsibilities:  You will be responsible for providing technical support and troubleshooting to end-users via phone, email, and in-person.  M365 Tenancy Administration: Manage and maintain M365 tenancies, ensuring best practices are adhered to. Email & Exchange: Oversee email services and Exchange administration, ensuring smooth operation and migration processes. Teams, OneDrive & SharePoint: Administer and support collaboration tools, optimizing for user productivity and security. Security & Compliance: Implement and manage security measures, with a focus on Microsoft Defender and other compliance tools. Intune Management: Deploy and manage devices using Intune, ensuring seamless integration and security. Migrations: Lead the migration of customers from legacy systems to M365, ensuring a seamless transition and minimal disruption to business operations. Manage all managed services agreement customers.  Qualifications:  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Experience with Microsoft 365 administration. Familiarity with Windows and Mac operating systems.  Benefits:  Competitive hourly rate Opportunities for professional growth and development Supportive and collaborative work environment Fast growing IT business with huge potential   If you are a passionate and motivated individual with a strong technical background, we encourage you to apply!  To Apply:  Please submit your resume and cover letter to info@bmcomp.com.au  We look forward to hearing from you!

column2: St John Ambulance Australia SA Ltd
column3: Showcase your technical expertise and contribute to the success of ICT projects.
column13: WHO WE ARE & WHAT WE DO  St John Ambulance SA provides Health and Medical Services for many of South Australia’s largest venues, such as Adelaide Oval, Adelaide Entertainment Centre, and Adelaide Showground. It is also the chosen provider for many major events on the SA calendar, including Schoolies Festival, VAILO Adelaide 500, and WOMAD.  For over 140 years, St John Ambulance SA has supported the South Australia community to help save lives and build community resilience to improve the safety and healthcare for all South Australians. In addition to Health & Medical Services, St John Ambulance SA also provides community care, delivers nationally accredited first aid training, and is the largest provider of first aid products and equipment.     THE OPPORTUNITY  The ICT Systems and Network Administrator is responsible for the day-to-day management of St John’s on premise and cloud-based systems and network infrastructure. This includes support maintenance and enhancement activities.  The role will provide technical expertise to ensure system reliability and protect infrastructure. The ICT Systems and Network Administrator will contribute to the success of ICT projects by leading technical deployment and enhancement of project tasks. As a member of a small team the role is expected to perform other general duties as required of the function including helpdesk support, reporting, and other tasks to support team goals.  Responsibilities include but aren’t limited to:  Manage business critical computer and networks to ensure St John can continuously operate. Deliver technical support for cloud, server, storage, backup and network environments. Provide expert advice to the business to ensure availability, reliability, capacity and security of the St John ICT environment. Manage security, audit records and documentation to ensure St John is fully compliant with all external and internal IT standards. Identify and implement cyber security controls and best practice to protect ICT infrastructure and improve ICT cyber security posture. Prioritise and resolve IT issues and support St John users to maintain a high level of productivity and customer satisfaction. Provide technical advice to ICT projects, including contribution to technical requirements documentation Lead technical deployments of new or upgraded applications     ESSENTIAL CRITERIA:  Current South Australian Driver’s License A relevant tertiary qualification such as a bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, related field or equivalent significant experience First aid qualification (minimum of Provide First Aid) (or willingness to obtain) At times of peak work demand, may be asked to participate in some after-hours work (or flexible working hours including requirement to work on weekends and after hours)       ABOUT YOU – Ideal candidates will demonstrate:  Proven experience in supporting technical environments including MS Windows, virtualised server and client PC operating systems in a business-critical environment. Demonstrated ability to identify, analyse, coordinate and implement the resolution of complex technical issues within a networked environment. Good understanding of enterprise network architecture, including Cisco Meraki networks and IP telephony systems in a distributed environment. Practical experience in managing cloud systems including Microsoft Azure and Office 365. Sound knowledge of Microsoft Intune environment, including mass deployment of device profiles, controls and policies. Exposure to MS SharePoint management and configuration. Exposure to business applications including ERP, finance and CRM systems (eg Salesforce) in a medium-sized organisation.                                                                                                         HOW TO APPLY  APPLY NOW via Seek with your CV and cover letter expressing why you are suited to the position. For enquiries, please get in touch with the ICT Manager Chamil.gallage@stjohnsa.com.au    St John SA does not accept calls from recruitment agencies. St John SA care about keeping children and young people safe. All successful applicants are required to complete a National Police Check and Working with Children Check. St John SA values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer.     St John SA values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. Employment is dependent upon a Criminal History check that St John finds satisfactory, a valid and current Working with Children Check, COVID vaccination certificate and the evidence of the right to work in Australia.

column3: Modern, agile company where people are always priority 1. Come join in and enjoy autonomy and responsibility as senior member of our epic team!
column13: Please DO NOT apply for this role if you:  Do not live within commuting distance to Byron Bay, NSW Australia Have less than 3 years experience in an IT Support or equivalent role  Applicants who do not satisfy this criteria will not be successful so please do not apply     Your new employer  itac.technology is an agile, modern tech support organisation. Based in Byron Bay servicing the Northern Rivers area, Gold Coast and beyond. ITAC delivers hassle-free IT solutions to SME businesses who value the ITAC approach. Focussing on long term partnerships, providing expertise in the issues facing SMEs and offering continuous improvement opportunities for clients, ITAC is an IT partner of choice.  itac.technology is growing and is looking for its next ICT Support Engineer, specialising in  M365/Google Workspace Cloud, who is keen to be part of the ongoing growth and success.     Why choose ITAC?  Location – you can surf, coffee, yoga, sleep or whatever brings out your A-Game Looking to stay in Australia? Sponsorship opportunities available If you are looking for some flexibility and balance this could be the role for you! Have a hand in company growth and direction, shaping your own role to fit your interests and the business needs Our people are priority 1! Be part of a small team with a strong emphasis on values and culture We're agile, honest with open comms and constantly seeking ways to do what we do with enhanced excellence! Use your experience to mentor junior team members No one day is the same! Get exposure to a variety of technologies and projects     In this role, you will be responsible for:  Deploying and managing project in Microsoft 365, Google Workspace and associated cloud services Heading up our development and enhancement of our Managed Support and Cyber Security offering Managing and supporting our Managed Support and Cyber Security Agreement clients Resolving support enquiries within your specialization Sharing general support workload with rest of team Monitoring and responding to incidents in our RMM and other platforms Logging and responding to work via the internal CRM Delivering thoughtful customer service to clients, the ITAC way, with a smile!     More about the role:  This role is flexible with option to start at 3-5 days a week depending on existing skill level A starting salary between $70,000 - $100,000 is offered, tailored to existing skill level and subject to performance based review     What’s ITAC is looking for?  Ideally, you’ll have 3+ years in a Managed Service Provider or System Admin environment and experience/curiousity in the areas listed above. You will already live within commuting distance of our office in Byron Bay, NSW. We apologise, but overseas or remote work applications will not be considered. Certifications or proven experience in cyber security, Service Desk, Google Workspace and Microsoft 365 are highly regarded.     How to apply?  If you are keen to join a forward thinking company and think you have what it takes, then please apply now! Send your CV with cover letter to work@itac.technology     Note we are not seeking candidates referred by recruitment agencies.

column3: Ongoing opportunity at the National Gallery of Australia for an IT Services Manager at an EL1 level.
column13: OVERVIEW OF THE ROLE  The Information Services Department covers the Gallery’s Information Technology (IT) team and Information Management (IM) team. As cornerstone teams that form part of the Gallery’s Enabling Services Portfolio, the department provides user-centred services to the Gallery with the upmost professionalism and leadership. We partner with all areas of the Gallery to ensure that our operations, initiatives and strategic priorities can be supported and implemented. This means we can support the Gallery to provide an enhanced visitor experience and manage the national collection of works of art we are custodians of.  The IT Service Manager position is part of the Information Technology (IT) Section within the Information Services Department. The IT Section manages and develops the Gallery’s information communication and technology (ICT) services both in the office and when staff are away from the office and emerging information technology requirements to meet our strategic and business needs.   The section provides the full suite of ICT services to enable all Gallery staff to access our IT network. This includes the applications we manage both on-premises and in cloud environments, and to enable reliable and safe devices for all staff to increase productivity and mobility.   This is a pivotal role, leading the IT Service Desk team and Service Management function for the National Gallery.  This role will lead a fundamental project to build our service management capability including development of Service Catalogue, ITIL processes to be built into our Service Management tool, redesigning how these services will be delivered to staff including change management and communication.   Working in a small team the role will provide you with experience across all facets of IT Service Management, vendor management, ICT procurement, budgets and costings, infrastructure, end user computing, IT and digital projects. As well as contributing to the National Gallery’s strategic direction including the development of written briefs and presenting to the National Gallery’s Executive team, responding to audit recommendations and contributing to the forward work plan for the IT team.   This position reports to the Chief Information Officer (CIO) and is responsible for ensuring the day-to-day operations of the ICT section operates efficiently, is well organised and supports the CIO in delivering high quality outcomes and cost-effective services for the National Gallery.       WHAT WILL YOU DO   In accordance with the APS Executive level 1 work level standards, you will have the following key responsibilities:  Lead the IT Service Desk team and Service Management function including external providers. Provide technical support for level 2 and 3 escalations. Actively contribute to the National Gallery’s strategic direction and implementation of suite of ICT strategies, in particular the ICT Infrastructure and Service Management action plan. Implement key improvements to the Service Management functions build our service management capability including development of Service Catalogue, ITIL processes to be built into our Service Management tool, redesigning how these services will be delivered to staff including change management and communication. Ensure effective risk management plans and policies for information systems are in place, monitored and updated regularly. Uplift IT Service Management processes for change, incident and problem management. Manage vendor relationships and service contracts for delivery of hardware, software, infrastructure and support services and evaluate and report on the provision of these services. License management across M365, Adobe and other products.  Support business system administration staff and business system projects. Undertake procurement and financial management activities including financial acquittals. Contract management including of our managed service provider.  Lead and deliver ICT projects and actively contribute to Gallery-wide projects. Provide high level advice to a range of internal and external stakeholders, including written and oral briefs to Executive and Council. Represent the Gallery internally and externally.        ELIGIBILITY:   Citizenship: To be eligible for employment with the Gallery, you must be an Australian citizen.   Police Check: to be eligible for this role you must complete a police check.  Security Assessment: The successful applicant will be required to obtain and maintain a Negative Vetting Level 1 security clearance. Ongoing employment in this role requires the successful candidates to maintain a high-level security clearance. Loss of a security clearance at any time will lead to termination of employment.     ADDITIONAL INFORMATION - Qualifications, Certifications and Registrations   Relevant qualifications in IT, ICT or other relevant fields is desirable     HOW TO APPLY  To apply for this role please forward your CV, statement and personal particulars form to recruitment@nga.gov.au.  View or download the complete position description at the Gallery's website.  You should provide a tailored CV (maximum of three pages) along with a statement of no more than two pages that outlines your skills, capabilities and experience, against the information above.   In your statement response you should keep in mind the capabilities and identified behaviours required to be successful for this role.  Try not to duplicate information that can be found in your CV but do highlight any specific examples or achievements that demonstrate your ability to perform the role.  As part of your application process, we ask that you also complete the personal particulars form as well.  An order of merit may be established from this selection process and may be used to fill future identical vacancies over the next 12 months. Selection may be based on application and referee reports only. If you do not wish to be added to an order of merit, please notify us in your application.

column2: bcu a division of Police and Nurses Limited
column3: P&N Group are seeking an experienced Cyber Security Officer to join our IT Infrastructure team on a permanent, full time basis.
column13: About us  Are you looking for a career with endless opportunities? There’s more to us than banking.  P&N Group is amongst the largest customer-owned banking organisations in Australia, represented by P&N Bank in Western Australia and BCU Bank in New South Wales and southeast Queensland. Our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers and their communities.    With over $8 billion in assets and a head office in Perth and corporate offices in Coffs Harbour and Brisbane, we service over 180,000 customers across Australia from all walks of life supported by over 600 employees in group services, retail banking, broker, and business banking roles.    We believe our culture is a real point of difference, and our values – Focus on Members, Improve & Learn and Trust & Collaborate – are fundamental to our ways of working. We offer a collaborative and inclusive workplace where our people feel a strong sense of belonging, are recognised, invested in, cared for, and are part of something bigger.    As part of our ongoing strategic customer-centric transformation, we’re focussed on making it even easier to bank with us for our customers of today and the future.   About the role;    The Cyber Security Officer is responsible for the day-to-day operation and management of the security controls put in place to minimise/reduce the cyber risk of business systems, to an acceptable level and to ensure these systems are operating as designed. The focus for this role will be on the development, enhancement, review, testing and access control of cyber security controls for business applications and systems to ensure they meet the security requirements to protect the data they hold, while enabling the function of the system in a safe and secure manner.  Additionally, this role will provide guidance and input into the secure provision and management of third party or outsourced services.    Working as part of an inclusive and collaborative team your key responsibilities will include:  Conduct compliance monitoring and/or control testing as required Effectively test systems, product applications or processes against cyber security standards, ready for implementation Assist with Help Desk procedure creation and maintenance Assist with administrative duties for the CIO, IT Managers or other senior staff as required Verify on-going conformance to security and/or compliance requirements Perform checks of security systems incidents and investigate as required Develop and operate security management standard operating procedures (SOP) and processes Monitor the application and use of security standard operating procedures (SOP) to ensure effective use Apply security standard procedures such as patching, managing access rights, malware protection and vulnerability testing under direction Assist with the implementation and rollout of cyber security related initiatives Take responsibility for system and security upgrades Review and remediate monthly vulnerability audits Coordinate and participate in periodic compliance audits Monitor the progress of outstanding incidents and service requests and escalate potential bottlenecks and workload issues to relevant IT Managers Assist helpdesk and end users with the resolution of security related incidents Ensure all user contacts are handled in a professional courteous and helpful manner Operate as a member of an intrusion and analysis team under supervision          What will you bring?     Three years’ experience in a complex IT infrastructure environment incorporating planning, implementation, operational management, configuration, and maintenance of security infrastructure Experience in vulnerability scanning, assessment, patching, remediation, and control testing Hands-on experience with monitoring, security diagnostic and network analytics tools High level understanding of Cisco FTD and Checkpoint Firewall products as well as other IT Security infrastructure Good understanding of Cisco Umbrella, Email Security, End Point Protection, ISE, Stealthwatch and other security products Good understanding in the use of Rapid7, Airlock, Grafana, Prometheus, PRTG, Graylog and/or similar monitoring solutions Good understanding of Active Directory, Group Policy, MSATA, Defender, Azure AD and other Microsoft products Advanced analysis, problem solving, troubleshooting and consultative skills Tertiary degree qualification or diploma in an IT related discipline or equivalent experience  What we can offer you There’s life at work, and life outside of work – and we understand that. P&N Group is committed to creating a satisfying and fulfilling working environment, offering employee benefits and development opportunities that reward and help you perform to your potential and expand your experience and learning.  To help you live your best life through work, we offer an extensive range of employee benefits.  Work for a national multi-brand, customer-focused organisation Enjoy flexible work arrangements An incentive scheme for exceptional performance Be supported with leadership and professional development 12 weeks paid parental leave for the primary care giver, and three weeks for the non-primary care giver Generous discounts on home loans, personal loans, insurance and other banking products and services Up to two weeks’ additional purchased leave per year Two days’ paid volunteer leave each year to use with a community partner of your choice An Employee Assistance Program At P&N Group, we want to leverage the numerous benefits and innovative gains that a diverse workforce brings, and especially the high engagement that comes from a culture built on belonging and inclusion. We encourage people of all abilities, backgrounds, identities, ages and cultures to apply. If you need assistance or require flexibility to be able to fully participate in the application process, please email us at recruitment@pnbank.com.au  The closing date for applications is 31 August 2024

column3: Design, implement, and maintain system architecture. Complex troubleshooting and long-term system strategy. Hybrid role.
column13: Join us for a hands-on role where you'll engage with a variety of technologies in a child sector and see your impact. Make a difference while collaborating with international teams and supporting overseas Junior Adventures Group companies. Enjoy a healthy work-life balance with true time off, a flexible rotating roster from 6am to 7pm, and a blend of 3 days in our Camberwell office and 2 days remote.   About the role  As an IT Systems Engineer, you'll design, implement, and maintain system architecture, focusing on complex troubleshooting and strategic planning. You'll manage cloud services, network configurations, and apply Zero Trust Security Methodologies.  Design and manage system architecture, including cloud and hybrid environments. Implement system monitoring, configure alerts, and analyze performance data. Troubleshoot issues, optimize architectures, and ensure Zero Trust Security compliance. Update and review architectural guidelines and documentation. Handle escalated issues, work with stakeholders, and manage change processes, including after-hours tasks.  About us  Partnering with parents and school communities, our goal is to help today's children navigate their tomorrow through play in fun, engaging environments. We live and breathe our company values every day by being considerate, passionate, and courageous, and making a difference.  Who are we looking for?  We can teach you about the job and sector, but a few basics you need to have:  Required:  Hold a Diploma level or higher in IT Systems, Networking, Computer Science, or a related field Minimum 3 years' experience in system engineering, level 3 support analyst, or related field Demonstrated proficiency with cloud services and network configurations. In-depth understanding of Microsoft Azure, Microsoft 365, Cisco Meraki, Intune and Autopilot configurations. Australian work rights  Desirable:  Experience with Netskope, HP Insights, and Zero Trust Security Methodologies Expertise in system architecture, including the design and implementation of scalable, high-availability solutions  What's in it for you?  Lucrative Employee Referral Program - earn up to $1,000 for an employee referral via Care Friends Discounted Health Insurance - get a discount off your premium with Bupa Discounted Fitness and Wellbeing - discounted gym membership at over 400 Gyms/Studios, up to 50% off fitness & wellbeing benefits through Wherefit Exclusive discounts for your family to attend our services, plus 1000's of savings on various lifestyle choices Recognition, awards, career growth   How to apply  If you share our values, want to have fun at work every day, and want a career that works for you, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now or reach out to our team with any questions: careers@junioradventuresgroup.com.au.  At Junior Adventures Group, safeguarding children is our top priority. As part of our recruitment process, we conduct thorough background checks, reference checks and appropriate screening on all potential employees to ensure that they share our commitment to safeguarding and have not been involved in any activities that could put children at risk.  We welcome all individuals from diverse backgrounds, genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage, to apply for any open positions within Junior Adventures Group.

column3: We are seeking an experienced full-time Head of IT & Business Systems to join our senior management team. Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer.
column13: About the role  We are seeking an experienced Head of IT & Business Systems to join our senior management team. Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer this role is responsible for overseeing the strategic planning, implementation, and day to day operational management of IT and business systems across the organisation.  This role balances both strategy and operations, and is pivotal to ensuring the technology infrastructure business systems landscape enables the organisation to deliver high-quality residential aged care and home and community care services.  Key Responsibilities  Leadership and management; working with the CFO and existing IT partners to develop and executive IT strategy and lead the digital transformation initiatives Technology Management; ensure integrity, security and efficient operation of the IT infrastructure and systems Business Systems; manage the development, implementation and maintenance of business systems Project Management; Oversee IT projects from conception to completion Stakeholder Engagement; Key liaison between IT and other organisational stakeholders and 3rd party providers  To be considered for this position you will demonstrate:  Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field. Minimum of 10 years of experience in IT management roles, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership position. Proven experience in managing IT infrastructure and business systems in a medium-sized organisation. Experience in the healthcare sector, particularly in aged care and community care services, is desirable. Proven track record in managing an IT and Business Systems Function, with a focus on leveraging integration and automation. Strong management and communication abilities, with the capacity to influence and build relationships with key stakeholders. A collaborative and flexible style, with a strong service mentality.  Benefits  Be part of the senior management team Ability to Salary Package - meaning you pay less tax and have more take-home money to spend Employee Assistance Program  Access to Procurement Australia which gives you exclusive deals and discounts on electrical, white, and brown goods Free onsite parking Paid blood donor leave  Commitment to ongoing professional development  About Catholic Homes  Caring for Western Australians for over 50 years, Catholic Homes is a leading not-for-profit comprehensive aged care provider. We pride ourselves on providing a workplace that reflects our values of joy, love, and hospitality.  Catholic Homes’ ‘Care with Purpose’ is our approach to person-centered care and advocates being active and independent for as long as possible.  We have six Residential Care facilities, four located alongside a Retirement Village.  Our Home & Community Care division provides service across Perth and Regional WA is tailored to suit the individual needs of those living in the community.   Catholic Homes is an inclusive organisation welcoming all faiths and backgrounds.  Catholic Homes’ innovation and proactive approach to aged care has won us numerous awards including the 2020 Institute of Hospitality In Health Care’s (IHHC) Brightest Star Award and Better Practice Award for its Circle of Men project.   To Apply:  For a copy of the position description please click here  For further information kindly contact hr@catholichomes.com   Shortlisting and interviews for this position will begin immediately. Catholic Homes reserves the right to close applications upon identifying a suitable candidate.  Applicants must have full rights to live and work in Australia. Please note Catholic Homes does not provide sponsorship to employees.  For more information on working with Catholic Homes please visit www.catholichomes.com

column3: Join La Trobe's Information Services function and help revolutionize the academic landscape through transformative leadership and technology.
column13: Business Unit: Chief Operating Officer (COO) Division: Information Service (IS) Employment Type: Full Time, Continuing position Campus Location: Bundoora, Victoria Salary Band: HEO6     About Us: Join La Trobe University, a prominent independent research institution renowned for its global impact and dedication to innovation. At La Trobe, we are committed to revolutionising the academic landscape through transformative leadership and cutting-edge technology. We are currently seeking skilled and visionary individuals to join our Information Services function in the role of Support Network Engineer within our Network Management team.  About the Role La Trobe University is looking for a motivated Support Network Engineer to join our Digital Workplace Services team. This role provides essential technical support in the maintenance and operation of our network infrastructure, contributing to a positive digital experience for students and staff.  Key Responsibilities  Assist in monitoring, maintenance, and troubleshooting of network systems. Provide first-level technical support for network-related inquiries. Support the deployment of network infrastructure projects. Maintain accurate records of network configurations and performance metrics. Collaborate with team members to enhance knowledge and skills. Engage with users to understand their needs and provide solutions.     Essential Criteria  Basic understanding of network design protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP). Familiarity with network hardware (e.g., routers, switches). Proficient in using network monitoring tools. Strong communication and problem-solving skills. Customer-oriented approach with a commitment to high-quality support. Degree or relevant experience in a related field.     Please refer to the Position Description for other duties, skills and experience required for this position.  Welcome to Bundoora campus – Please click on the video link below:   https://f.io/KDo0ceng  Benefits:  17% employer contributed superannuation On site child care facilities Flexible work arrangements Discounts for staff and their family members to study a range of La Trobe courses     How to apply  Closing date:  By 11:55pm Sunday the 25th of August 2024  Position Enquiries: Fraser Shields   f.shields@latrobe.edu.au  Recruitment Enquiries:  Madeleine Parker m.parker@latrobe.edu.au     Position Description below:    PD-Support Network Engineer-HEO6 .pdf  Only candidates with Full Working Rights in Australia may apply for this position.  Please submit an online application ONLY and include the following documents:  Cover letter; and An up to date resume  Please scroll down to apply.     Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Applicants  We welcome and strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.      La Trobe University is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We take an intersectional approach by actively supporting and encouraging people of all backgrounds and abilities to submit an application and aim to ensure that the recruitment and employee experience is as accessible and inclusive as possible. Flexibility in interview format will be offered to shortlisted candidates.     All La Trobe University employees are bound by the Working with Children Act 2005.  If you are successful, you will be required to hold a valid Victorian Employee Working with Children Check prior to commencement.

column3: Currently seeking the services of an experienced delivery manager who has been focused Scrum Master to join their busy and growing team.
column13: DELIVERY MANAGER - PERM - $190k + SUPER + BONUS - HYBRID ROLE/SYDNEY (3 DAYS MAX IN THE OFFICE A WEEK) - ASX LISTED COMPANY - GREAT TEAM AND CULTURE!!  Our client is currently seeking the services of an experienced Delivery Manager who has experience as a seasoned Scrum Master to join their busy team. The organisation is currently transitioning into a pure Scrum methodology and you will be required to assist in this transition and make it successful. You will be responsible for a team including Developers, Business Analysts and Testers.   About the role:  Oversee the successful delivery of high-impact financial projects. Lead and mentor a team of delivery managers and project leads in an Agile environment. Develop and implement best practices to enhance Agile delivery processes. Collaborate with senior leadership to align delivery strategies with business goals. Ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget. Foster a culture of continuous improvement and Agile innovation. Requirements: Proven experience in a senior delivery or project management role within a financial organization. Strong leadership and team management skills in an Agile environment. Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities. Ability to drive strategic initiatives and manage complex projects. Extensive experience with Agile methodologies and frameworks (e.g., Scrum, SAFe). To be considered for this role please 'apply' by submitting an up to date word version of your CV or email sophie@ibcrecruitment.com.au

column3: Join La Trobe's Information Services function and help revolutionize the academic landscape through transformative leadership and technology.
column13: Business Unit: Chief Operating Officer (COO) Division: Information Service (IS) Employment Type: Full Time, Continuing position Campus Location: Bundoora, Victoria Salary Band: HEO6     About Us: Join La Trobe University, a prominent independent research institution renowned for its global impact and dedication to innovation. At La Trobe, we are committed to revolutionising the academic landscape through transformative leadership and cutting-edge technology. We are currently seeking skilled and visionary individuals to join our Information Services function in the role of Support Network Engineer within our Network Management team.  About the Role La Trobe University is looking for a motivated Support Network Engineer to join our Digital Workplace Services team. This role provides essential technical support in the maintenance and operation of our network infrastructure, contributing to a positive digital experience for students and staff.  Key Responsibilities  Assist in monitoring, maintenance, and troubleshooting of network systems. Provide first-level technical support for network-related inquiries. Support the deployment of network infrastructure projects. Maintain accurate records of network configurations and performance metrics. Collaborate with team members to enhance knowledge and skills. Engage with users to understand their needs and provide solutions.     Essential Criteria  Basic understanding of network design protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP). Familiarity with network hardware (e.g., routers, switches). Proficient in using network monitoring tools. Strong communication and problem-solving skills. Customer-oriented approach with a commitment to high-quality support. Degree or relevant experience in a related field.     Please refer to the Position Description for other duties, skills and experience required for this position.  Welcome to Bundoora campus – Please click on the video link below:   https://f.io/KDo0ceng  Benefits:  17% employer contributed superannuation On site child care facilities Flexible work arrangements Discounts for staff and their family members to study a range of La Trobe courses     How to apply  Closing date:  By 11:55pm Sunday the 25th of August 2024  Position Enquiries: Fraser Shields   f.shields@latrobe.edu.au  Recruitment Enquiries:  Madeleine Parker m.parker@latrobe.edu.au     Position Description below:    PD-Support Network Engineer-HEO6 .pdf  Only candidates with Full Working Rights in Australia may apply for this position.  Please submit an online application ONLY and include the following documents:  Cover letter; and An up to date resume  Please scroll down to apply.     Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Applicants  We welcome and strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.      La Trobe University is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We take an intersectional approach by actively supporting and encouraging people of all backgrounds and abilities to submit an application and aim to ensure that the recruitment and employee experience is as accessible and inclusive as possible. column3: Do you have a passion for improving business systems? Do you have experience with Asset Management Systems?
column13: Join our Asset Services team in this exciting business analysis and improvement role!  About the role  The City of Coffs Harbour is searching for a dynamic and innovative Business Analyst and Improvement Officer to join our talented and friendly team! As a key member of our Asset Services team, you will play a crucial role in driving business improvements and delivering high-performance outcomes for our organisation.  In this role, you will lead the development and implementation of cutting-edge Asset Management systems and processes, enabling effective data management across the City of Coffs Harbour. You will have the opportunity to apply your expertise in Business Intelligence to analyse data and trends and implement improvement projects to enhance the City's practices.  The successful candidate will have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills in order to effectively liaise with various stakeholders. If you are passionate about driving positive change, possess strong analytical skills, and are eager to contribute to the growth and success of the City of Coffs Harbour, we want to hear from you!  About you?  Tertiary qualifications in Computer science, Information Technology, Business or other relevant disciplines. Current C Class Drivers Licence. Demonstrated knowledge and experience in the use of Asset Management Systems. Excellent attention to detail. A positive team player!  What's on offer?  Starting salary from $96,123.76 + 11.5% superannuation Permanent Full Time 35 hours per week Brand new office location at Yarrila Place! Options to accrue flex time and flexible working arrangements. Generous leave entitlements - long service leave after 5 years. Scope for performance-based salary increases.  About us  The City of Coffs Harbour strives to ensure the community and visitors can enjoy and grow the City's opportunities. We empower our people to innovate and work collaboratively with accountability and respect at the core of our approach.  This is an excellent opportunity to be a part of a dynamic organisation and a thriving community in one of NSW's most beautiful regions. Check out the benefits of living on the Coffs Coast  Want to chat?  Please reach out to Kylee Mariott, Team Leader Asset Support Services on kylee.marriott@chcc.nsw.gov.au or via phone 02 6648 4472 to discuss the role in more detail.  If you have any queries around your application or the recruitment process, then you can reach out to our Talent Acquisition Team via email at recruitment@chcc.nsw.gov.au  Want to apply?  The application process and further details, including the Position Description, can be found on our Careers Page: https://coffsharbour.recruitmenthub.com.au/Positions-Vacant/  The City of Coffs Harbour is committed to the principles of employment equity and diversity and encourages applications from people of all ages and backgrounds to apply.

column3: Currently seeking the services of an experienced delivery manager who has been focused Scrum Master to join their busy and growing team.
column13: DELIVERY MANAGER - PERM - $190k + SUPER + BONUS - HYBRID ROLE/SYDNEY (3 DAYS MAX IN THE OFFICE A WEEK) - ASX LISTED COMPANY - GREAT TEAM AND CULTURE!!  Our client is currently seeking the services of an experienced Delivery Manager who has experience as a seasoned Scrum Master to join their busy team. The organisation is currently transitioning into a pure Scrum methodology and you will be required to assist in this transition and make it successful. You will be responsible for a team including Developers, Business Analysts and Testers.   About the role:  Oversee the successful delivery of high-impact financial projects. Lead and mentor a team of delivery managers and project leads in an Agile environment. Develop and implement best practices to enhance Agile delivery processes. Collaborate with senior leadership to align delivery strategies with business goals. Ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget. Foster a culture of continuous improvement and Agile innovation. Requirements: Proven experience in a senior delivery or project management role within a financial organization. Strong leadership and team management skills in an Agile environment. Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities. Ability to drive strategic initiatives and manage complex projects. Extensive experience with Agile methodologies and frameworks (e.g., Scrum, SAFe). To be considered for this role please 'apply' by submitting an up to date word version of your CV or email sophie@ibcrecruitment.com.au

column3: This role ensures successful project outcomes through the entire lifecycle and maintains high stakeholder engagement, all while requiring to be hands
column13: About Southern Ports Southern Ports manages the three gateway ports of Albany, Bunbury and Esperance, and facilitates trade through the commercial management of efficient, safe, sustainable, and customer-focused ports. Our three regional ports play a vital role in connecting Western Australia with world markets. It is our belief that strong regional ports lead to strong regions, and that results in economic and social benefits for the communities across the regions we serve. Our people are our greatest asset, and we are committed to supporting our teams and building a diverse and capable workforce that is geared to meet the current and future needs of our customers and the sustainability of our ports. Our Vision: Strong Regional Ports, strong regions.  About the role Reporting to the Technology PMO, the role provides project management for several internal technology projects. Strong organisational and communication skills are essential for engaging end-users, stakeholders, and contractors. Responsibilities include overseeing project delivery, managing budgets, defining scope, and adhering to schedules. This role ensures successful project outcomes through the entire lifecycle and maintains high stakeholder engagement, all while requiring to be hands on when needed. Additionally, this role emphasises teamwork, communication, safety and ensuring that the company’s technology systems are governed, maintained and functional.  Key Responsibilities  Develop project plans: scope, objectives, timelines, resources, and budgets. Manage project lifecycles, ensuring timelines and budgets are met. Identify, document and resolve project risks and issues. Engage and communicate regularly with end-users, stakeholders, and contractors. Facilitate project meetings and updates. Develop and manage project budgets, tracking and reporting expenses. Address stakeholder concerns and allocate resources efficiently. Ensure deliverables meet quality standards. Maintain project documentation. Foster team collaboration and support team member development. Implement technology policies and ensure compliance.    Experience and Requirements  Bachelor's degree; or equivalent work experience Project management qualifications e.g. PRINCE2, PMP 3-5 years of project management experience, specifically in managing technology infrastructure projects. Strong understanding of project management methodologies and tools. Ability to bridge business requirements and technical implementation. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong organisational skills and ability to manage multiple projects. Effective stakeholder engagement and management. Team player in an integrated environment. Self-motivated and problem-solving skills. Ability to travel to other Southern Ports locations (Albany, Bunbury, Esperance, and Perth).    Highly Desirable Experience    Experience with security and scalability projects, particularly those involving compliance with ASD Essential 8, ISO 27001, or the NIST Framework Technical background, with a hands-on approach to project delivery If you’d like to see a PD for this role, please copy and paste the below link into your browser:  https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/r0si5p2mcbls3dpzi52tm/PD-Technology-Project-Manager-Infrastructure.pdf?rlkey=h2x3bf5gocletaomwijajtavu&st=np7e8h6c&dl=0  Requirements    To be eligible for this 2-year fixed term full-time role, applicants must provide proof of Australian citizenship or permanent residency and reside in Perth, WA.    The successful applicant must have a current WA driver’s licence, be able to obtain and maintain a Maritime Security Access Card and undergo a pre-employment medical assessment including drug and alcohol testing.  Southern Ports is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against race, gender, age, religion, sexual preference or disability. We encourage applications from all culturally diverse backgrounds, Indigenous Australians and Non-Indigenous Australians. Southern Ports is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and impartial workplace with equal opportunities for all employees.  Applications close 23rd August 2024. We reserve the right to commence the recruitment process during the application period. Please contact Marianna Gyulambaryan on recruitment@southernports.com.au for a position description or further information.

column3: This Australian Company is ranked among the top MSP's in Australia!
column13: Cyber and Cloud technologies! Expand your IT knowledge Northern Beaches     This client is an award-winning Managed Service Provider with a varied and high-profile client base. Due to rapid expansion, we are seeking an outstanding individual to undertake the role of Service Desk Analyst (Level 2). The environment is fast-paced and is a rare opportunity for you to make a genuine impact in a company that focuses on a culture that embraces creativity, fosters innovation and offers real career progression. This will be your chance to demonstrate delivering results for customers and building strong customer relationships. You will be collaborative, team orientated as well as being able to work autonomously.  About the Company  This company is regularly ranked among the top MSPs in Australia. It helps businesses across Australia and New Zealand to use cloud technologies efficiently and securely. It is also committed to support best practice infrastructure solutions to some of Australia’s best-known brands.  About the Role  The purpose of the role is to deliver  with impact, fast reaction results and remote support to customers across Australia; provide technical support to major Australian projects, with a particular focus on SEQ sites and works; build and maintain strong customer relationships while providing onsite support for a range of clients covering physical networking, hardware and peripherals and provide strategic solutions to a variety of technical issues including desktop support, telephony, local area networking and peripherals.   About You  To be successful in this role you need to demonstrate the following: a high skill level of Windows and Mac desktop support, and an understanding of core networking principles and technologies; prior Level 1 and Level 2 IT support experience – preferably in a professional services environment; experience with Autotask (or another ITIL-compliant ticketing system);excellent customer service skills, with experience working in a high-demand environment; the ability to provide excellent customer service and provide clear verbal and written communication skills; technical and solutions focused with demonstrated attention to detail; certifications in Microsoft product support and ITIL frameworks are preferred but not essential and a desire  to upskill on different types of technologies;  Please note , this position will be located on a client site.  For further details contact Rosa on 03 9347 7780 or email your resume to rosa@micalerecruitment.com
column14: Help Desk & IT Support (Information & Communication Technology)

column3: Join our IT team on permanent basis.
column13: The Opportunity  At APA, our purpose is simple: to strengthen communities through responsible energy.  We now have an exciting opportunity for a ServiceNow Product Owner to join our Platform & Technology Operations (PTO) team in Sydney, Melbourne, or Brisbane on a permanent full-time basis. Reporting directly to the Value Stream Manager - Enterprise Information, the Senior Product Owner of the ServiceNow Platform will lead the ServiceNow Platform Pipeline using an agile delivery methodology. This role is crucial in continuously developing and enhancing the capabilities that support APA operations and enterprise processes.  As the Product Owner, you will be accountable for the ServiceNow Roadmap and platform lifecycle management. You will serve as the bridge between the business and IT, facilitating existing and new service offerings across the ServiceNow Platform. You will work closely with the Service and Experience Team, which plays a key role in delivering the Brilliant Basics services back into IT and the business.  Key Responsibilities  Accountable for the overall architecture, frameworks, governance, and development activities of the ServiceNow platform.  Define and execute the ServiceNow implementation roadmap, aligning ServiceNow capabilities across the APA organisation.  Design, implement, and optimise integrations that enhance the ServiceNow platform ecosystem.  Lead a team of ServiceNow professionals in an agile, fast-paced environment, ensuring exceptional outcomes for APA.  Demonstrate excellent cross-group collaboration skills, including conflict resolution and negotiation.  Provide thought leadership on the licensing model and assist in contract negotiations/renegotiations.  Your background  Strong experience in leading a ServiceNow capability in a large-scale organisation with 5+ years of experience in designing, implementing, and supporting ServiceNow solutions.  In-depth knowledge of ServiceNow ITSM, ITOM, HRSD, PPM, including Incident Management, Problem Management, and Change Management.  Strong understanding of the ITIL framework and IT service management principles.  user-cantered mindset balancing UX best practices with the need to deliver in a fast-paced agile environment.  Good understanding of project management principles and practices.  Experience of simplifying complex business processes  About the Team  Technology underpins everything we do at APA from helping connect millions of Australians to essential energy sources every day to achieving our net zero ambition - and the capability for our people to make this happen.  To help APA power ahead, the Energy Technology Systems & Data team is focused on enhancing APAs technology offering, providing innovative and progressive technology - enabling APA to be world class in energy solutions.  This is an exciting time for the team, we need people who are courageous, nimble, and ready to make an impact - change makers and risk takers.  Working at APA  At APA we're committed to fostering a safe and inclusive workplace where you can achieve your best. We'll provide you with access to targeted career development programs, competitive remuneration, employee benefits, flexible working arrangements, and wellbeing programs. We also have an inclusive parental leave policy providing 18 weeks leave including superannuation to support parents at work and in life.  We employee more than 2900 people across Australia and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture, where everyone feels safe, valued, and trusted to do their best every day.  We are APA  APA Group is a leading Australian energy infrastructure business. We proudly own, operate and manage a diverse $27 billion portfolio of gas, electricity, solar and wind assets which deliver essential services to communities and customers across Australia. And we own over 15,000 kilometres of gas pipelines which deliver energy to families and industry across every corner of Australia.  As the partner of choice in delivering infrastructure solutions for the energy transition, we're focused on bundled remote grid energy solutions, electricity and gas transmission, and future energy, including hydrogen and carbon capture and storage.  Our customer centric approach means we understand our customers and their businesses offering reliable, innovative, and cost-effective energy solutions that support their decarbonisation ambitions.  We are committed to delivering infrastructure solutions for Australia's energy transition and supporting the decarbonisation ambitions of our customers. We prioritise sustainable outcomes so that APA, our people, customers, and communities can thrive - now and in the future.  Join our team and be part of Australia's energy transition! We'd love to hear from you.  APA is an equal-opportunity employer. The safety, health and wellbeing our people, community and environment a priority. We embrace diversity in our people to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we operate in.  Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia to be considered.  This vacancy works with critical APA data, systems or infrastructure and candidates are subject to background vetting (including Police checks) before & during employment.  Role closes Saturday 31 August 2024. Role Reference number JR877.  PD is available on request by emailing recruitment@apa.com.au quoting reference number above.  We will contact successful candidates after the closing date.

column3: Join La Trobe's Information Services function in the role of Senior Network Engineer within our Network Management team.
column13: Business Unit: Chief Operating Officer (COO) Division: Information Service (IS) Department: Cloud, Infrastructure and Service Delivery Employment Type: Full Time, Continuing position Campus Location: Bundoora, Victoria Salary Band: HEO8     About Us: Join La Trobe University, a prominent independent research institution renowned for its global impact and dedication to innovation. At La Trobe, we are committed to revolutionising the academic landscape through transformative leadership and cutting-edge technology. We are currently seeking skilled and visionary individuals to join our Information Services function in the role of Senior Network Engineer within our Network Management team.  About the Role La Trobe University is seeking a highly skilled Senior Network Engineer to play a pivotal role in managing our Cisco software-defined network (SDN). This role focuses on designing, implementing, and optimising our network infrastructure to ensure reliability, scalability, and performance. The successful candidate will provide expert technical leadership and collaborate with cross-functional teams to advance our technological capabilities.     Key Responsibilities  Being part of the team responsible for implementation and ongoing management of our Cisco SDN architecture network. Configure and deploy SDN controllers, switches, routers, and other network devices. Monitor and optimise network performance, identifying and addressing bottlenecks. Lead SDN-related BAU initiatives, ensuring timely and within-budget delivery. Collaborate with IT operations, applications, and infrastructure teams. Stay updated on emerging technologies and trends in SDN and network virtualisation. Maintain comprehensive documentation of SDN configurations and procedures. Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues.     Please refer to the Position Description for other duties, skills and experience required for this position.     Essential Criteria  Expertise in network architecture, routing protocols (e.g., OSPF, BGP), and switching technologies. Experience in designing and managing wireless networks. Familiarity with network monitoring tools (e.g., Nagios, SolarWinds). Proficiency in TCP/IP networking and DNS/DHCP configuration. Current industry accreditation (CCNA, CCNP, CCIE) and basic programming knowledge. Strong leadership, communication, and collaboration skills.     Essential Compliance Requirements:  Hold, or be willing to undertake and pass, a Victorian Working with Children Check. Adhere to all University policies, procedures, and regulatory obligations.     Why Join La Trobe:  Career Development: Grow your career at an innovative, global university where you'll collaborate with community and industry to create impact. Inspiring Campuses: Enjoy working on our inspiring and stunning campuses, perfect hubs for industry, students, and academics. Transform Lives: Help transform the lives of students, partners, and communities now and in the future.     At La Trobe, you'll join a community dedicated to diversity, inclusion, and social justice. We value and support our staff to achieve their full potential while fostering a workplace culture of trust and innovation.  Welcome to Bundoora campus – Please click on the video link below:   https://f.io/KDo0ceng  Benefits:  17% employer contributed superannuation On site child care facilities Flexible work arrangements Discounts for staff and their family members to study a range of La Trobe courses  How to apply  Closing date:  By 11:55pm Sunday the 25th of August 2024  Position Enquiries: Fraser Shields   f.shields@latrobe.edu.au  Recruitment Enquiries:  Madeleine Parker m.parker@latrobe.edu.au     Position Description below:   PD-Senior Network Engineer - HEO8.pdf  Only candidates with Full Working Rights in Australia may apply for this position.  Please submit an online application ONLY and include the following documents:  Cover letter; and An up to date resume  Please scroll down to apply.          Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Applicants  We welcome and strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.      La Trobe University is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We take an intersectional approach by actively supporting and encouraging people of all backgrounds and abilities to submit an application and aim to ensure that the recruitment and employee experience is as accessible and inclusive as possible. Flexibility in interview format will be offered to shortlisted candidates.     All La Trobe University employees are bound by the Working with Children Act 2005.  If you are successful, you will be required to hold a valid Victorian Employee Working with Children Check prior to commencement.

column2: St John Ambulance Australia SA Ltd
column3: The Business Analyst and Application Support Specialist provides technical support for existing, new and emerging business systems across St John SA.
column13: WHO WE ARE & WHAT WE DO  St John Ambulance SA provides Health and Medical Services for many of South Australia’s largest venues, such as Adelaide Oval, Adelaide Entertainment Centre, and Adelaide Showground. It is also the chosen provider for many major events on the SA calendar, including Schoolies Festival, VAILO Adelaide 500, and WOMAD.  For over 140 years, St John Ambulance SA has supported the South Australia community to help save lives and build community resilience to improve the safety and healthcare for all South Australians. In addition to Health & Medical Services, St John Ambulance SA also provides community care, delivers nationally accredited first aid training, and is the largest provider of first aid products and equipment.     THE OPPORTUNITY  Working collaboratively with a small IT team, the Business Analyst and Application Support Specialist provides technical support and expertise for existing, new and emerging business systems across St John SA. You will have an opportunity to work closely with members across the organisation and provide technology solutions which directly contribute to the success of the organisation.  The St John IT team supports existing applications as well as supporting projects for new or improved technology solutions. As a member of a small team the role is expected to perform other general duties as required of the function including helpdesk support, reporting, and other tasks to support team goals.  Responsibilities include but aren’t limited to:  With the ICT Manager and wider ICT team, plan, execute and deliver IT enabled projects. Independently manage assigned projects and tasks. Work with user groups to identify opportunities for improvement of IT systems and processes. Identify opportunities to leverage existing technology to solve business problems. Document, translate and map user requirements to system improvements, including data design, where relevant. Participate in budget and forecasting activities. Build reports and dashboards using available application toolsets and general BI. Resolve escalated helpdesk tickets in accordance with performance metrics. Triage and coordinate resolution of specific tickets with St John SA designated partners. Be a team player within the ICT team to ensure it is a high-performance team with an external ‘can do’ attitude.     ESSENTIAL CRITERIA:  Current South Australian Driver’s License A relevant tertiary qualification such as a bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, related field or equivalent significant experience First aid qualification (minimum of Provide First Aid) (or willingness to obtain) At times of peak work demand, may be asked to participate in some after-hours work (or flexible working hours including requirement to work on weekends and after hours)       ABOUT YOU – Ideal candidates will demonstrate:  A proven track record in project management including user requirements gathering, preparation of technical documentation, estimation, and scheduling Knowledge and fundamental practical experience with integrated cloud-based system architectures – especially connected, integrated, API driven systems Operation, configuration and application of Salesforce CRM software is highly desirable Microsoft 365 suite experience including SharePoint and BI is desirable Ability to convey and translate complex concepts in a language suitable for non-technical people Understanding of the application of cyber security practices in a business environment Experience managing or contributing to projects with Agile methodologies     HOW TO APPLY  APPLY NOW via Seek with your CV and cover letter expressing why you are suited to the position. For enquiries, please get in touch with the ICT Manager Chamil.gallage@stjohnsa.com.au    St John SA does not accept calls from recruitment agencies. St John SA care about keeping children and young people safe. All successful applicants are required to complete a National Police Check and Working with Children Check. St John SA values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer.     St John SA values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. Employment is dependent upon a Criminal History check that St John finds satisfactory, a valid and current Working with Children Check, COVID vaccination certificate and the evidence of the right to work in Australia.
