Self-motivated and problem-solving skills. Ability to travel to other Southern Ports locations (Albany, Bunbury, Esperance, and Perth).    Highly Desirable Experience    Experience with security and scalability projects, particularly those involving compliance with ASD Essential 8, ISO 27001, or the NIST Framework Technical background, with a hands-on approach to project delivery If you’d like to see a PD for this role, please copy and paste the below link into your browser:  https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/r0si5p2mcbls3dpzi52tm/PD-Technology-Project-Manager-Infrastructure.pdf?rlkey=h2x3bf5gocletaomwijajtavu&st=np7e8h6c&dl=0  Requirements    To be eligible for this 2-year fixed term full-time role, applicants must provide proof of Australian citizenship or permanent residency and reside in Perth, WA.    The successful applicant must have a current WA driver’s licence, be able to obtain and maintain a Maritime Security Access Card and undergo a pre-employment medical assessment including drug and alcohol testing.  Southern Ports is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against race, gender, age, religion, sexual preference or disability. We encourage applications from all culturally diverse backgrounds, Indigenous Australians and Non-Indigenous Australians. Southern Ports is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and impartial workplace with equal opportunities for all employees.  Applications close 23rd August 2024. We reserve the right to commence the recruitment process during the application period. Please contact Marianna Gyulambaryan on recruitment@southernports.com.au for a position description or further information.

column3: Join our IT team on a permanent basis.
column13: The Opportunity  At APA, our purpose is simple: to strengthen communities through responsible energy.  We now have an exciting opportunity for a ServiceNow Product Owner to join our Platform & Technology Operations (PTO) team in Sydney, Melbourne, or Brisbane on a permanent full-time basis. Reporting directly to the Value Stream Manager - Enterprise Information, the Senior Product Owner of the ServiceNow Platform will lead the ServiceNow Platform Pipeline using an agile delivery methodology. This role is crucial in continuously developing and enhancing the capabilities that support APA operations and enterprise processes.  As the Product Owner, you will be accountable for the ServiceNow Roadmap and platform lifecycle management. You will serve as the bridge between the business and IT, facilitating existing and new service offerings across the ServiceNow Platform. You will work closely with the Service and Experience Team, which plays a key role in delivering the Brilliant Basics services back into IT and the business.  Key Responsibilities  Accountable for the overall architecture, frameworks, governance, and development activities of the ServiceNow platform.  Define and execute the ServiceNow implementation roadmap, aligning ServiceNow capabilities across the APA organisation.  Design, implement, and optimise integrations that enhance the ServiceNow platform ecosystem.  Lead a team of ServiceNow professionals in an agile, fast-paced environment, ensuring exceptional outcomes for APA.  Demonstrate excellent cross-group collaboration skills, including conflict resolution and negotiation.  Provide thought leadership on the licensing model and assist in contract negotiations/renegotiations.  Your background  Strong experience in leading a ServiceNow capability in a large-scale organisation with 5+ years of experience in designing, implementing, and supporting ServiceNow solutions.  In-depth knowledge of ServiceNow ITSM, ITOM, HRSD, PPM, including Incident Management, Problem Management, and Change Management.  Strong understanding of the ITIL framework and IT service management principles.  user-cantered mindset balancing UX best practices with the need to deliver in a fast-paced agile environment.  Good understanding of project management principles and practices.  Experience of simplifying complex business processes  About the Team  Technology underpins everything we do at APA from helping connect millions of Australians to essential energy sources every day to achieving our net zero ambition - and the capability for our people to make this happen.  To help APA power ahead, the Energy Technology Systems & Data team is focused on enhancing APAs technology offering, providing innovative and progressive technology - enabling APA to be world class in energy solutions.  This is an exciting time for the team, we need people who are courageous, nimble, and ready to make an impact - change makers and risk takers.  Working at APA  At APA we're committed to fostering a safe and inclusive workplace where you can achieve your best. We'll provide you with access to targeted career development programs, competitive remuneration, employee benefits, flexible working arrangements, and wellbeing programs. We also have an inclusive parental leave policy providing 18 weeks leave including superannuation to support parents at work and in life.  We employee more than 2900 people across Australia and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture, where everyone feels safe, valued, and trusted to do their best every day.  We are APA  APA Group is a leading Australian energy infrastructure business. We proudly own, operate and manage a diverse $27 billion portfolio of gas, electricity, solar and wind assets which deliver essential services to communities and customers across Australia. And we own over 15,000 kilometres of gas pipelines which deliver energy to families and industry across every corner of Australia.  As the partner of choice in delivering infrastructure solutions for the energy transition, we're focused on bundled remote grid energy solutions, electricity and gas transmission, and future energy, including hydrogen and carbon capture and storage.  Our customer centric approach means we understand our customers and their businesses offering reliable, innovative, and cost-effective energy solutions that support their decarbonisation ambitions.  We are committed to delivering infrastructure solutions for Australia's energy transition and supporting the decarbonisation ambitions of our customers. We prioritise sustainable outcomes so that APA, our people, customers, and communities can thrive - now and in the future.  Join our team and be part of Australia's energy transition! We'd love to hear from you.  APA is an equal-opportunity employer. The safety, health and wellbeing our people, community and environment a priority. We embrace diversity in our people to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we operate in.  Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia to be considered.  This vacancy works with critical APA data, systems or infrastructure and candidates are subject to background vetting (including Police checks) before & during employment.  Role closes Saturday 31 August 2024. Role Reference number JR877.  PD is available on request by emailing recruitment@apa.com.au quoting reference number above.  We will contact successful candidates after the closing date.

column3: ASX-listed business where we keep communities connected to essential network services across Australia
column13: About Us  Service Stream is an equal opportunity ASX-listed business that develops and operates Australia's essential services networks across telecommunications, utilities, transport, defence, and social infrastructure industries. Specialising in designing, constructing, and maintaining new and existing networks, we provide end-to-end engineering and asset management solutions for our blue-chip client base.  We have an opportunity for a Workday Systems Lead to join us! This will be offered on a permanent full time basis, from our office conveniently located on Collins Street. Bring your own ideas and passion for continuous improvement!  Benefits of working with us include:  Flexibility - All flexibility requests are genuinely considered, and this role offers hybrid/work from home options. Growth – We are growing and there are opportunities for your career development. Discounts - Employee rewards program and employee discounts across hundreds of businesses such as Woolworths, Air BNB, The Iconic, JB HI-FI, Dan Murphys, Bupa Health Care, Specsavers and many more! Paid Leave - Parental, cultural, community service, study, corporate volunteering and purchased leave along available. Culture – we are committed to fostering a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion.     About The Role  Key responsibilities include:  Maximise Workday system functionality through continuous review and implementation of improvements, including new workflows. Provide technical support and guidance to HR Business Partners, stakeholders, and end users, focusing on areas such as recruitment and performance management. Maintain system configuration and oversee master data values in Workday. Work in conjunction with Payroll Workday Systems Lead to support and maintain master data values in Workday (Job Profile, Job Family, Job Group, Roles, Custom Organisation Types, Positions, Locations). Act as a liaison between stakeholders including HR, Payroll, IT and the Workday vendor for issue resolution and enhancement requests. Generate data reports, dashboards, and summaries for key stakeholders, ensuring accuracy and relevance.     About You  Our ideal candidate will have:  Experience using Workday for HR/Payroll systems administration or business analysis. Leadership capabilities and ability to communicate with stakeholders of levels. Passion for continuous improvement and desire to enhance the user experience for our team members. Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues; excellent problem-solving skills and outside the box thinking. Technical aptitude, with proven experience in reporting, measurement, data analysis, and interpretation.     How To Apply  Please submit your interest with the apply button where you will be directed to create a profile on our system. We celebrate diversity at Service Stream and would absolutely welcome applications from people who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander, people with a disability or neurodivergence, and those from LGBTIQA+, Veteran or other diverse groups.  Feel free to email Talent.Corporate@servicestream.com.au for any inquiries on how we can best support you with reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process and a designated person will contact you regarding your inquiry.  Service Stream does not accept any unsolicited resume referrals from external Recruitment or Labour Hire Companies.

column3: An exciting ongoing opportunity has arisen for a Category Manager, Commercial Programs to join the NSW Telco Authority!
column10: Great Salary + Benefits + Discounts on Offer
column13: Category Manager, Professional Services  Employment Type: Ongoing, Full-time opportunity Salary Grade - Clerk Grade 11/12; base salary starts at $139,787 - $161,663, employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading. Location: Sydney/Bathurst/Gosford/Tweed Heads, Hybrid working options available and flexible working arrangements considered This role sits in the Commercial business unit within NSW Telco Authority  About the team: An exciting ongoing opportunity has arisen for a Category Manager, Commercial Programs to join the NSW Telco Authority, a rapidly growing agency within the Department of Customer Service.  The role leads the Professional Services Category team in the Commercial business unit of NSW Telco Authority, reporting directly to the Director of Commercial (Programs). This position will play a key role as a member of the Commercial leadership team. The successful candidate will have significant experience in procurement and commercial programs or projects and can play a key part in leading the procurement team that manages the Professional Services category for the agency and its customers.  You will be joining a friendly, fast-paced, dynamic and diverse team who is passionate about keeping people and places safe. Happy to challenge the status quo, you will be comfortable engaging at all levels and communicating succinctly. We are an inclusive employer that fully supports flexible working and values our people for their diverse ideas, backgrounds and skills. We are committed to building a workplace that reflects the community we serve and welcome applications from everyone.  Opportunities this exciting don't come around often. Don't let this one pass you by!  Your day-to-day  In this role, you will:  Manage and lead the procurement team of up to two employees with various level of capabilities and expertise to deliver efficiencies in Professional Services procurement categories. Support team implementation of category plans and sourcing strategies based on research and analysis to optimise value for money outcomes and meet stakeholder needs and expectations. Candidates with category knowledge of Professional Services will be preferred, however the ability to manage and prioritise business and customer requirements will be key to the role, as will the ability to think outside of the box. Activities span across procurement and contract management, and your portfolio will include a number of critical categories with a lot of visibility within the agency. This role will also support the engagement of emerging technology for digital connectivity which will require you to be outcomes-focussed.  To be successful in this role, you will demonstrate:  Experience in managing and prioritising business requirements and team capacity. Experience in team capability, process and systems optimisation/uplift. Experience in managing relationships with business leaders to define improved ways of working. Experience in managing complex tenders and contracts within a large stakeholder group. Manage team compliance with the NSW Government's defined procurement processes with capability to resolve/escalate commercial risks or the ability to quickly become familiar with the NSW Government Procurement process. Proficient in managing team workload within project deadlines/budgets while delivering a high-quality result. Ability to negotiate effectively with external parties and support technical SMEs to solve the technical issues/risks with suppliers. You will be resilient, adaptable, collaborative and will be able to roll up your sleeves and get into the detail where needed. Demonstrated ability to derive insights from data/contracts and present this data in different forms such as in reports, procurement documents or presentations with a high level of accuracy. Experience or ability to develop skills to understand NSW Government Procurement Policy and Schemes Ability to provide 360 feedback to junior and senior stakeholders. Good internal and external stakeholder management skills by listening and understanding their needs to solve any business or commercial/legal issues. Customer centric mindset, putting customers at the centre of everything that we do.  What we need from you:  An up-to-date CV and a brief cover letter outlining how your skills and experience are aligned to the role. For enquiries regarding this position, please contact tulika.bairoliya@customerservice.nsw.gov.au  About NSW Telco Authority  NSW Telco Authority (NSWTA) operates and manages the Public Safety Network to deliver radio communications for frontline responders. We work with emergency services and telecommunications carriers to protect communications assets during emergencies and natural disasters.  NSWTA is a delivery agency with responsibility for over $1.5 billion in key NSW Government projects that connect communities and support emergency services. We lead and coordinate whole-of-government connectivity strategy to bridge the digital divide and help keep people and places safe.  NSWTA operates as a standalone Statutory Authority within the Department of Customer Service. We promote flexibility and we will consider part time, job share and other flexible arrangements. We're proud of our customer-centric, people-first culture and it is key to the success of our fast-moving, high-performance organisation, where our people and partners live and breathe our values of Integrity, Trust, Service and Accountability.  We understand the importance of continuing to learn and grow in your career and provide a range of training and development opportunities to keep upskilling and nurturing our people. We're also committed to creating opportunities for job mobility and new experiences within our organisation or the wider public sector.  Salary Grade 11/12, with the base salary for this role starting at $139,787 base plus superannuation  For enquiries relating to recruitment, please contact Katerina Xenos via katerina.xenos@customerservice.nsw.gov.au.  Visit the Capability Application Tool to prepare for the recruitment process by accessing practice application and interview questions based on the focus capabilities listed in the role description.  Closing Date: Friday, 16th August 2024 at 9:59am  Careers at Department of Customer Service A career at the Department of Customer Service (DCS) gives you the opportunity to help improve government services and be part of reform that benefits people across NSW. We are focused on delivering excellent customer service, digital transformation, and regulatory reform. Come join us and influence the future of our great state.  Belong in our diverse and inclusive workplace  The strength of our workforce lies in its diversity and embracing difference, while the key to our success is leveraging the contributions of employees with different backgrounds and perspectives.  You can view our full diversity and inclusion statement here.  We want you to bring your best self to this application process. If you feel you may require an adjustment during the recruitment process, please contact our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion team via katerina.xenos@customerservice.nsw.gov.au or 02 9494 8351.  For more information, please visit: Information on some of the different types of disabilities Information on adjustments available for the recruitment process

column3: We are currently seeking a Principal Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team and help lead and drive our data initiatives to new heights.
column13: Do you want to work for an iconic Western Australian organisation committed to changing lives and making a difference to your community?  For more than 130 years, St John WA has been a cornerstone of support in Western Australia connecting with community through education, training and care.    As a trusted not-for-profit, the organisation’s unwavering mission is to serve humanity and build resilient communities which we do through a strong team spirit, camaraderie and the collaboration of all team members – paid and volunteers alike - working together to support wellbeing and health for every Western Australian.    St John WA is powered by team members who have a strong sense of belonging and purpose and combined we are a leader in pre-hospital care and related products with revenue of about $500 million across 17 different services, and a team of 8500 including 3500 paid team members and 5000 volunteer team members.     Last year, we connected with 1.2 million Western Australians including:    340,000 people through first aid training, education and engagement,   362,000 people who received care close to where they live and work,   410,000 received trusted transport and emergency care when they needed it most.        A job to be proud of:  We are currently seeking a Principal Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team and help lead and drive our data initiatives to new heights. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining St John WA’s data warehouse and data pipelines, as well as administering business intelligence and data visualisation tools.      What you’ll do:  The Principal Data Engineer works closely with Business Intelligence Analysts and a range of internal and external stakeholders to ensure the organisation has access to a robust, reliable, and timely data foundation to inform decision making. Reporting to the Manager Data Engineering & Governance, you will be responsible for driving efficiencies through automation, and documentation, as well as taking a lead role in coaching junior staff and advocating for best practice methodologies.  Your technical and leadership skills will be crucial in driving innovation, fostering collaboration, and ensuring the team's ongoing success in supporting the data needs of the business.  Key Outcome Area’s include;  Data Engineering Data Quality and Management Knowledge Management & Leading & Coaching Coordinate and lead special projects as required Legal Compliance Organisational Support Technical Lead Support     What you’ll need:  Experience:  3-5 years’ experience in a Data Engineering or IT senior technical role 2 years’ experience working with cloud technology, ideally Azure Demonstrated experience leading or guiding technical teams  Knowledge and Skills:  Excellent critical thinking and decision-making skills Strong understanding of data engineering processes and functions (eg ETL, Data Warehousing) and data            concepts Experience in SQL and data development Enjoy working in a dynamic, cross-functional environment where collaboration and innovation are key  Qualifications:  Tertiary or related qualification (business, commerce, information systems or other quantitative field) with a continuous record of professional development Relevant certifications from cloud platform vendors (such as Microsoft DP203 or AZ305) advantageous     What’s in it for you?  The successful candidate will be offered an interactive and supportive working environment within a positive and professional team along with:  $550 Health and Wellness reimbursement 17.5% leave loading $1,200 Clothing Allowance Competitive remuneration package Salary packaging options Free emergency ambulance cover Free first aid training     Are you ready to change lives?  To apply for this exciting opportunity please select "Apply Now".  Alternatively, if you have any questions please contact Talent Sourcing Consultant – Jenna Childs via email at jenna.childs@stjohnwa.com.au  Applications close on Friday 16th August 2024 at 6:00 PM.  St John WA is committed to creating an inclusive environment which provides a sense of belonging and enables a welcoming, diverse, capable and connected workforce who represent the community we serve. Our goal is to ensure people feel safe to be themselves.  We actively encourage applications from people of all ages, genders, nationalities, abilities, and cultural backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, members of the LGBTIQ+ community, and all other suitable applicants.  Please note that St John will not accept recruitment agency applications for this position.  St John reserves the right to select a shortlist from the applications received. The selection process employed will be at the discretion of St John

column3: P&N Group are seeking an experienced Cyber Security Officer to join our IT Infrastructure team on a permanent, full time basis.
column13: About us  Are you looking for a career with endless opportunities? There’s more to us than banking.  P&N Group is amongst the largest customer-owned banking organisations in Australia, represented by P&N Bank in Western Australia and BCU Bank in New South Wales and southeast Queensland. Our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers and their communities.    With over $8 billion in assets and a head office in Perth and corporate offices in Coffs Harbour and Brisbane, we service over 180,000 customers across Australia from all walks of life supported by over 600 employees in group services, retail banking, broker, and business banking roles.    We believe our culture is a real point of difference, and our values – Focus on Members, Improve & Learn and Trust & Collaborate – are fundamental to our ways of working. We offer a collaborative and inclusive workplace where our people feel a strong sense of belonging, are recognised, invested in, cared for, and are part of something bigger.    As part of our ongoing strategic customer-centric transformation, we’re focussed on making it even easier to bank with us for our customers of today and the future.   About the role;    The Cyber Security Officer is responsible for the day-to-day operation and management of the security controls put in place to minimise/reduce the cyber risk of business systems, to an acceptable level and to ensure these systems are operating as designed. The focus for this role will be on the development, enhancement, review, testing and access control of cyber security controls for business applications and systems to ensure they meet the security requirements to protect the data they hold, while enabling the function of the system in a safe and secure manner.  Additionally, this role will provide guidance and input into the secure provision and management of third party or outsourced services.    Working as part of an inclusive and collaborative team your key responsibilities will include:  Conduct compliance monitoring and/or control testing as required Effectively test systems, product applications or processes against cyber security standards, ready for implementation Assist with Help Desk procedure creation and maintenance Assist with administrative duties for the CIO, IT Managers or other senior staff as required Verify on-going conformance to security and/or compliance requirements Perform checks of security systems incidents and investigate as required Develop and operate security management standard operating procedures (SOP) and processes Monitor the application and use of security standard operating procedures (SOP) to ensure effective use Apply security standard procedures such as patching, managing access rights, malware protection and vulnerability testing under direction Assist with the implementation and rollout of cyber security related initiatives Take responsibility for system and security upgrades Review and remediate monthly vulnerability audits Coordinate and participate in periodic compliance audits Monitor the progress of outstanding incidents and service requests and escalate potential bottlenecks and workload issues to relevant IT Managers Assist helpdesk and end users with the resolution of security related incidents Ensure all user contacts are handled in a professional courteous and helpful manner Operate as a member of an intrusion and analysis team under supervision          What will you bring?     Three years’ experience in a complex IT infrastructure environment incorporating planning, implementation, operational management, configuration, and maintenance of security infrastructure Experience in vulnerability scanning, assessment, patching, remediation, and control testing Hands-on experience with monitoring, security diagnostic and network analytics tools High level understanding of Cisco FTD and Checkpoint Firewall products as well as other IT Security infrastructure Good understanding of Cisco Umbrella, Email Security, End Point Protection, ISE, Stealthwatch and other security products Good understanding in the use of Rapid7, Airlock, Grafana, Prometheus, PRTG, Graylog and/or similar monitoring solutions Good understanding of Active Directory, Group Policy, MSATA, Defender, Azure AD and other Microsoft products Advanced analysis, problem solving, troubleshooting and consultative skills Tertiary degree qualification or diploma in an IT related discipline or equivalent experience  What we can offer you There’s life at work, and life outside of work – and we understand that. P&N Group is committed to creating a satisfying and fulfilling working environment, offering employee benefits and development opportunities that reward and help you perform to your potential and expand your experience and learning.  To help you live your best life through work, we offer an extensive range of employee benefits.  Work for a national multi-brand, customer-focused organisation Enjoy flexible work arrangements An incentive scheme for exceptional performance Be supported with leadership and professional development 12 weeks paid parental leave for the primary care giver, and three weeks for the non-primary care giver Generous discounts on home loans, personal loans, insurance and other banking products and services Up to two weeks’ additional purchased leave per year Two days’ paid volunteer leave each year to use with a community partner of your choice An Employee Assistance Program At P&N Group, we want to leverage the numerous benefits and innovative gains that a diverse workforce brings, and especially the high engagement that comes from a culture built on belonging and inclusion. We encourage people of all abilities, backgrounds, identities, ages and cultures to apply. If you need assistance or require flexibility to be able to fully participate in the application process, please email us at recruitment@pnbank.com.au  The closing date for applications is 31 August 2024

column3: Join our team to support web and cloud-based services for national research data discovery, connection, publishing, sharing, and reuse.
column13: Title: Business Analyst – Technical Division: Scholarly Information Services Classification: ANU Officer 8 (Information Technology) Salary package: Competitive remuneration package including 17% superannuation Terms: Full time, Continuing (contingent funded), funded until 30 June 2028 Location: Canberra ACT Position Description & Selection Criteria: PD&PEWER_Business Analyst_Technical BA.pdf Closing Date: 25 August 2024  Support the development and success of important national research services to provide Australian researchers with competitive advantage through data Make a difference to the national research infrastructure of our world-leading researchers with our mission to accelerate research and innovation by driving excellence in the creation,analysis and retention of high-quality data assets Enjoy workplace flexibility and excellent ANU employee benefits  and be part of a supportive team  Position overview The Australian Research Data Commons (ARDC) is a Commonwealth-funded national research infrastructure facility within the National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy program. The ARDC is a transformational initiative that creates competitive advantage through data for researchers, through access to nationally significant, leading-edge data intensive digital research infrastructure, platforms, skills and collections of high-quality data.  The Technical Business Analyst (Technical BA) in the ARDC plays a pivotal role across the ARDC Services business unit. The incumbent will work in a Canberra-based team, which has responsibility for the development and operations of several web-based and cloud-based national services that support research data discovery, connection, publishing, sharing, and reuse. Acting as a technical liaison, the Technical BA will work in an iterative environment across the business unit and be responsible for the effective elicitation, communication, and validation of requirements to support the continued development and success of these important national research services. The Technical BA will help define the success and future of these services and other products and infrastructure managed across the Services business unit, as these are leveraged to support the needs of ARDC’s thematic Research Data Commons (RDCs) and for the benefit of Australian research.  To excel in this role you will have:  We welcome applications from individuals who possess the following attributes  An understanding of the research context and the role of web-based services in transforming and accelerating research in Australia (will be highly regarded). Demonstrated expertise in developing requirements specifications, conducting testing, and creating end-user documentation, with experience in backend data systems including databases (MySQL/Neo4j), APIs, data integration, deployments, and data processing workflows. (knowledge of or experience with frontend interfaces would be highly regarded). Demonstrated skills and experience in Agile/iterative methodologies, managing competing priorities to meet critical deadlines, while coaching and supporting other team members through projects. Experience in Agile coaching or Scrum Master, along with demonstrated technical expertise in Jira and Confluence, is strongly preferred. Extensive experience working closely with technical teams and web application developers across the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) to deliver effective and timely outcomes, including a basic understanding of programming languages such as Python, Java etc. Demonstrated high level interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills to cultivate and maintain strong working partnerships with a diverse range of stakeholder groups; an ability to write technical documentation and reports for a variety of audiences; and develop and deliver training and workshops. Knowledge of emerging cloud technologies and trends, (experience with AI tools and technologies to enhance data analysis, automation, and decision-making processes within cloud services would be highly regarded). Demonstrated ability to successfully work within a diverse team, fostering a service-oriented culture, and building effective skill sets and expertise within the team.  For further information, please contact Kiran Gautam, ARDC DevOps Manager, ANU, kiran.gautam@ardc.edu.au  The University actively encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. For more information on employment opportunities, contact our Indigenous Employment Consultant on indigenous.employment@anu.edu.au   ANU values diversity and inclusion and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to those of all backgrounds and identities. For more information about staff equity at ANU, visit https://services.anu.edu.au/human-resources/respect-inclusion  How to apply: To apply for this role please ensure that your application includes the following:  A statement addressing the selection criteria showing how your skills, experience and approach align with the role in no more than 400 words. A current curriculum vitae (CV) of no more than 3 pages. The names and contact details of at least two referees.  Applications which do not address the selection criteria may not be considered for the position.  Please note: The successful candidate must have rights to live and work in Australia and will be required to undergo a background check during the recruitment process, in accordance with the Background Checking Procedure. An offer of employment is conditional on satisfactory results.
column14:
Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology)
Other (Education & Training)

column3: P&N Group are seeking an experienced Cyber Security Officer to join our IT Infrastructure team on a permanent, full time basis.

P&N Group is committed to creating a satisfying and fulfilling working environment, offering employee benefits and development opportunities that reward and help you perform to your potential and expand your experience and learning.  To help you live your best life through work, we offer an extensive range of employee benefits.  Work for a national multi-brand, customer-focused organisation Enjoy flexible work arrangements An incentive scheme for exceptional performance Be supported with leadership and professional development 12 weeks paid parental leave for the primary care giver, and three weeks for the non-primary care giver Generous discounts on home loans, personal loans, insurance and other banking products and services Up to two weeks’ additional purchased leave per year Two days’ paid volunteer leave each year to use with a community partner of your choice An Employee Assistance Program At P&N Group, we want to leverage the numerous benefits and innovative gains that a diverse workforce brings, and especially the high engagement that comes from a culture built on belonging and inclusion. We encourage people of all abilities, backgrounds, identities, ages and cultures to apply. If you need assistance or require flexibility to be able to fully participate in the application process, please email us at recruitment@pnbank.com.au  The closing date for applications is 31 August 2024

column3: ASX-listed business where we keep communities connected to essential network services across Australia
column13: About Us  Service Stream is an equal opportunity ASX-listed business that develops and operates Australia's essential services networks across telecommunications, utilities, transport, defence, and social infrastructure industries. Specialising in designing, constructing, and maintaining new and existing networks, we provide end-to-end engineering and asset management solutions for our blue-chip client base.  We have an opportunity for a Workday Systems Lead to join us! This will be offered on a permanent full time basis, from our office conveniently located on Collins Street. Bring your own ideas and passion for continuous improvement!  Benefits of working with us include:  Flexibility - All flexibility requests are genuinely considered, and this role offers hybrid/work from home options. Growth – We are growing and there are opportunities for your career development. Discounts - Employee rewards program and employee discounts across hundreds of businesses such as Woolworths, Air BNB, The Iconic, JB HI-FI, Dan Murphys, Bupa Health Care, Specsavers and many more! Paid Leave - Parental, cultural, community service, study, corporate volunteering and purchased leave along available. Culture – we are committed to fostering a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion.     About The Role  Key responsibilities include:  Maximise Workday system functionality through continuous review and implementation of improvements, including new workflows. Provide technical support and guidance to HR Business Partners, stakeholders, and end users, focusing on areas such as recruitment and performance management. Maintain system configuration and oversee master data values in Workday. Work in conjunction with Payroll Workday Systems Lead to support and maintain master data values in Workday (Job Profile, Job Family, Job Group, Roles, Custom Organisation Types, Positions, Locations). Act as a liaison between stakeholders including HR, Payroll, IT and the Workday vendor for issue resolution and enhancement requests. Generate data reports, dashboards, and summaries for key stakeholders, ensuring accuracy and relevance.     About You  Our ideal candidate will have:  Experience using Workday for HR/Payroll systems administration or business analysis. Leadership capabilities and ability to communicate with stakeholders of levels. Passion for continuous improvement and desire to enhance the user experience for our team members. Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues; excellent problem-solving skills and outside the box thinking. Technical aptitude, with proven experience in reporting, measurement, data analysis, and interpretation.     How To Apply  Please submit your interest with the apply button where you will be directed to create a profile on our system. We celebrate diversity at Service Stream and would absolutely welcome applications from people who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander, people with a disability or neurodivergence, and those from LGBTIQA+, Veteran or other diverse groups.  Feel free to email Talent.Corporate@servicestream.com.au for any inquiries on how we can best support you with reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process and a designated person will contact you regarding your inquiry.  Service Stream does not accept any unsolicited resume referrals from external Recruitment or Labour Hire Companies.

column3: Influence and lead tech strategy, vision, modernisation and scaling of this Saas platform as the customer base continues to increase.
column10: Great Salary + Benefits + Discounts on Offer
column13: All the benefits of a SF Icon Remote from anywhere in Australia  Private health insurance 16 weeks paternity leave $150 a month treat yourself budget Extra company-given holiday days! A publicly listed scale up, that in the last few years has blown up.  Huge prospects for a Technical Lead to support the tech strategy, vision, modernisation and scaling of the platform as the customer base continues to increase across their huge code base.  Get stuck in as you investigate how these systems are currently used by customers and how you can enhance their experience. Ensuring high quality shipping, scalable and highly robust solutions, as well as software architecture and design.  With great responsibility…  Comes great power and strong leadership.   Your stakeholder engagement will be on point, and your ease at talking through all technological aspects of the product and platform will determine your ability to ensure things are being established and run in the right way.  This is a complex system, so expect to get your hands dirty. You will be directly involved in leadership, mentoring, coding, design and architecture, as well as making key decisions around them. You will be expected to be fluent in .Net Core, Cloud, CI/CD, Event Driven Architecture and Microservices.  This is an incredibly strong team of senior engineers, that in turn requires a superior Tech Lead who is technically switched on and able to drive innovation and the ability to think beyond the parameters of “typical”.  Learn, earn and grow with a team of dynamic, collaborative, like minded engineers.  Experience required:   Prior experience in a Technical Leadership role is essential Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills Lead and influence technical problem solving and solution design Distinguished web development skills across .Net, React.js and Azure Experience across the Microsoft stack C#, .Net Framework, .Net Core and MVC. Strong business acumen with the ability to consider all dimensions of the business issues into solution design. Experience in management, deployments and scaling of cloud based services (Azure preferable but not a deal breaker) If you are ready to bring your expertise to a collaborative and supportive environment geared up for significant growth… Apply now or email Dani - danielle@theonset.com.au       --

column3: Seeking Cyber Security Analysts for a Metals Industry Giant to implement, maintenance and provide support within their cyber security team.
column13: Job Description: Our client is seeking skilled and motivated Cyber Security Analysts to join their esteemed organisation that is recognised on a global scale. The right candidates will play a crucial part in ensuring the security of our systems and data. Responsibilities:  Support the creation, implementation, and upkeep of information security policies, standards, and procedures. Prioritise, identify, and analyse information security breaches, perform cause analysis, and assist in the investigation, resolution, and prevention of security incidents. Work closely with the Business Technology Operations team to enhance existing security controls, resources, and services. Report any potential security threats or risks to the Senior Security Staff. Aid in the development and implementation of cybersecurity incident response plans and playbooks. Assist in conducting technical audits and configuration reviews, offering recommendations to reduce the attack surface. Manage the Information Security Risk Management framework, including maintaining security records and artifacts within the risk management system. Participate in Information Security Third Party Risk Management activities. Help with vulnerability assessments and patch management processes. Research new products, services, protocols, and standards to support security improvements and development efforts. Continuously maintain relevant qualifications and skills through ongoing learning and by following trusted information sources.  *Recruiting several head counts in various seniority  Our client offers a dynamic and collaborative work environment, with opportunities for continued professional growth and development. If you have a passion for cyber security and meet the requirements listed above, we encourage you to apply.  To be considered for the role click the 'apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Nicole Oo on 0466 641 000 or email: noo@paxus.com.au and quote the above job reference number.  Paxus values diversity and welcomes applications from Indigenous Australians, people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people living with a disability. If you require an adjustment to the recruitment process, including the application form in an alternate format, please contact me on the above contact details.

column1: Practice Management Systems Analyst, Corporate Services - VGSO
column2: Department of Justice and Community Safety
column3: Unique role supporting the Finance team with their Practice Management System. Lots of professional growth & skill development opportunities.
column13: Great opportunity to take ownership of a practice management system Work in a supportive and collaborative hybrid team environment Ongoing | Full-time VPS 4 $92,332 - $104,762 p.a. + superannuation  About the VGSO  The Victorian Government Solicitor's Office (VGSO) serves the rule of law exclusively for the State.  The VGSO provides responsive legal services exclusively for the Victorian Government and public sector. Our place within government ensures we are at the centre of legal change, reform and problem-solving. We operate as a service-driven legal professional practice and strive for excellence in this competitive environment. In all aspects of our operations, we aim to role model and live by our values: Responsiveness, Integrity, Insight, Collaboration and Excellence.  About the branch  The Corporate Services branch provides critical strategic and operational support services to ensure the continual success and advancement of the VGSO. Balancing an appreciation of the complexities and nuances of the public sector, along with the requirements of operating in a competitive legal services environment, Corporate Services delivers proactive, effective and efficient services to VGSO's internal and external clients. Functions within Corporate Services include but are not limited to; Finance, Business Development and Marketing, Information, Communication and Technology (ICT), People and Culture, Strategic and Business Planning, Business Support and Administration.  About the role  VGSO is seeking a proactive, responsive and tech savvy Systems Analyst who will be responsible for the day-to-day administration of VGSO's practice management systems (Elite and Cosine). Whilst this role will sit in the Finance Team, it will also serve as the key liaison between Finance and IT in ensuring the practice management system operates effectively and efficiently on a day-to-day basis for the whole of VGSO. Reporting to the Head of Finance, this role requires an individual with strong communication skills and the ability to provide high quality and responsive support, advice, training and technical expertise to all staff in relation to the day-to-day operations and administration of the practice management system (Elite and Cosine).  Key responsibilities  Handling day-to-day support queries in relation to the practice management system for users. Ensure a high level of data integrity within practice management systems, via maintaining systematic and logical structures/hierarchies and naming conventions, maintaining completeness and accuracy of transactional and master data, including the timely handling of data errors. Promote the use of the organisation's practice management system (Elite 3e), billing system (Cosine Proforma) and matter planning system (Cosine Matter Planning), including investigating and proposing enhancements to the capability of the system to deliver improved accuracy, long term modelling, escalation, additional drivers/calculations and balance sheet forecasting. Identify and propose continuous improvements to the organisation's practice management system (Elite 3e), billing system (Cosine Proforma) and matter planning system (Cosine Proforma) to facilitate a greater degree of automation and reliance on a strong controls framework. Working with internal and external project team members, manage or support the implementation of additional systems and applications such as automation tools. Participate in requirements gathering, selection of appropriate application, design, testing, and documentation. Proactively liaising with all colleagues to ensure that service queries are resolved effectively and efficiently. Liaising and working closely with IT in implementing any system changes or updates. Providing training and support to end-users. Update existing or prepare new system manuals as required. Responsible for maintaining and supporting the day-to-day operations of Cosine and Elite. Ensuring month end close, as well as, year-end close is actioned in a timely manner. Perform ad-hoc analysis and prepare advice for internal stakeholders (e.g. legal branches, finance and IT teams) and external stakeholders (e.g. auditors, vendors).  Skills and experience  Tertiary qualification in IT. Qualifications in finance would be highly regarded. 3 - 5 years business experience within a practice management system or business systems function. Track record of working in system focused positions and on a range of different system projects, with preferably legal industry practice management systems. Experience with a variety of organisation-wide systems or practice management systems and proven system development skills will be highly regarded. Knowledge of financial processes, in particular, in relation to billing and accounts receivable would be desirable. Relevant experience a legal or professional services environment is highly regarded. Advanced Microsoft Excel skills. Technical reporting skills using Power BI and SQL would be advantageous.  Benefits  VGSO offers an inclusive, collegiate and collaborative work environment where you will be well-supported and mentored to develop your knowledge. You will also be given excellent career opportunities to progress and develop within the organisation. You will also be given the opportunity to develop a close understanding of government processes and develop relationships with key government stakeholders.  VGSO embraces flexibility and welcomes a conversation to help you achieve work-life balance. We currently work in a hybrid environment with employees enjoying a balance of working from home and in the office.  How to apply  If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply now! Applications must include a resume only. Please note it is not a requirement to submit a cover letter or respond to the Key Selection Criteria separately. Applicants should outline their relevant experience in the application questions.  To find out more about this role, please view the position description attached. Alternatively, you can contact Syreeta Robinson, Talent Acquisition Advisor via email at vgso.recruitment@vgso.vic.gov.au.  Applications close at 11:59pm on Sunday, 18 August 2024  Preferred candidates will be subject to pre-employment checks including but not limited to, reference checks, pre-employment misconduct screening and criminal record checks.

Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)

column3: Manage alerts, threats, vulnerabilities and exposures, as well as assist in uplifting the posture as per the cyber roadmap
column13: Who are we?  We're here to help people live well and create a better and more sustainable future. We support healthy and liveable communities by delivering water, sewerage and recycled water services to 1.77 million people who rely on us every day and every night. At South East Water, we innovate with purpose and act with care to deliver healthy water for life. Fresh thinking and collaboration are at the heart of our organisation. We are constantly learning, embracing the challenges of today and excited by the opportunities that tomorrow will bring.  The role  South East Water is now seeking an experienced and talented Security Analyst to work closely with the Cyber Security Team and wider IT and OT departments. The role will manage alerts, threats, vulnerabilities and exposures, as well as assist in uplifting the posture as per the cyber roadmap.  Some of the key accountabilities for the role include, but are not limited to:  Ensuring effective monitoring, detection and response to security threats and incidents as per the alert/incident response procedures and playbooks Perform threat hunting and provide timely response to the detected alerts Review, develop and maintain the response plans, procedures and playbooks as per the evolving threat landscape and changing South East Water technology and business environments. Administer and maintain the tools and technologies that support the security operations, and contribute to security toolset enhancements and projects Conduct technical analysis and investigations to enhance, automate and optimise security operations and implementing application control mechanisms Manage vulnerabilities, exposures and associated risks within a Hybrid IT landscape and improve the vulnerability management practices and procedures Conduct risk assessments and controls evaluation where needed, and provide assurance that the SEW Information assets and data are appropriately protected Ensuring that the response, vulnerability management and resilience metrics are met and exceeded   Who are you?  To be considered for this exciting new role, candidates must possess at least 5 years' experience as a security analyst or in another related role that includes cyber security operational functions and duties. With experience in managing vulnerabilities and exposures in a hybrid environment covering multi-cloud and on-prem IT and OT technologies, you will also possess a good understanding and practical application of cybersecurity frameworks such as ISM, NIST, ISO, Essential 8 and Victorian Protective Data Security Standards (NPDSS).  The following key skills, knowledge and experience will ensure you're set up for success in this role:  Strong familiarity with Microsoft security technologies and their integration Ability to understand and disseminate industry terminology and concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders Working knowledge in uplift and maintenance of security technology platforms Strong knowledge and ability to establish and enforce security baselines and best practice Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a demonstrated ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders Prior experience in the Utilities sector and/or critical infrastructure may be beneficial but not essential. What's in it for you?  A commitment to work-life balance with truly flexible working arrangements, including hybrid working and leave purchasing. 15 weeks paid parental leave for all parents and paid super on unpaid parental leave A range of benefits, including free on-site parking and cultural leave. A great culture working in collaborative teams with strong work ethics. Career focused learning and development opportunities. The opportunity to be part of an organisation committed to environmental initiatives. Enjoy modern office facilities with panoramic beachfront views. We're for everyone  We do meaningful work, but how we do it is just as important. We're here to help people live well, protect the environment, and keep healthy water and resources accessible and affordable for all. We know to make a positive difference we need to support our people to be their very best. Flexibility and innovation are at the heart of how we work. But it's our people's collective ambition, authenticity and differences that bring our culture to life.   Our people are as diverse as the communities we serve. Everyone brings a unique voice and a refreshing perspective that keeps us innovating. It makes us better learners, thinkers and collaborators, helping create better outcomes for our customers. Even though we're all different, we still share a common goal to deliver healthy water for life.  We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People, members of the LGBTIQ+ community, people with disability and from culturally diverse backgrounds. We aim to provide an inclusive and accessible workplace for everyone. If you need any help with the application process or would like to discuss your reasonable adjustments during interviews, or to learn more about the role, please contact: careers@southeastwater.com.au  Keen to make an impact?  Click here to check out the position description. We're accepting applications for this exciting opportunity until Thursday 8 August 2024!  Visit southeastwater.com.au to learn more about us and how we serve our customers.

column3: Are you an experienced Cyber Run Operations Manager who is ready to step into a new challenge and work in an award-winning tier 1 company?
column13: Come and join a thriving company and become part of a diverse global collective of free-thinkers, entrepreneurs and industry experts who are all driven to use technology to reimagine what’s possible. Capgemini. Get the future you want.      For more about why Capgemini https://www.capgemini.com/au-en/careers/why-join-capgemini/    Let’s talk about the role and responsibilities   As the leader of a Leverage (West) Cyber Run Managed Services team, you will act as Capgemini’s expert leader for your Cyber operational services & delivery.    With specific accountability for ensuring that your Cyber Run Managed Services critical operational services are resilient and available as contracted. On a day-to-day basis, you will achieve this through technical, operational, and commercial leadership.    As an individual, you will be able to demonstrate a successful track record of leading and continuously improving a Cyber engineering and operational function. This will be complemented with personal attributes such as resilience, collaboration, coaching, communication and engagement.   Technical, operational, commercial, and people leadership of a Cyber Run delivery function Lead Cyber incident response and remediation. Current and emerging Cyber Technology (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS Platform, tooling, infrastructure) Optimisation of Cyber technology (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS Platform, tooling, infrastructure) Cyber platform & tooling engineering: customer operations & delivery frameworks, and standard operating procedures (SOP) Development of high performing teams Delivering continuous improvement/transformation in globally complex and dynamic technology and operational environments Creating a coaching and learning environment. Knowing when to offer support to others and when to step in to take personal accountability. Strong communication and engagement skills. Able to effectively engage and communicate at all levels and across diverse stakeholder groups. Let's talk about the team   Our Cloud Infrastructure Services practice brings together the right technology, processes, and culture to deliver business agility and cost reduction to our clients. We provide cloud focused delivery services on areas such as hybrid cloud, workplace services, security, and cloud service management/delivery.  Let’s talk about your capability and experience   Degree (or equivalent) educated in a relevant Cyber or IT subject. Cyber or Information Security professional certifications e.g. CISSP, CISM Agile and continuous improvement Strong analytic skills to inform effective data driven decision making on service improvement and risk reduction. Cyber leadership team experience Understanding of current Cyber risks and threats and emerging Cyber mitigations (controls and mitigations) About Capgemini     At Capgemini, we are more than just a business, we are a diverse global collective of strategic and technological experts who are passionate about finding ways technology can help our clients, our people and our communities get the future they want.    Our people are the key to making this vision a reality, which is why we have been recognised by the Australian Workplace Equality Index as LGTBQ+ ‘Employer of the Year’ and ‘Inclusion of Trans and Gender Diverse Employees’ for the past two years. We believe in creating a safe, flexible, and inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work, contributing to our inclusive culture and truly belong, and our staff-led community groups are a testament to this commitment. We are committed to being active allies for everyone.   We believe by combining the power of the latest technology with our human energy, we can drive sustainable thinking into our operations and the work we do with clients. Its why we are committing to being carbon neutral for our own operations no later than 2025 and across our supply chain by 2030, and committed to becoming a net zero business by 2040.  Empower yourself with the knowledge and skills you need to succeed with our access to premier learning platforms, sought-after certifications and boundless development opportunities. You’ll be encouraged to gain at least 40 hours of training each year.      For over 50 years our values and ethics have been at heart of our identity. From our approach to ethics to the way we interact with one another, honesty, boldness, trust, freedom, team spirit, modesty, and fun guide and inspire all we do and have led to us being recognised as one of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by the Ethisphere Institute 10 years in a row.      Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion   Don’t meet every single requirement for this role? Studies have shown women and people from diverse minority backgrounds are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single requirement. At Capgemini, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly, we encourage you to apply and tell us what you can bring to the role.   We understand for some people, a standard hiring processes can come with challenges. If you are living with a disability, are gender diverse or neurodivergent and we can provide support with access requirements or by making an adjustment to our hiring process, please contact us at talentacquisitionaunz@capgemini.com   Information Security and Compliance  Capgemini Australia has developed and manages, process orientated Management Systems compliant to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001 and ISO14001. We are committed to delivering secure solutions and services through state-of-the-art processes and continual improvement frameworks in line with industry best practices as well as contractual, statutory, and regulatory requirements.  #LI-BS1

column3: Currently seeking the services of an experienced delivery manager who has been focused Scrum Master to join their busy and growing team.
column13: DELIVERY MANAGER - PERM - $190k + SUPER + BONUS - HYBRID ROLE/SYDNEY (3 DAYS MAX IN THE OFFICE A WEEK) - ASX LISTED COMPANY - GREAT TEAM AND CULTURE!!  Our client is currently seeking the services of an experienced Delivery Manager who has experience as a seasoned Scrum Master to join their busy team. The organisation is currently transitioning into a pure Scrum methodology and you will be required to assist in this transition and make it successful. You will be responsible for a team including Developers, Business Analysts and Testers.   About the role:  Oversee the successful delivery of high-impact financial projects. Lead and mentor a team of delivery managers and project leads in an Agile environment. Develop and implement best practices to enhance Agile delivery processes. Collaborate with senior leadership to align delivery strategies with business goals. Ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget. Foster a culture of continuous improvement and Agile innovation. Requirements: Proven experience in a senior delivery or project management role within a financial organization. Strong leadership and team management skills in an Agile environment. Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities. Ability to drive strategic initiatives and manage complex projects. Extensive experience with Agile methodologies and frameworks (e.g., Scrum, SAFe). To be considered for this role please 'apply' by submitting an up to date word version of your CV or email sophie@ibcrecruitment.com.au

column3: Opportunity to work for a leading Financial Services company based in Sydney.
column13: Data Engineer Permanent  $130k-$140k + Super    Our client is seeking a seasoned Data Engineer with expertise in the Cloudera Data Platform (CDP) and Spark-based ingestion pipelines. This role is ideal for a professional with a strong background in building and optimising data pipelines and a track record of working with large-scale data infrastructures.   Key Responsibilities:  Develop, implement, and manage scalable data systems to ensure efficient extraction, transformation, and loading of data from diverse sources using SQL, Spark, and Cloudera technologies. Create high-performance algorithms, predictive models, and prototypes utilizing Spark and Scala. Handle and deploy interactive Hive queries for data analysis and manipulation. Maintain data privacy and compliance in line with data governance standards. Collaborate with stakeholders, including Executive, Product, Data, and Design teams, to address technical issues and support data infrastructure needs. Work with data scientists to transform data and integrate algorithms and models into automated processes. Qualifications: Proficient in Spark, Scala, and Hive, with practical experience in Cloudera Data Platform (CDP). Extensive experience in building and optimizing big data pipelines, architectures, and data sets. Strong knowledge of Spark SQL and ANSI SQL. Experience in the banking sector, preferably in Payments or Financial Crime. Skilled in data pipeline and workflow management tools. Excellent project management and organizational skills. Proven ability to support and collaborate with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment. If you're interested in the role please APPLY NOW! or email me on Jmitchell@attributegroup.com.au

column3: Support the conduct of research studies by maintaining data quality control and management and continued functioning of electronic databases
column13: Data Officer – The Kirby Institute  Employment Type: Full-time (35 hour week) Duration: 12 month fixed term contract Remuneration:  $100,354 - $107,054 + 17% Super and leave loading Location: Kensington, NSW (Hybrid working, work from home and from UNSW Sydney campus) Full Australian working rights required for the duration of the contract  About The Kirby Institute:  The Kirby Institute is a world-leading health research institute at UNSW Sydney. We work to eliminate infectious diseases, globally. Our specialisation is in developing health solutions for the most at-risk communities. Putting communities at the heart of our research, we develop tests, treatments, cures and prevention strategies that have the greatest chance of success.  Why Your Role Matters:  As a Data Officer, you will be responsible for maintaining data quality control and management (such as data cleaning, data query resolution, data mapping and database design, development, implementation) and continued functioning of electronic databases to facilitate the conduct of research studies. You will work predominantly with REDCap to provide data solutions for clinical data collection and study management.  The role reports to the Systems Manager and has no direct reports.  Who You Are:  Graduate biomedical science qualifications, computer or other medical qualifications including Nursing with relevant experience in the conduct of clinical research. Demonstrated experience in data management, data cleaning, data query resolution and data mapping. Experience with REDCap database design, build, and data management viewed favourably. Experience with data and data extraction from general practice sites and tertiary sties from a wide range of databases is highly regarded. Proven knowledge of International Council for Harmonisation Good Clinical Research Practice Guidelines (ICH GCP) as governed by the International Council for Harmonisation. Excellent Interpersonal skills, verbal and written communication skills. Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise own workload and work independently as well as an effective member of a team. Proven initiative, analytical and problem-solving skills, capacity to meet deadlines and ability to pay close attention to detail.  Benefits and Culture:  UNSW offer a competitive salary and access to a plethora of UNSW-perks including:​  17% Superannuation and leave loading​ Flexible working ​ Additional 3 days of leave over the Christmas Period​ Access to lifelong learning and career development ​ Progressive HR practices​  More information on the great staff benefits and culture can be found here.  How to Apply:  Make each day matter with a meaningful career at UNSW. Submit your application online before 25 August at 11:55pm. To be considered for this role, your application should include a document addressing the Selection Criteria (skills and experience on the position description). A copy of the Position Description can be found on JOBS@UNSW.  Get in Touch (for job related queries only – applications will not be accepted if sent to the contact listed):  Jamie Cutler: Talent Acquisition Consultant  E: j.cutler@unsw.edu.au  UNSW is committed to evolving a culture that embraces equity and supports a diverse and inclusive community where everyone can participate fairly, in a safe and respectful environment. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and encourage applications from people of diverse gender, sexual orientation, cultural and linguistic backgrounds, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background, people with disability and those with caring and family responsibilities. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff.  The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.
