column3: Are you an Integration Developer with strong experience in Microsoft Dynamics and Power Apps?
column13: We are seeking an innovative and skilled Integration Developer to design, create, and maintain user-friendly applications within the Microsoft Dynamics 365 ecosystem. This role will enhance integration capabilities with the Power Platform, ensuring seamless and efficient data flow and process automation. The mission of the is to help young people tackle life’s challenges, believe in their strengths, and create their own paths and they are looking for a great cultural match to ensure this mission is achieved.    Responsibilities:  Develop and maintain integrations using the Power Platform, including Power Apps and Power Automate. Create custom connectors and leverage Power Platform APIs to integrate various services and data sources seamlessly. Develop solution designs using recognized design principles and technologies to achieve business outcomes efficiently. Maintain integrations using Microsoft products such as API Management, Azure Function and Logic Apps, and Microsoft Service Bus. Deploy software applications into development and testing environments using CI/CD processes. Develop and maintain appropriate automated tests. Requirements:  Tertiary qualifications or equivalent studies/experience with 5 years’ experience in D365 Development and strong knowledge of configuring and customizing D365 modules. Demonstrated experience in integration with Power Platform, including Power Apps and Power Automate. Experience in integration with other Microsoft products - Azure Function Apps, Service Bus, API. Strong understanding of Power Apps Portals, Model Driven, and Canvas Power Apps. Proficiency in Javascript, C#, HTML, and CSS. Experience with GIT and Azure DevOps. Proven experience in a technical development role within ERP/CRM Systems such as MS Dynamics 365 CE, Power Platform, .NET, and Restful API integration technologies. Experience with Agile/Scrum development processes and Azure DevOps, CI/CD pipeline tools. Knowledge in D365 Omnichannel. Be part of a team dedicated to making a real difference in the lives of young people. Invest in your professional growth, collaborate with passionate colleagues, and help us create a brighter future. Apply here or email me on amber.larkin@troocoo.com.

column3: Sydney based E-commerce company looking for a Data Engineer
column13: Data Engineer - Sydney - Permanent  About the company A Sydney based, fast paced E-commerce company - looking to bring on a Data Engineer to join their growing team. The company have a growth mindset and a culture which rewards innovation and creative thinking.  About the role As a Data Engineer you will be responsible for a number of areas including Data models, pipelines and business intelligence tools & analysis. The is a great opportunity to gain exposure across different products and teams.  They have an office in Sydney and a great office culture, so not accepting applicants looking for remote work.  Key responsibilities - Develop ETL Data pipelines and processes - SQL Queries for data modelling - Work with the finance team to produce reporting - Analyze large data sets using BigQuery and GCP - Work with the team to implement Data driven solutions  Skills and experience - 2-5 years experience as a Data professional - SQL and Data Modelling - ETL experience - GCP (Google Cloud Platform) and BigQuery - Analytical skills and financial literacy  - Able to work in a fast paced environment  Package on offer - Flexible depending on experience but considering a base between $110,000 to $140,000 + super.  If you're keen to know more then please apply or reach out to me at kaio.desouza@allurapartners.com.au  About Allura Partners Allura Partners was founded to support private equity firms by placing C-Suites to lead, transform, and scale portfolio companies. Today, in addition to our proven private equity specialisation, we’ve become a trusted partner for major ASX-listed and private enterprises in Australia, offering executive search, recruitment, and business transformation. Known for integrity, reliability, and results, our expertise spans Executive Search, Accounting & Finance, Transformation & Change, and Technology & Digital. We connect businesses and top-tier talent, exceeding expectations and driving lasting impact.

column3: As Project Coordinator, you will take total accountability for the planning, resourcing, leading and delivery of Emydex customer projects.
column13: Project Coordinator  Emydex Technology is currently looking for a standout Project Coordinator who embodies all our values of:  #Empowerment #YesMinded #Dependability #Excellence #Integrity #Teamwork  We are an Irish Software Development company providing Software Solutions to over 100 leading Food & Meat Processing companies in Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, the UK, France, Namibia, Botswana, South Africa and North America.    To look a little further into our company profile and to see what we are all about, check out our:  Latest news and what we have been up to: https://www.emydex.com/news/ Facebook page here with some staff event photographs: https://www.facebook.com/Emydex-Technology-344547285589514/  LinkedIn Profile which helps show you what Emydex is all about: https://www.linkedin.com/company/emydex-technology   The Candidate:   The ideal candidate for this role is a proactive and detail-oriented individual with a passion for project management. They should possess strong communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration with cross-functional teams. The ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, prioritise tasks, and adapt to changing project requirements is crucial. A problem-solving mindset, along with a commitment to delivering high-quality results, will contribute to the success of our projects.   Responsibilities:   Support project managers in managing budgets on behalf of the Technical Director, monitoring the expenditures and costs against deliverables as projects are implemented Assist in the planning of customer projects and monitor their overall progress, resolving issues and initiating corrective action as appropriate Management and analysis of issues Support Project Managers in building, managing and motivating the Programming implementation team.  Prepare monthly resource schedules in order to deliver customer projects to agreed timescales Track projects in progress, ensuring that all relating tasks are completed so that nothing unnecessarily delays the project work Be responsible for the quality assurance and overall integrity of projects delivered to customers Manage third party suppliers to customer projects as appropriate. Communicate with all stakeholders Manage both the dependencies and the interfaces between projects Manage customer change requests including preparation of quotes and deliver Manage customer Annual Maintenance agreements Report the progress of all customer projects at regular intervals to the Head of PMO/CEO   Requirements:   3+ years’ experience in Project Coordination using leading project management methodologies and processes (desirable but not essential) Experience in managing multiple parties including application programmers and third-party vendors The ability to manage projects across multiple locations Flexibility to join calls during non-standard working hours, with the latest call finishing at 10 pm. Experience with MS Project or similar Project Planning Tool Understand budgetary control and resource allocation procedures Ability to create a sense of community among the disparate members of the project teams Ownership of a car (desirable) Valid Driving License Knowledge of C# and SQL technologies (desirable but not essential)   Emydex Working Environment:   Emydex values our employees and strives to create an engaging and enjoyable working environment that promotes personal growth while working with a leading-edge tool set. Emydex Technology is an equal-opportunity employer.   We thank our employees by providing the following benefits:   Encouragement, guidance and support for those that want to self-improve and up-skill  Team cultural events  Time in lieu of overtime worked  Flexible working hours (possible)  Extra days’ holiday per year of service  Finish Early Fridays  Refer a friend scheme

column3: Looking for Data specialist
column13: About the Company  Tech Mahindra offers innovative and customer-centric digital experiences, enabling enterprises, associates and the society to Rise. We are focused on leveraging next-generation technologies including 5G, Blockchain, Cybersecurity, Artificial Intelligence, and more, to enable end-to-end digital transformation for global customers. Tech Mahindra is one of the fastest growing brands and amongst the top 15 IT service providers globally.  Key Responsibilities  Define and design the overall data architecture, strategy, and data capabilities roadmap that are consistent with our technology direction. Define and design the data platforms, tools and governing process Create, maintain and communicate go-forward strategies for business intelligence capabilities and tools. Responsible and accountable for producing the data solution and data product architecture design ensuring that they are submitted and progress via the prescribed governance process through to approval (ARB) in a timely manner aligned with project prescribed timelines. Define and review data solutions for re-usability, scalability, synergy opportunities and alignment to defined best practice and guidelines Create and evolve data technology roadmap, to align with continuously evolving business needs. Help defining and improving best practices, guidelines, and integration with other enterprise solutions. Participates in planning, dependency identification, and management as well as estimation with Project Managers. Leads Work Breakdown identification and workshops utilising Architecture designs as input Demonstrated grasp of Architecture techniques and ability to work effectively with senior business stakeholders and initiative owners. Act as Technology advisors on data to business leaders and strategic leaders on technology direction.  Domain Expertise  7 years+ of professional experience in data architecture or data engineering role. Demonstrating a high degree of proficiency in designing and developing complex, high quality data solutions according to our architecture governance policies guidelines. Strong experience in developing and maintaining data warehouses (e.g., Redshift, Teradata) Able to work independently and develop the solution architecture according to the business requirements and compliance requirements. Strong Data warehouse development experience using different ETL tools (e.g. SAS DI, Glue, DBT) Experience with data streaming platforms (e.g., Kafka/Kinesis) Familiarity with different operational orchestration platforms (e.g., Airflow, LSF scheduler etc) Experience with data catalogue and data governance tools. Understanding of CLDM, Star Schema, Data Mesh and Data Product concepts Exposure to machine learning, reporting, data sharing, data intensive application-oriented use cases Extensive experience in consulting with business stakeholders and other user groups to deliver both strategic and tactical information management solution. Experience working within matrix structures, with demonstrated ability to broker outcomes effectively and collaboratively with colleagues and peers. Experience on different delivery methodologies (e.g., Waterfall, Agile) Telecommunication Industry experience Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer programming or related field preferred  Why Tech Mahindra?  You will work within a successful, established and trusted organisation, where you the opportunities are only limited by your by aspirations; Do you want to travel the world? Do you want to be always learning new skills and developing professionally and personally? We offer everything you could desire with flexibility work, excellent salary, healthcare, dedicated training/certification platform and unrivalled recognition throughout the business.  For further information please contact Gayathri Ganapathy at email: gayathri.ganapathy@techmahindra.com  *Applications will only be considered for candidates with full working rights without restriction or sponsorship.

column3: Payroll compliance project. Data, analytics and reporting capabilities in payroll governance reqd SQL Power BI Tableau exp, hybrid work, hiring now
column13: About the company  My client is one of the big 4 banks with around 40000 staff globally. It is headquartered and listed in the Australian stock exchange and operates out of Australia, Asia, UK and the US. Being one of the largest business banks and over 8 million customers globally, they also offer corporate and retail banking to their valued customers.  About the role  Because of them undertaking a payroll compliance program, they are in a process to strengthen their data, analytics and reporting capabilities in payroll governance. As a result, an exciting opportunity has come up in one of their offices in Sydney. You will be joining their elite Data and Analytics team and will be playing a key role in driving the regulatory reporting and payroll governance initiatives of the bank.  This is an urgent role and candidates with regulatory reporting experience working in payroll governance projects will be preferred. PLEASE NOTE THAT IT IS A SYDNEY BASED ROLE  Skill Sets  You need to have the following skill sets to excel in this role:  Experience in Data, BI, Analytics and regulatory reporting in enforcement undertaking programs. Candidates with Payroll project experience will be highly regarded. Hands on experience in analytics tools SQL, SAS etc. and Reporting tools PowerBI, Tableau etc. Background in Banking/Financial services with experience in regulatory reporting will be regarded Experience working in an ambiguous environments Experience in leading small teams of data analytics and BI Developers will be highly desirable.  It is an urgent position and my client is interviewing candidates at the moment. It is an exceptional opportunity for someone who has Regulatory reporting or enforcement undertaking experience and has worked in payroll projects. Only Australian Permanent Residents and Citizens required for this role.  For more information on the role, please either apply or contact Nathan Sabherwal on 0430880196. Urgent opportunity, excellent project, excellent salary, great career path, interviews happening now  At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

column3: Sydney based E-commerce company looking for a Data Engineer
column13: Data Engineer - Sydney - Permanent  About the company A Sydney based, fast paced E-commerce company - looking to bring on a Data Engineer to join their growing team. The company have a growth mindset and a culture which rewards innovation and creative thinking.  About the role As a Data Engineer you will be responsible for a number of areas including Data models, pipelines and business intelligence tools & analysis. The is a great opportunity to gain exposure across different products and teams.  They have an office in Sydney and a great office culture, so not accepting applicants looking for remote work.  Key responsibilities - Develop ETL Data pipelines and processes - SQL Queries for data modelling - Work with the finance team to produce reporting - Analyze large data sets using BigQuery and GCP - Work with the team to implement Data driven solutions  Skills and experience - 2-5 years experience as a Data professional - SQL and Data Modelling - ETL experience - GCP (Google Cloud Platform) and BigQuery - Analytical skills and financial literacy  - Able to work in a fast paced environment  Package on offer - Flexible depending on experience but considering a base between $110,000 to $140,000 + super.  If you're keen to know more then please apply or reach out to me at kaio.desouza@allurapartners.com.au  About Allura Partners Allura Partners was founded to support private equity firms by placing C-Suites to lead, transform, and scale portfolio companies. Today, in addition to our proven private equity specialisation, we’ve become a trusted partner for major ASX-listed and private enterprises in Australia, offering executive search, recruitment, and business transformation. Known for integrity, reliability, and results, our expertise spans Executive Search, Accounting & Finance, Transformation & Change, and Technology & Digital. We connect businesses and top-tier talent, exceeding expectations and driving lasting impact.

column3: Work with a modern data tech stack across GCP, BigQuery and Dbt building the data foundations for an Australian e-commerce platform
column13: $130K - $140K + Super + Bonus  Flexible working arrangement   Benefits such as; Private Healthcare + Learning and Development budget     Are you looking for more flexibility and a healthy work-life balance? If so, you can wfh 3 days a week here with flexible working hours.   Want to work with a modern data tech stack? Guess what…You’ll also get this here working across GCP, BigQuery and Dbt building the data foundations for an Australian customer and product led company.   The other two days you’re in the office you will find yourself working closely with and influencing cross functional teams -  product, sales and finance.   Your work directly impacts the digital e-commerce platform, touching the lives of millions of customers and allowing you to see real results from your efforts.  What you’ll do:   Play a key role in building the data foundations that facilitate analytics, reporting and AI rollout at scale   Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines for ingesting, transforming and storing data using DBT and Bigquery   Conducting SQL data investigations, and optimisations, and troubleshoot pipeline related issues   Implement monitoring and alerting solutions for pipeline and data issues to ensure data quality, pipeline health, and performance metrics along with continuous data flow and minimal downtime.   What you’ll bring:   3+ years experience in data engineering, including ETL processes, data modelling, and data warehouse development in cloud environments   Strong experience with hands-on design, development and support of Enterprise Data Warehouses   Advanced SQL for data transformation and querying   Experience with GCP and CI/CD and extensive hands on experience of working with DBT and Bigquery   Experience in troubleshooting and addressing production defects, fixing bugs and supporting ETL pipelines   Experience working with large volumes of data and transforming it for optimal business use and ETL performance (time and cost)      There is plenty of room for growth across the company as they scale their data team.  If you want to wake up knowing you're working in a key role inspiring those around you and developing skills that will slingshot your career, apply here or feel free to connect with me, Ailbhe McDonagh Kelly on LinkedIn or get in touch at ailbhe@theonset.com.au

column3: xAmplify is on the search for a dynamic and experienced Program Quality and Assurance Manager to join our PMO team and one of our large scale projects
column13: ENABLING A SMARTER FUTURE  xAmplify is Australia's leading Integrator of Artificial Intelligence and Automation services. We understand and enable the journey to an automated and technology enabled future backed by the world’s largest and most innovative AI and technology companies.  We don’t pretend to do everything, so we specialise in delivering technology, digital, and business transformation through the aggregation and integration of the world’s most innovative people, technology, and partners. We genuinely partners with our clients and industry to deliver a new digital transformation and IT service delivery experience.  We're all about Smart People, Smart Processes and Smart Technology  We are enablers. What’s ours is yours, so check us out online at - https://xamplify.com.au/  OUR ROLE  As a member of our Consulting Team we are seeking a Program Quality & Assurance Manager/Senior Consultant to join one of our key Program Management Office (PMO) projects and support the delivery of a large-scale transformation program. Upon commencement you will join our multi-disciplinary team and support in providing this program with key quality management, governance, reporting, and risk and issues management actions.  In this role you will:  Engage with our client and other key program stakeholders to oversee all assurance activities, providing advice and strategic direction Manage the programs Quality Management Plan Undertake assurance action status reporting Deliver collaborative workshops and multi-team meetings Organise and coordinate gateway reviews and actions plans Drive lessons learnt sessions and develop associated reports Facilitate and enable independent assurance bodies and associated action Partner with the Program Risk Manager to ensure an integrated program assurance framework is implemented Work cohesively within our PMO team and the broader multi-agency program team to delivery key actions in both a waterfall and agile manner  KEY ELIGIBILITY  As you will be working to a Federal Government client, we are seeking Australian Citizens who have an active NV1 or higher security clearance. Please note this role will also require the successful candidate to undergo and pass OSA assessment prior to commencement of this role.  LOCATION  This role operates predominately on client site which is located in Canberra, ACT, therefore we are seeking candidates based in this location .  YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE  Previous experience in a Quality, Assurance or Project Manager role, in a dynamic, fast-paced environment Experience working within a large multi-team complex Tier 1 IT Program will be highly regarded Demonstrated experience undertaking assurance activities including program gate reviews, lessons learnt, producing key program reports, engaging with independent assurance bodies and working with stakeholders to drive effective remediation activities and closure of assurance recommendations Excellent communication skills – including written, verbal and presentation as you will be developing executive briefs and reports, presenting at governance forums and executive meetings Experience using JIRA and Confluence is desirable, but not essential Demonstrated stakeholder and client engagements skills, with the ability to deal with various stakeholders and translate their needs into a complete solution A high level of organisation, time management with the ability to adapt and respond promptly to changing and competing priorities at short notice Strong analytical problem-solving capabilities, with the ability to think laterally and propose solutions Excellent client relationship building and management skills Self-starting, with the ability to drive your own actions, whilst also working as part of a team  GETTING AMP’D  Getting AMP’d is our people commitment to you! We strive to create a work environment that allows our team to play to their strengths, inspires great performance and supports your wellbeing. We’ve recently been certified as a Great Place to Work so we take this commitment pretty seriously! As part of this commitment, you will have access to:  Flexible working options that suit you, because we recognise the importance of putting you and your family first! When you visit our Canberra office, it features free parking, close proximity to public transport and unlimited Nespresso coffee, tea, snacks and fruit! Regular online events and social functions to ensure you stay connected and up-to-date on all things xAmplify Professional growth and development opportunities provided by our top technology partners Access to a diverse range of benefits, retail discounts and rewards via our digital partner Employment Hero Workplace banking program Parental leave program A health and wellbeing program and app, providing you access our 24/7 employee assistance program  Intrigued or want to know more? Click APPLY NOW or connect with us via recruitment@xamplify.com.au  xAmplify is an advocate for diversity and inclusion, and welcomes applications from all irrespective of their gender, LGBTQI identity, ethnicity, religion, physical ability or age.

column3: Join our Strategy Implementation Team (SIT) based in East Melbourne as a Data Analyst (Power BI Visualisation).
column13: At Melbourne Archdiocese Catholic Schools Ltd (MACS) we envision every student to be inspired and enabled to flourish and enrich the world. MACS is the largest Catholic school system in Australia. We own, govern and operate approximately 300 Catholic schools, employ over 16,000 staff and serve more than 112,000 students and their families in the Archdiocese of Melbourne. It is an exciting time to join MACS, where we are transforming to bring to life our recently launched strategic plan: MACS 2030: forming lives to enrich the world.   WHY WORK FOR US?  Professional development opportunities with a defined personalised annual budget Access to flexible working arrangements, which include working from home arrangements You will work in a tight-knit, supportive team to ensure you succeed in your role    Our Strategy Implementation Team (SIT) are responsible for the delivery of programs, projects and actions that underpin the MACS 2030: Forming Lives to Enrich the World strategic plan. Under the guidance of the Executive Director, our SIT shape the organisation to translate strategic priorities into tangible outcomes and plays a significant role in ensuring all members of the MACS community are committed to the Purpose and Vision of Catholic education, and that ‘Every student is inspired and enabled to flourish and enrich the world’.  You’ll lead the collection, analysis and reporting of data on school, system and performance, and in support of strategic research and projects.     WHAT YOU WILL DO  Collect relevant data from across MACS to inform school, system, and MACS performance, and ensure data sets are reliable and robust to deliver high quality analysis and advice. Create and implement data models using tools like Power BI, SQL or similar, to support the enhancement of reporting. Generate reports, briefings, and other materials to effectively communicate insights and recommendations to the SIT team. Utilise highly developed written and oral communication skills to explain complex data analysis and findings to various audiences through presentations, briefings, research reports, and other communication methods. Leverage strong interpersonal skills to partner and collaborate with internal stakeholders, promoting best practices in data collection and usage, encouraging data-sharing, and ensuring shared ownership of data analysis, performance assessments, and research findings.    ABOUT YOU  Tertiary qualification in data analytics, statistics, or related field. Extensive experience with using MS Power BI for data visualisation and analytics to enable informed decision making. High level of understanding of the Power query engine and the ability to write DAX code, Power Query M formula language. Comprehensive understanding of Microsoft Azure and SQL Server databases Extensive experience using SQL queries and highly advanced skills in Excel, Power BI, Microsoft Office suite, and survey platform. Extensive experience in initiating and delivering high-quality data analysis and reports, focused on the needs of stakeholders and the strategic priorities of an organisation.  HOW TO APPLY  Please refer to the position description for further details about the role and the Key Selection Criteria.  Click APPLY to submit your application. If you have any queries about this role, they can be directed to our HR team by email recruitment@macs.vic.edu.au     Note: MACS is committed to the safety, wellbeing and protection of all children in our care. The successful candidate must hold or acquire, and maintain a Victorian Institute of Teaching (VIT) and/or Working with Children Check, and must be willing to obtain and maintain a National Criminal History Check.  Candidates must hold full Australian Working Rights, and provide evidence of this.     APPLICATIONS CLOSE: 4.00pm Friday, 16 August 2024

column3: Great opportunity for a tertiary qualified Data Analyst with a few years experience to grow their career in the Renewables industry!
column13: Location: Melbourne/Morwell Job Type: Permanent Organisation: SEC  Become part of the solution to climate change, accelerating Victoria’s renewable energy transition. Join a ‘for purpose’ government-owned energy company that empowers its people to make a difference. Opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst to assist with Victoria’s transition to renewable energy. Do work that makes a difference     More action is needed to reduce emissions and manage climate change. At the SEC, we are building an enterprising and dynamic team to accelerate Victoria’s transition to renewables and help achieve Victoria’s renewable energy target of 95% by 2035.     We are working together for renewable, affordable reliable energy for all Victorians.    Your role  As a Data Analyst at the SEC, you will play a critical role in data collection, validation, and analysis to support energy market modelling and analytics activities. You will be responsible for developing the tools to handle and process the large streams of historical, live and forecast data that underpin decision-making for the SEC’s market-facing functions, including wholesale market participation and energy retailing.    This role can be based in either our Melbourne CBD office or our regional office located in Morwell.    What you will do:  Data collation and validation – Collect, validate, monitor and maintain high levels of data quality from various sources, including the AEMO Market Management System and the SEC’s Enterprise Trading and Risk Management system. Data management and governance – Work to continuously improve the fitness and management of data streams for post-processing into meaningful outputs, analysis and insights. Data visualisation – Develop scripts, tools and dashboards for processing market data (historical, live and forecast) into easily digestible visuals, reports and summaries for use by the wider business. Forecast model development – Support the development of correlated forecasts of market price, generation and load across short- and long-term horizons, and conduct analysis and interpretations of variances and trends, to inform SEC’s operations as a retailer and as a market participant. Who you are:  Must Have: Your capabilities and areas of expertise that matter most for this role are:  Tertiary qualifications (honours or advanced desirable) in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics and/or other relevant specialisation. 2+ years’ experience in data science or data analysis, specifically around handling and processing large datasets (up to 30 years of data down to 5-minute resolution). Advanced proficiency in programming languages to support data processing and workflow development, with preferences for Python, R and/or SQL. Proficiency in use of data visualisation tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau) to build dashboards. Strong analytical, problem-solving and critical-thinking skills, with the ability to collaboratively interpret data and modelling outputs and produce and distribute meaningful insights across the organisation. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with an ability to explain complex technical details to non-technical stakeholders. Aligned to the SEC ways of working and cultural behaviours, with an unwavering customer focus, striving for continuous improvement, and demonstrating a proactive can-do, attitude in what is a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Highly Desirable:  Working knowledge of principles governing the operation of the National Electricity Market in Australia, including wholesale market operations, market data availability and the key influences on the energy transition; An appreciation of Victorian Government policy targets, initiatives, and goals. Our empowered workforce  A career with us means you’ll be joining a new and vibrant ‘for purpose’ government-owned renewable energy company that:    Empowers you to influence how we accelerate Victoria’s renewable energy transition and decarbonise our economy. Inspires you through meaningful, challenging work in an environment that encourages leadership and an entrepreneurial spirit. Supports your growth through career advancement and professional development opportunities. Provides hybrid work arrangements, with around 3 days working in Melbourne or Morwell, with flexible work options to meet individual circumstances, providing greater choice and autonomy.    About us   We have an exciting and ambitious road ahead with a focus on:    Investing in renewable energy and storage projects that accelerate the transition and deliver commercial returns. Supporting households to go all electric to reduce their emissions and energy bills. Building the renewable energy workforce our energy transition requires. We’re partnering with industry to transform the energy sector, opening the state up for further innovation and investments in renewables. This includes an initial $1 billion towards delivering 4.5 gigawatts of power through renewable energy and storage projects – the equivalent replacement capacity of coal-fired power station Loy Yang A, which is set to close in 2035.        We will also play an important role in helping Victorian households to reduce their energy bills and emissions by offering simple and effective solutions to help them switch to electric.    The energy transformation will create thousands of jobs. The SEC will play a role in attracting and training our future renewable energy workforce, including through the SEC Centre of Training Excellence.    How to Apply We strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. We are also deeply committed to building an inclusive workplace that embraces diversity and people with disability, people from the LGBTIQ community, and people from culturally diverse backgrounds. We strive to create a respectful and collaborative workplace culture that allows all employees to thrive. Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job, but we recognise that there’s no such thing as a ‘perfect’ candidate. At the SEC we offer more than a job. We provide a platform for growth, encouraging you to bring your whole self to your role. However you identify and whatever your background, please apply if this is a role that excites you. For further information and to explore this opportunity further please contact sec.careers@secvictoria.com.au Please click the ‘Apply Now’ button. As part of the application process, you will need to provide a copy of your resume and/ or a cover letter (optional) addressing how your skills, knowledge and experience will be relevant to this role. Applications close on Friday 16th August 2024.    Other things to know  Applicants must be an Australian citizen, permanent resident or hold a valid work permit to be eligible to apply. To receive this information in an accessible format (such as large print or audio) or if you require any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, please reach out to sec.careers@secvictoria.com.au The SEC affirms that the collection and handling of applications and personal information will be consistent with the requirements of the Privacy and Data Protection Act 2014.

column3: D365 Functional Consultants Position: D365 Functional Consultants Location: Prefer Adelaide (Open to other locations too) Type: Full-time
column13: D365 Functional Consultants  Position: D365 Functional Consultants Location: Prefer Adelaide (Open to other locations too) Type: Full-time    Benefits:  Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses. Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible working hours and remote work options. Collaborative and inclusive work environment. Opportunities for career growth and advancement.  About the Role  Join a leading organization known for innovative solutions and excellence! We are expanding our team with talented D365 Functional Consultants. Whether your expertise is in Finance, System Administration, Retail & Commerce, Supply Chain Management, or Integrations, we have a role for you.  Ideal candidates will have a strong background in implementing, configuring, and optimizing D365 solutions, and a passion for driving business success through technology. Configure and customize financial modules to meet client needs. Manage system administration tasks and ensure smooth system operations. Provide technical support and troubleshooting. Optimize supply chain operations and product management strategies. Analyze and document business requirements for supply chain and product management. D365 Finance & Operations - Integrations Consultant: Skill in integrating D365 with other systems and applications to streamline operations. Design and implement integration solutions. Troubleshoot and resolve integration issues.  Key Responsibilities:  Understand client business needs and requirements. Configure and customize D365 Finance & Operations modules. Perform system testing, troubleshooting, and issue resolution. Support post-implementation activities and user support. Stay updated with the latest D365 features and industry trends.  Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field. Proven experience as a D365 Functional Consultant in one or more of the key areas listed. Experience in configuring and customizing D365 Finance & Operations. Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex issues. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with clients and team members. Certification in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations is a plus. Ability to travel as required for client engagements.  Reach out to us for a confidential chat and learn more about this exciting opportunity!  📞 Contact: +61 280283130; +61 261 450 151   📧 Email: Parul.Verma2@Akkodisgroup.com; shivali.badlia@akkodisgroup.com  Privacy  Due to new privacy laws regarding the collection and handling of personal information, all applications must be submitted online. Once you click on the "apply for this job" button below you will be directed to our Online Centre where you will have the opportunity to read and agree to our Privacy and Consent statements and it will allow your details to be formally lodged and processed correctly. column3: This role involves maintaining application stability, performance, and availability, as well as leading a team to quickly address and resolve issues.
column13: Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world’s leading businesses, governments and other organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance citizen services—creating tangible value at speed and scale. We are a talent and innovation led company with 738,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries. Technology is at the core of change today, and we are one of the world’s leaders in helping drive that change, with strong ecosystem relationships. We combine our strength in technology with unmatched industry experience, functional expertise and global delivery capability. We are uniquely able to deliver tangible outcomes because of our broad range of services, solutions and assets across Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, Industry X and Accenture Song. These capabilities, together with our culture of shared success and commitment to creating 360° value, enable us to help our clients succeed and build trusted, lasting relationships. We measure our success by the 360° value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.    The Application Maintenance Lead will be responsible for overseeing the maintenance and support of critical applications. This role includes ensuring application stability, performance, and availability, while also leading a team of skilled professionals to troubleshoot and resolve issues promptly. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in application support within the telecom sector, strong leadership skills, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.     Key Responsibilities:  Team Leadership & Management: Lead, mentor, and manage a team of application maintenance engineers. Foster a collaborative and high-performance team environment. Conduct regular performance reviews and provide constructive feedback. Application Maintenance & Support: Oversee the maintenance and support of telecom applications, ensuring high availability and reliability. Manage incident response, problem resolution, and change management processes. Develop and enforce best practices for application monitoring, maintenance, and support. Operational Excellence: Implement and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure application performance and stability. Continuously improve support processes and procedures to enhance service delivery. Collaborate with other IT teams and stakeholders to ensure seamless integration and performance of applications. Technical Expertise: Provide technical leadership and guidance to the team on complex issues and projects. Stay updated with the latest technologies and industry trends in telecommunications. Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements. Customer Focus: Act as the primary point of contact for application-related issues and escalations. Develop strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders to understand their needs and ensure satisfactory service delivery. Provide regular updates and reports to stakeholders on application performance and issues.     Qualifications:  Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Telecommunications, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred. Experience: Minimum of 7-10 years of experience in application maintenance and support within the telecommunications industry. Proven experience in a leadership or management role. Strong technical background with expertise in telecom applications and systems. Skills: Excellent leadership and team management skills. Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities. Proficient in application monitoring tools and techniques. Knowledge of ITIL or similar service management frameworks. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Certifications: Relevant certifications such as ITIL, PMP, or specific telecom certifications are a plus.     Key Competencies:  Leadership: Ability to inspire and lead a team towards achieving common goals. Technical Proficiency: Deep understanding of telecom applications and their maintenance requirements. Problem-Solving: Aptitude for diagnosing and resolving complex technical issues. Communication: Strong ability to communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders. Customer Orientation: Commitment to delivering high-quality service and support to clients and stakeholders.     Benefits of working at Accenture:  Holistic well-being program including health insurance Life & Salary Continuance Insurance 18 weeks paid parental leave Long & short-term career break opportunities Structured career development program Local and international career opportunities. Certified as a Family Inclusive Workplace™ Flexible Work Arrangements - centered around Accenture’s Truly Human ethos and our commitment to supporting the health and wellbeing of our people. column1: Senior Audio Visual and Security Technician
column3: Join a company that truly supports their staff to establish longevity with a rewarding career.
column13: CAV Audio Visual & Security is a well-established family company located in Morningside QLD, that has been providing AV & Security solutions by specialising in the design, sales and back up service of AV and security requirements to our clients throughout NSW & QLD for over 39 years.  We are currently looking for a full-time, AV & Security Technician to join our team.  Tasks/Responsibilities:  Installation, commissioning & service of TV Systems, CCVE Systems, PA, Visual Display, Sound, Stage & Lighting, Alarm & Access Control. Maintain a high level of customer service and documentation. Able to take direction as required and work within a team. Communicate effectively and professionally with both co workers and clients alike.  CAV's focus is on continual improvement of delivery process and customer experience.  We are looking for a suitably qualified individual who shares this motivation.  This role will be based in QLD with a large portion of the install work to be delivered onsite.  The Successful Applicant will have:  Current QLD drivers licence Proven experience in installing/commissioning audio visual systems Excellent communication and interpersonal skills High attention to detail and strong problem solving skills Be a team player Be an Australian Resident  If you are looking for a career and not just a job, then this is a great opportunity to join a dynamic company and build a solid career in a friendly team environment.  Please email your cover letter and resume to employment@cav.com.au

column3: Smart Industry is where digital and engineering converge into a connected world - reshaping entire industries and providing solutions for Dynamic 365
column13: D365 Test Analyst  Position: D365 Test Analyst Location: Prefer Adelaide (Open to other states) Type: Full-time   Join our innovative and fast-growing company, a leader in providing business technology solutions. We are dedicated to helping our clients achieve their goals through cutting-edge technology and exceptional expertise. If you are passionate about quality assurance and driving business success through technology, we want to hear from you!  Benefits:  Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses. Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible working hours and remote work options. Collaborative and inclusive work environment. Opportunities for career growth  The role:  We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced D365 Test Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in testing D365 solutions, ensuring the highest quality standards. You will work closely with our development and implementation teams to understand business requirements, develop test plans, and execute tests to ensure seamless deployment of D365 solutions.  Key Responsibilities:  Analyze business requirements and develop comprehensive test plans for D365 solutions. Execute test cases, document results, and track defects to ensure the quality of D365 implementations. Perform functional, integration, regression, and user acceptance testing (UAT) for D365 modules. Collaborate with developers, functional consultants, and project managers to understand system functionality and resolve issues. Develop and maintain automated test scripts for continuous testing. Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices in quality assurance. Provide regular status updates and reports on testing activities and outcomes. Participate in test planning, design, and review meetings. Stay updated with the latest D365 features and industry trends.  Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field. Proven experience as a Test Analyst with expertise in D365 solutions. Strong understanding of D365 Finance & Operations and related modules. Proficiency in developing and executing test plans, test cases, and automated test scripts. Experience with testing tools and frameworks (e.g., Selenium, TestComplete, Microsoft Test Manager). Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality results. Certification in Microsoft Dynamics 365 is a plus.   📞 Contact: +61 28028 3141  📧 Email: preetika.arora@akkodisgroup.com  Privacy  Due to new privacy laws regarding the collection and handling of personal information, all applications must be submitted online. Once you click on the "apply for this job" button below you will be directed to our Online Centre where you will have the opportunity to read and agree to our Privacy and Consent statements and it will allow your details to be formally lodged and processed correctly.   "Akkodis is an Equal Opportunity employer, committed to all forms of workforce inclusion. We actively invite and encourage applications by candidates from diverse backgrounds"

column3: xAmplify is on the search for a dynamic and experienced Program Quality and Assurance Manager to join our PMO team and one of our large scale projects
column13: ENABLING A SMARTER FUTURE  xAmplify is Australia's leading Integrator of Artificial Intelligence and Automation services. We understand and enable the journey to an automated and technology enabled future backed by the world’s largest and most innovative AI and technology companies.  We don’t pretend to do everything, so we specialise in delivering technology, digital, and business transformation through the aggregation and integration of the world’s most innovative people, technology, and partners. We genuinely partners with our clients and industry to deliver a new digital transformation and IT service delivery experience.  We're all about Smart People, Smart Processes and Smart Technology  We are enablers. What’s ours is yours, so check us out online at - https://xamplify.com.au/  OUR ROLE  As a member of our Consulting Team we are seeking a Program Quality & Assurance Manager/Senior Consultant to join one of our key Program Management Office (PMO) projects and support the delivery of a large-scale transformation program. Upon commencement you will join our multi-disciplinary team and support in providing this program with key quality management, governance, reporting, and risk and issues management actions.  In this role you will:  Engage with our client and other key program stakeholders to oversee all assurance activities, providing advice and strategic direction Manage the programs Quality Management Plan Undertake assurance action status reporting Deliver collaborative workshops and multi-team meetings Organise and coordinate gateway reviews and actions plans Drive lessons learnt sessions and develop associated reports Facilitate and enable independent assurance bodies and associated action Partner with the Program Risk Manager to ensure an integrated program assurance framework is implemented Work cohesively within our PMO team and the broader multi-agency program team to delivery key actions in both a waterfall and agile manner  KEY ELIGIBILITY  As you will be working to a Federal Government client, we are seeking Australian Citizens who have an active NV1 or higher security clearance. Please note this role will also require the successful candidate to undergo and pass OSA assessment prior to commencement of this role.  LOCATION  This role operates predominately on client site which is located in Canberra, ACT, therefore we are seeking candidates based in this location .  YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE  Previous experience in a Quality, Assurance or Project Manager role, in a dynamic, fast-paced environment Experience working within a large multi-team complex Tier 1 IT Program will be highly regarded Demonstrated experience undertaking assurance activities including program gate reviews, lessons learnt, producing key program reports, engaging with independent assurance bodies and working with stakeholders to drive effective remediation activities and closure of assurance recommendations Excellent communication skills – including written, verbal and presentation as you will be developing executive briefs and reports, presenting at governance forums and executive meetings Experience using JIRA and Confluence is desirable, but not essential Demonstrated stakeholder and client engagements skills, with the ability to deal with various stakeholders and translate their needs into a complete solution A high level of organisation, time management with the ability to adapt and respond promptly to changing and competing priorities at short notice Strong analytical problem-solving capabilities, with the ability to think laterally and propose solutions Excellent client relationship building and management skills Self-starting, with the ability to drive your own actions, whilst also working as part of a team  GETTING AMP’D  Getting AMP’d is our people commitment to you! We strive to create a work environment that allows our team to play to their strengths, inspires great performance and supports your wellbeing. We’ve recently been certified as a Great Place to Work so we take this commitment pretty seriously! As part of this commitment, you will have access to:  Flexible working options that suit you, because we recognise the importance of putting you and your family first! When you visit our Canberra office, it features free parking, close proximity to public transport and unlimited Nespresso coffee, tea, snacks and fruit! Regular online events and social functions to ensure you stay connected and up-to-date on all things xAmplify Professional growth and development opportunities provided by our top technology partners Access to a diverse range of benefits, retail discounts and rewards via our digital partner Employment Hero Workplace banking program Parental leave program A health and wellbeing program and app, providing you access our 24/7 employee assistance program  Intrigued or want to know more? Click APPLY NOW or connect with us via recruitment@xamplify.com.au  xAmplify is an advocate for diversity and inclusion, and welcomes applications from all irrespective of their gender, LGBTQI identity, ethnicity, religion, physical ability or age.

column3: Join one of Australia's most certified consultancies as a Test Analyst!
column13: Have you ever considered a challenging, exciting and progressive career working for one of the most certified tech consultancies in Australia?    Who We Are  Akkodis, we thrive on solving complex problems and building a smarter future; we power digital transformation and accelerate innovation with our cross-industry technology and digital engineering consulting, talent services and skilling. We're passionate about our work and committed to creating and implementing cutting-edge solutions that drive industry progress. Our culture is built on honesty, respect, fairness and inclusion, and we're looking for innovative and talented individuals who share these values to join us on this journey.    The Role  Ensuring stability, availability and reliability of production platforms and applications through the planning and execution of functionally based user testing.    Responsibilities   Delivering quality application change across various platforms through analysis, planning, creation and execution of User Acceptance Test designs, cases and procedures. Liaising with business users, business analysts and developers to ensure that planned testing meets their requirements. Acquiring and analysing all relevant documents for assigned projects to determine testing requirements. Consulting on testing matters to business and IT project managers. Executing Test cases for all assigned projects/enhancements. Raising any defects found during test and escalating in accordance with set procedures. Tracking progress of allocated test designs and test cases to ensure testing deadlines will be met.    Certifications   ISTQB certification highly desirable    Talented, committed, can-do individuals have always been the cornerstone of our dynamic organisation. If you have what it takes to thrive in this role and want to know more, please reach out to Shivani at shivani.singh@akkodisgroup.com    Why Work for Us?  Joining Akkodis means being part of a dynamic community of engineers that's at the forefront of tech innovation. You'll have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies:  Whether your interests lie in systems engineering, software development, data platforms or any other tech discipline, we have a role that will suit you. You'll get to collaborate with talented expert colleagues from around the world who share your enthusiasm and passion for technology. We offer a  flexible and supportive work environment, and we're committed to helping you grow and achieve your career goals. If you want to make a real difference, Akkodis is the place for you.    Akkodis is a commercial brand under which both AKKA and Modis entities operate.    "Akkodis is an Equal Opportunity employer, committed to all forms of workforce inclusion. We actively invite and encourage applications by candidates from diverse backgrounds".

This Business Analyst is leveraging past business analysis experiences to recognise and support stakeholder change journey required. This Business Analyst role is seeking to develop within an organisation providing consultancy services and build their breadth and/or specialisms within industry domains, types of delivery assignments, or techniques and methods used.    Responsibilities   Undertake business analysis as part of a project delivery team or individual consulting assignment across range of industry and clients. Investigate business situations where there is some complexity and ambiguity. Adopt holistic view to identify and analyse problems and opportunities. Engage and collaborate with stakeholders. Conduct analysis and identifies recommendations for improvements. Follow agreed standards, applying appropriate techniques to elicit and document requirements to appropriate level. Demonstrate good stakeholder management skills and provides constructive challenge to stakeholders as required. Demonstrate business analysis competencies and Agile mindset. Help develop and enhance customer and stakeholder relationships. column3: Optimise user experience of SuccessFactors while helping to save lives in this exciting opportunity at Lifeblood
column13: Company description:    At Lifeblood, our purpose is simple: to give life.    Job description:   Champion and elevate employee experience as a SuccessFactors Product Owner Permanent Full-Time opportunity Based out of our Melbourne Processing Centre + offering very generous work from home benefits  Discover life-giving possibilities Lifeblood is more than just a job or a career, it's an opportunity to be part of something that matters. As an organisation, our purpose is simple: to give life. Together, we want to help you build a fulfilling career with Lifeblood.  About the role As a Product Owner (SuccessFactors) you will join the Employee Experience Agile Release Train (EXART) and be responsible for maximizing the value of the product (SuccessFactors) and ensuring that the product meets the user's needs whilst always representing the People and Culture brand.  You will be responsible for defining stories and prioritising the Agile Team Backlog to streamline the execution of program priorities.  Working in collaboration with our stakeholders across ICT, People and Culture, the business and the vendor the PO ensures that the SuccessFactors system is maximized to provide a superior employee and manager experience. This adaptive role will also work closely and collaboratively with the Product Manager and Release Train Engineer.  Sound interesting? Here's what we are looking for;  3+ Years of experience in product management or similar roles with an Agile delivery model in large to medium size organisations, preferably with SAP Successfactors A demonstrated understanding of SAFe Agile methodology. Exposure to and experience applying human centred design approaches to product delivery Proven ability to streamline the execution of program priorities while maintaining the conceptual and technical integrity of the product Demonstrated ability to problem solve and work collaboratively and with agility in high demand and high pressure situations Demonstrated ability to guide the rapid resolution of technical incidents to conclusion and the ability to uplift, manage and identify critical improvements to the user service experience Deep expertise in the product domain combined with broad capability and a proven ability to innovate and adapt to the latest developments  This is a permanent full-time opportunity and ideally would like the role to be based in Victoria however will also consider candidates from interstate. We are offering a fully flexible hybrid work model.  Thrive in a diverse culture that cares for your wellbeing We're a diverse and inclusive bunch. We're proud to foster an environment where all people can come together to achieve their very best. Whether it's workplace safety or work/life balance, we look after our employees' varying needs. As part of the Lifeblood team, you'll have access to a generous salary packaging program, plus a great range of rewards like discounts on insurance, groceries, food & beverage, department stores, travel, and more.  Excited about this opportunity? Apply now and discover a career filled with life-giving possibilities.  Next steps When it comes to recruitment we like to move fast, this means we progress suitable candidates through the hiring process as soon as we can.  We are a 2024 Circle Back Initiative Employer and commit to respond to every applicant. You'll hear from us with an outcome after your application has been reviewed and assessed.  If selected, you'll be required to complete a few background checks and we'll help you through this process.  If you require any adjustments during the recruitment process, please reach out to us.  For further details on this position, please contact Svet on ssubotic@redcrossblood.org.au

column3: Manages AEMO’s end to end process for connecting and registering generators into the National Electricity Market
column13: AEMO at the Heart of Energy    AEMO is Australia’s independent energy system and market operator and system planner.  AEMO’s purpose is to ensure safe, reliable and affordable energy today, and enable the energy transition for the benefit of all Australians.  Australian governments are now committed to a net zero economy for Australia by 2050 and our vision is to enable this. We have the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to co-design the future of our energy systems, and our core values revolve around character, commitment, and connection. Join us as we contribute to this significant transition in the energy sector.       About the role   The Onboarding and Connections Group manages AEMO’s end to end process for connecting and registering generators into the National Electricity Market. With more than 160 GW of new generation to connect in the next 30 years, you will be instrumental in connecting a range of technologies, including onshore wind, offshore wind, hydro and solar generation; battery and storage systems, and hydrogen plants. As Principal Engineer reporting to the Manager - Commissioning, this role can be based across all states.        What you will be doing   Manage the commissioning process of multiple renewable projects to ensure they full operational capacity. Advocate for regulatory changes to acknowledge and support the integration of large-scale renewable energy projects into the Australian electricity market. Provide expert technical advice and make informed technical decisions, employing constructive and open problem-solving approaches across areas of performance standard assessment, power system stability, system strength remediation, registration and commissioning. Create a unified vision and framework for integrating diverse generation and storage reach technologies.     What you will bring to the role   Extensive experience in commissioning renewable projects A wealth of experience in R2 compliance requirement and R2 model validation Significant experience in Hold point testing/witnessing of various generator systems and plants. Knowledge of the electricity industry, NEM dispatch process, generator behaviour and network constraints. Proven experience in managing the generator commissioning process, with robust skills in assessing and solving generator and power system performance issues.     In return some of our benefits to you   Flexible working: work from home, part time, job share, hybrid options, and additional leave options  Professional development via projects, industry networks, job rotation, study assistance and more.  Give back with up to 4 days of volunteering leave per year.   Reward your hard work with annual performance bonuses (subject to eligibility).  Embrace a healthier you with our wellness program, discounted health insurance, gym perks and our comprehensive Employee Assistance Program (EAP).   About Our Process    AEMO values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace, welcoming applications from all backgrounds without regard to age, disability, gender, sexual orientation, parental status, race, religion and our First Nation peoples. We are dedicated to accommodating applicants' needs during the application or interview process, simply let the us know by emailing us at talent@aemo.com.au   If you would like to know more about working at AEMO, please check out our careers page for more information.

column3: Seeking experienced Splunk engineer for security monitoring, threat detection, and incident response roles.
column13: *Closing Date:  ASAP  face2face reference:  618564  Location:  Remote Working   Hours: Full-time Contract length:  Permanent + Permanent On-going Entry requirements:  Australian Citizen + minimum Baseline preferred Pay range: $140,000.00 to $160,000.00 p/y ex super  Duties  Implement and maintain Splunk solutions for security monitoring, threat detection, and incident response  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement security use cases in Splunk  Develop custom searches, dashboards, and reports in Splunk to provide actionable security insights  Investigate and analyze security events and incidents using Splunk to identify potential threats  Provide expertise in building correlation searches and threat hunting queries in Splunk  Conduct regular health checks of Splunk systems to ensure optimal performance and data accuracy Assist in the integration of security tools and systems with Splunk for comprehensive security visibility  Required experience/skills  5+ years’ experience in installing and configuring Splunk, specifically Splunk Enterprise Security Extensive experience in installing, configuring, and managing Splunk for security and compliance monitoring  In-depth knowledge of security information and event management (SIEM) principles and best practices  Proficiency in developing and maintaining Splunk dashboards, reports, and alerts for security monitoring and incident response  Strong understanding of network security, including firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and virtual private networks Familiarity with scripting languages such as Python, PowerShell, or JavaScript for customizing Splunk functionality  Excellent understanding of log management, data indexing, and data visualization techniques within Splunk   If this sounds like the role for you, and you'd like to learn more, click apply now. f2f Recruitment team will be happy to assist you.  Urvish Kahar    02 6199 5750  TeamICT@f2frecruitment.com.au   Excited about this role but don’t believe your experience perfectly matches all job specifications? Why not examine your transferable skills? If they position you as a strong, quality candidate, it’s well worth applying for the position. Read more on transferable skills: www.f2frecruitment.com.au/transferable-skills-more-important-than-ever  #APS   *Thank you for your interest in this position with face2face Recruitment. Our advertisements automatically stay live for 30 days, even if the position is filled beforehand. Should you find this role closed, not all is lost. If you submit your resume to us as a general expression of interest, we will consider you for other positions that suit your talent and experience. We may well have current positions to fill and will certainly consider you for future suitable roles. Submitting your resume has the added bonus of getting your name in the mix for opportunities we fill without even advertising. All you have to do is send your resume to TeamICT@f2frecruitment.com.au.

column3: Join one of Australia's most certified consultancies as a .NET Developer!
column13: Are you a .NET Developer looking to join an outstanding Consultancy?    About us  At Akkodis, we believe that we must go beyond what is possible to make incredible happen. We pride ourselves on a culture of trust where you have the autonomy to own your decisions and the support you need to achieve your ambitions. When it comes to a career at Akkodis, you are in the driving seat.    We put our people first: To build a community of the sharpest minds, we begin by understanding the potential of our people. Then, through rigorous training, we can help them learn, share, grow and excel by applying their ingenuity. Understanding your ambitions and working with you to achieve them are just the beginning of your Career at Akkodis.    Values: Our focus is on developing a diverse team of people who want to excel. We offer careers that span countless domains, projects and challenges across IT and Engineering. We expect our people to be ambitious. That's why we entrust them with responsibility and encourage every colleague to apply their learnings from one discipline to another, so we can innovate together and unlock new ways of working    The Role  As part of the Development Practice, you will be responsible for developing solutions and undertake critical planning, design and development activities for technical programs. In this role you are expected to provide a holistic view across business, information, application, and technology aspects for the solution to identify and analyse value propositions to deliver the solution within the cost and time constraints of the program in a way that realises the business outcomes and aligns to the organisation's development best practices.    Duties/Typical Day/Responsibilities   Developing and maintaining software using .Net framework and related technologies. Designing UI/UX guidelines and associated documentation. Solving complex problems and implementing innovative solutions with guidance from senior developers. Participating in code reviews to ensure quality and maintainability of the codebase. Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features. Staying up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies. Communicating effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Contributing to the development of project plans, schedules, and budgets.    Front End Requirements   Strong experience with .Net framework and related technologies (C#, ASP.Net, MVC, Web API, Entity Framework, etc.). Strong experience in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Bootstrap and related front-end technologies. Knowledge of modern front-end frameworks such as Blazor WASM. Ability to create responsive and visually appealing user interfaces. Experience with Azure DevOps (Build/Release Pipelines, etc.) Experience in developing and running automated tests for .Net applications and libraries (e.g. NUnit, Mock etc.). Experience with creating and consuming REST APIs. Understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and solutions. Familiarity with version control systems such as Git. Understanding of accessibility and security considerations for web applications. Ability to create and integrate animations, transitions, and other dynamic elements into the user interface. Knowledge of the Azure cloud computing platform. Proven track record of delivering high-quality software projects. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Demonstrated ability to work independently and/or as part of a team. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Familiarity with Agile development methodologies, particularly Scrum. Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or a related field, or relevant work experience.    Back End Requirements   Strong experience with .Net framework and related technologies (C#, ASP.Net, MVC, Web API, Entity Framework, etc.). Strong experience in database design and management (SQL Server). Knowledge of the Azure cloud computing platform including identity services (such as Azure Active Directory, Azure B2C, and Azure AD B2B) Experience with Azure DevOps (Build/Release Pipelines, etc.) Experience in developing and running automated tests for .Net applications and libraries (e.g. NUnit, Mock etc.). Ability to create and maintain scalable and secure REST APIs and experience with microservices architecture. Familiarity with message queuing systems such as IBM MQ. Understanding of caching and performance optimization techniques. Knowledge of security best practices and experience with implementing security measures (e.g. encryption, authentication, authorization). Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker. Ability to monitor and diagnose production issues using log analysis and performance monitoring tools. Proven track record of delivering high-quality software projects. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Demonstrated ability to work independently and/or as part of a team. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.    Talented, committed, can-do individuals have always been the cornerstone of our dynamic organisation. If you have what it takes to thrive in this role and want to know more, please reach out to Shivani at shivani.singh@akkodisgroup.com    Benefits  Akkodis is a forward thinking organisation and this role will provide an opportunity to learn new skills within Azure, Analytics, AWS and other leading technologies.  Akkodis, is a global leader in the engineering and R&D market that is leveraging the power of connected data to accelerate innovation and digital transformation.  With a shared passion for technology and talent, 50,000 engineers and digital experts deliver deep cross-sector expertise in 30 countries across North America, EMEA and APAC. Akkodis offers broad industry experience, and strong know-how in key technology sectors such as mobility, software & technology services, robotics, testing, simulations, data security, AI & data analytics. The combined IT and engineering expertise brings a unique end-to-end solution offering, with four service lines - Consulting, Solutions, Talents and Academy - to support clients in rethinking their product development and business processes, improve productivity, minimize time to market and shape a smarter and more sustainable tomorrow. Akkodis is part of the Adecco Group.  Privacy  Due to new privacy laws regarding the collection and handling of personal information, all applications must be submitted online. Once you click on the "apply for this job" button below you will be directed to our Online Centre where you will have the opportunity to read and agree to our Privacy and Consent statements and it will allow your details to be formally lodged and processed correctly.  "Akkodis is an Equal Opportunity employer, committed to all forms of workforce inclusion. We actively invite and encourage applications by candidates from diverse backgrounds"

Market leading salaries An environment where you'll constantly learn Security and stability in your role  Contribute to a hugely exciting product  You won't be bored, trust me!   This is a fantastic role for someone who is looking to take on a new challenge and take their career to another level, they sit at over 400 in total at the moment and will be continuing to grow.    Please note: Only candidates who possess a permanent residency or citizenship are eligible to apply for the position.    You know what to do – click that apply button or get in touch for more details.    Alex Milligan Team Lead - Software & Mobile Development Just Digital People 0455 858 652 alex@justdigitalpeople.com.au
