column3: Full Time Permanent Role based in Fortitude Valley with 2 Days WFH
column13: About the Position  Anglicare's Information Communications & Technology team is looking for a Full Time Permanent Power BI Developer to model, build and maintain Power BI reports and provide specialist technical advice to other BI team members.   You will be working with business stakeholders to learn their needs and build a range of Power BI dashboards. You will draw on financial and operational data to provide management with simplified and meaningful insight into the organisation.  Responsibilities  Undertake data modelling with members of the Information & BI Team, and other internal and external stakeholders. Ensure report development is visually attractive and easy to interpret, using innovative data visualizations where available. Work collaboratively with business stakeholders to define their requirements. Identifying problems or errors in code that impact business intelligence reporting Technical troubleshooting and problem solving to resolve issues identified Ensure reports are updated in response to changes in associated software or business needs Consultation with organisational stakeholders and software vendors to identify data warehousing and technology improvements Support the implementation of new BI technologies and solutions Provide training and support to ICT team members to transfer knowledge and capability of Power BI and other tools.  About You  Along with tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Information Technology or Finance our ideal candidate will have:  Demonstrated experience in SQL development, data modelling, and data analysis Demonstrated expertise in BI, Data Visualisation and Data Analytics Commercial experience with Power BI A current National Police Certificate (or ability to attain if successful) The following would also be highly regarded:  Previous experience working in health or finance industries Experience in GIT or other versioning software Demonstrated experience with Cloud technologies - specifically Azure, including but not limited to: Data Factory, Data Lake Storage, Dev Ops, Data Bricks Interested?  Click apply and send us your current resume.   For further information please contact Daniel Walsh - Corporate Recruitment Advisor  Email: dwalsh@anglicaresq.org.au   Why Join Anglicare?  Join a respected Not For Profit and make a real impact in your role to assist Queenslanders in need. Great flexibility, work-life balance, flexible hours and hybrid work from home (WFH) model. Salary Packaging - get up to $15,900 of your salary tax free to pay for items such as Rent, Mortgage, Credit Cards, Utilities, School Tuition and more. In addition to your tax-free benefit, you can also use up to $2,650 of your pre-tax income to pay for entertainment expenses (meals, venue hire, holiday accommodation etc.)   Enjoy the potential tax savings of a Novated Car Lease. Employee Discounts at some of Australia's leading retailers. 6% Bupa Health Insurance Discount. Referral App - Earn real $$$ for sharing jobs to your network and potentially earn up to $300 per referred successful starter. Career Opportunities - join a company who aim to promote from within to fill new roles with our internal-only Job Board. Opportunities to purchase additional annual leave. Pastoral Care Support & Employee Assistance Programs. Free annual Flu vaccinations.  Anglicare Southern Queensland is committed to the health and safety of our workforce. Shortlisted Applicants will be asked to complete a Pre-Employment Assessments that requests the sharing of information regarding pre-existing injuries, illnesses or conditions that could reasonably be aggravated by performing the duties of this position.  Anglicare is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce and encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, those from cultural and linguistically diverse backgrounds, LGBTIQ+ communities, people with disabilities and people with a lived experience of mental ill health. We promote a child-safe environment and are committed to providing on-going care and protection.

column3: Join our experienced Platform Engineers team and showcase your AWS and GCP certification, training and experience.
column13: At Optus, we don't sit back and let the future happen to us - we're out there making it. By expanding into new technology and relentlessly improving every day, we're creating a better tomorrow for all Australians.  We believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers.  The primary objective of the Senior Platform Engineer role is to architect, develop, and coordinate the management of a robust, scalable, and efficient platform infrastructure. This role strives to elevate our platform into a sophisticated product that empowers engineering teams to independently access and use platform resources, reducing dependencies and accelerating development cycles. You get a chance to lead collaborative efforts with delivery teams to improve and operate our cloud-based platforms, using AWS Cloud services to enhance the platform's capabilities, ensuring it is secure, reliable, and efficient.  The role requires a passion for automation and optimization, as well as being comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.  The day to day  Own the design and development of a scalable and robust platform infrastructure that meets the diverse needs of engineering teams. Orchestrate the automation of platform management and deployment processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual intervention. Use tools like Terraform or CloudFormation to manage infrastructure through code, ensuring consistency and repeatability. Lead efforts in containerization using Docker and orchestration with Kubernetes to streamline application deployment and management. Implement comprehensive monitoring solutions and optimize platform performance to ensure reliability and optimal performance.  Why you are our next Senior Platform Engineer  Expertise in Scripting and Automation: High proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Shell) for automating platform management and deployment. Infrastructure as Code Proficiency: Deep experience with Terraform or CloudFormation for managing infrastructure through code. Containerization Mastery: Extensive knowledge of containerization technologies (Docker) and orchestration tools (Kubernetes). Monitoring and Performance Tuning: Strong background in implementing and using monitoring tools and techniques to ensure platform reliability and performance. Collaboration and Communication: Excellent ability to collaborate with multi-functional teams and effectively communicate technical concepts. Security Knowledge: In-depth understanding of security standard processes and compliance requirements for cloud platforms.  What's in it for you?  3 days in the office, 2 days remote - with flexible hours to suit! Inclusive paid parental leave, up to 14 weeks for the primary care giver All Optus employees have access to resources, webinars and support via the ‘Parents at Work portal' Own your own growth by accessing an extensive online and facilitator led learning catalogue - even earn a MBA micro-credential via OptusU (University) Connect at work through one of our employee-led volunteer groups: Culture Connect, Elevate Women, Disability Network, Express Yourself (LGBTQIA+), United Veterans and Yarn Network Vibrant campus life, variety of facilities including restaurants, cafes, gymnasium, GP, and post office Two easy travel options to Sydney Campus: Optus bus from Sydney CBD (20min travel time) and Macquarie University Metro Station (every 6-8 minutes); morning and afternoon!  Keen to see what it's really like to work at Optus? Search #OptusLife on LinkedIn to go behind the scenes!  At Optus, we are strengthened by others and that means valuing diversity and saying ‘yes' to embracing individual differences. We are committed to ensuring that our application process provides an equal employment opportunity to all job seekers, including individuals from diverse gender, cultural and linguistic backgrounds, individuals with a disability, individuals identifying as being part of the LGBTQIA+ community, individuals who may have served in the armed forces or who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander. If you require any adjustments or accessibility support to participate fairly and equitably in the recruitment process, please email AccessibleRecruitment@optus.com.au along with your preferred method of contact and we will be in touch.  For more information on Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging at Optus, please visit https://www.optus.com.au/about/inclusion-diversity.

column1: Software Development Engineer in Test | Automation Test Engineer
column3: Software Development Engineer specialising in automation testing needed to implement automation testing in a Brisbane born technology company.
column13: About the Company  This well established, Brisbane born technology firm is a full-service advanced tech solutions provider that develops, deploys and supports an international award-winning platform. Their line of business includes providing tech services and consulting in order to deliver creative solutions.  About the Role  As a motivated Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) this role will see you responsible for creating components, tools and scripts that enable the execution of automated tests locally, as part of an automated CI/CD pipeline, or within a staging environment on Amazon Web Services (AWS). As a member of an agile and multi-disciplinary product team, you will consistently deliver high-quality, reliable and performant applications. You will also participate in a community of practice that collectively aligns and advances techniques, architectures and technologies to keep pace with industry innovations and evolving practices.  Key Responsibilities  Collaborate with the product manager and agile product team to achieve sprint goals, ensuring delivered quality of product functionality, reliability and performance; Develop BDD tests from user stories and acceptance criteria, understanding how applications interface; Write supporting test automation code to validate browser-based user interfaces, microservices, applications and APIs; and Actively engage in contemporary software engineering practices, including coding guidelines, peer code reviews, test automation, knowledge sharing and teamwork. Essential Criteria  Tertiary qualification in Software Engineering, Information Technology, or Computer Science (or equivalent proven experience); Familiar with utilising both on-prem and public cloud infrastructure, such as Amazon Web Services (AWS); At least 3 years of experience working in a software product environment utilising Scrum and DevOps/SRE practices (with an emphasis on automation) to develop, test, deploy and support scalable, highly available software products incrementally; Fluent in expressing user features and associated test scenarios / cases in gherkin syntax within Behaviour-Driven Development (BDD) feature files and code repositories; Proficient in creating software components, tools and scripts to automate tests for cloud-native browser-based user interfaces, microservices, applications and APIs; Proficient in using related languages and technologies such as C# / .NET Core, JavaScript/TypeScript, Playwright, Selenium, Jest and others; Familiar with internet protocols and application interface technologies such as REST, gRPC, JSON, XML and Protobuf; and Competent with source code control, agile workflow and CI / CD pipeline tools. Benefits and Culture  Flexible working arrangements including three days work from home; Annual health and wellbeing allowance + Discounted private health insurance; This growing organisation is able to offer long term career development opportunities and continual learning with their uncapped training budget and education assistance; and Ongoing social events throughout the year. How to Apply  For more information or a confidential discussion please call Jasmine Perkins at u&u on 07 3232 9146 quoting reference number 37128.  At u&u Recruitment Partners, we value diversity, equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disability.  Should you require reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process, we encourage you to make a request via adjustments@uandu.com or phone the above-mentioned u&u consultant to discuss. In response to these requests, we will collaborate closely with you to implement the appropriate adjustments.  Additionally, for a barrier-free and inclusive online experience, you can access u&u’s opportunities using accessibility software Recite Me at https://www.uandu.com/jobs.  Please submit your resume in Word format only.

column13: Technical Lead, D365 / POS Developer  Position: Technical Lead, D365 / POS Developer Location: Prefer Adelaide (Open to all states) Type: Full-time    Join our dynamic and forward-thinking company, a leader in providing innovative business technology solutions. We are committed to helping our clients achieve their goals through cutting-edge technology and exceptional service. If you are passionate about driving business success through technology and are looking for an opportunity to advance your career, we want to hear from you!  Benefits:  Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses. Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible working hours and remote work options. Collaborative and inclusive work environment. Opportunities for career growth and advancement.  The Role :  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Technical Lead, D365 / POS Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in developing, implementing, and optimizing D365 and POS solutions. You will lead a team of developers, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and work closely with our clients to understand their business needs and deliver high-quality technical solutions.  Key Responsibilities:  Lead the development, implementation, and optimization of D365 and POS solutions. Analyze and document business requirements and translate them into technical specifications. Design, develop, and customize D365 and POS applications to meet client needs. Collaborate with functional consultants to ensure alignment between business requirements and technical solutions. Provide technical leadership and guidance to a team of developers. Conduct code reviews, mentor team members, and ensure best practices in software development. Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues. Stay updated with the latest D365 and POS features, updates, and industry trends. Coordinate with clients to ensure successful project delivery and client satisfaction.  Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field. Proven experience as a Technical Lead or Senior Developer in D365 and POS systems. Strong technical skills in X++, C#, .NET, and SQL Server. Experience with D365 Finance & Operations, Retail, and Commerce modules. Solid understanding of business processes and best practices. Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with clients and team members. Certification in Microsoft Dynamics 365 is a plus. Ability to travel as required for client engagements.  Reach out to us for a confidential chat and learn more about this exciting opportunity!  📞 Contact: +61 280283105 📧 Email: rahul.sharma@akkodisgroup.com  Privacy  Due to new privacy laws regarding the collection and handling of personal information, all applications must be submitted online. This is a highly rewarding opportunity for an experienced Helpdesk officer, or a recent Graduate/Trainee looking to kick start their career in the IT field with a reputable employer.    Reporting to our IT Manager based in Adelaide, and joining a team 6, the successful applicant will be responsible for providing IT support to our staff across the country. The successful candidate must have outstanding communication skills and an energetic and engaging personality.  Duties and responsibilities in this role will include:   Serve as the first point of contact for stakeholders seeking technical assistance over the phone or email Perform remote troubleshooting through diagnostic techniques and pertinent questions Determine the best solution based on the issue and details provided by stakeholder Direct unresolved issues to the next level of support personnel Record events and problems and their resolution in logs Follow-up and update customer status and information Creation of user accounts  To join our team, you will bring with you:  Solutions and commitment to work with and support a diverse range of users, from very inexperienced to highly competent across Australia and on various construction sites Lateral thinking and the ability to use your initiative Good problem solving skills with the ability to provide solutions to issues as they arise Effective time management and task prioritisation skills Ability to be an effective and reliable team member working in a cohesive team Recently completed studying or still studying degree in an IT related discipline is advantageous  The perks!   We don’t just talk about our people being our best asset, we actually show it! Working with BADGE means you will work supporting 300 staff in a friendly, casual environment. We are also proud to offer you:  An enjoyable, fast-paced and professional working environment that’s not too formal Modern offices Free onsite car parking  About us:  BADGE is an award-winning commercial construction company with 40 years’ experience delivering quality projects nationwide.  We are Australian-owned, with a turnover of $500m, and employ over 300 high-performing professionals at our offices in Adelaide, Perth, Gold Coast, Maroochydore, Brisbane, Melbourne and Darwin.  To find out more visit www.badge.net.au, email recruitment@badge.net.au or contact us on (08) 8293 5099.    BADGE does not accept unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles from external agencies or suppliers via any method.  If any candidates are submitted in an unsolicited manner, we will consider this as a direct candidate application to BADGE and no fee will be payable.

column3: New Solution Architect Role with a Federal Government Department
column13: Federal Government Role Must have minimum NV1 clearance Attractive rates + full client fee disclosed ACT based role with remote work arrangement options considered  We are currently looking for enthusiastic and experienced individuals for one of our clients in Canberra to join as a Solution Architect.  As a Solution Architect, you will be required to provide design assurance, draft solution design, technical oversight and assurance that implementations conform to designs.  The ideal candidate will be required to have:  Demonstrated experience in successfully assuring the design of third-party solutions, undertaking ICT solution options analysis, and designing sustainable value for money ICT solutions that address business needs and incorporate architecture principles and engineering best practices. Demonstrated ability to work with a high degree of independence and professionalism, including the ability to prioritise and undertake a varied workload and respond positively and flexibly to change. Strong interpersonal skills, including both oral and written communication, in addition to strong stakeholder engagement skills with a demonstrated ability to quickly build trust and effectively manage expectations. This includes cultivating productive working relationships with technical subject matter experts and incorporating their knowledge and expertise. Ability to successfully engage, manage and deliver supporting artefacts in support of architectural and design approval for Federal Government ICT technology solutions. Specialised knowledge and experience in relevant technologies. The following skills and technologies are relevant: • Service oriented architecture and micro-services • Systems integration design • Data modelling • Design assurance – oversighting 3rd party design to ensure it meets requirements and contributes as planned to target business outcomes. • Implementation assurance – oversight implementation to ensure it aligns with design • Business process/workflow optimisation and automation • Case management • Information architecture.     We are looking for a candidate with exceptional communication skills who can lean into complex conversations and offer technical solutions that creates buy-in from stakeholders with varying technical and non-technical backgrounds.  If you are looking for a change and might be interested in applying, please get in touch with Harry at enquiries@vlinked.com.au for more details.  Please ensure that you provide your CV in word format outlining the skills and experience.

column1: Execution Systems Platform Owner / Systems Engineer
column3: Seeking a Automation, Electrical and MES professional to join a world class biopharmaceutical organisation for CAPEX project improvement and rollout.
column13: Company Overview  Proclinical is seeking a Execution Systems Platform Owner / Systems Engineer to join our client, a global Biopharmaceutical leader renowned for its innovation and commitment to delivering medicines to treat health conditions and improve quality of life. At their Broadmeadows site, they manufacture life saving blood plasma derived medicines.  Role Overview  The Execution Systems Department provides automation and control systems expertise at the blood plasma derived therapeutics manufacturing site. As part of significant investment in their pharmaceutical manufacturing facility, there is an extensive project in continuing to improve their automation and manufacturing capabilities. The Execution Systems Platform Owner / Systems Engineer will be responsible for technical installation and setup, account administration, maintenance, reliability, performance and compliance of core system platforms (PCS, MES, PLC, SCADA) and associated interfaces as a platform owner in addition to, the ongoing improvements, upgrades, support and maintenance of the systems including windows server administration, system virtualisation support, Hotfix and patch deployment for locally hosted platforms which include Siemens PCS 7, Siemens, JAG, Schneider and others.  You will be the system owner and system administrator and will work in close partnership with the IT infrastructure team to deliver a seamless, integrated, compliant and holistic framework for control system platform management and administration. You will also drive technical alignment between different GxP control system platforms by ensuring system configuration, access and maintenance standards are aligned including interfaces with historian and business systems (SAP, LIMS, etc).  You will provide life cycle support for automation control systems infrastructure including technical support for projects, operational support and continual improvement initiatives.  Location: Broadmeadows, 3047  Team size: 10 people plus wider project team and many different external and internal stakeholders  Duration: 6-month contract with potential for extension  Capacity: Majority on-site, possibility to WFH 1 day a week after training and will need to be negotiated/ discussed  Role responsibilities  In addition to above  CAPEX project work Working closely with project team and IT colleagues to ensure automation infrastructure is implemented correctly Issues followed up and resolved Installing new applications, fault finding  Required Qualifications & Experience  Proven experience in the design, development, installation, commissioning and/or servicing of information technology and automation process control systems. Strong knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server Administration, Server Virtualisation, Thin Clients, System backup, archiving and recovery, System networking including DNS, SMTP, NTP, vLAN, Network Switches / Routers and Firewalls. Demonstrated capability for maintenance and compliance support of complex and integrated control systems from initial development through operation of the facility. Degree in the discipline of Computer Science; Mechatronics; Computer Systems Engineering or a similar field with a focus on controls, automation or IT. Pharmaceutical experience and a good knowledge of GMP principles is desirable  How to Apply  To apply for this opportunity, please click on the APPLY NOW button NOW!  For further information, please contact Pamela Phoumavong on 02 9054 7411 or email p.phoumavong@proclinical.com.  About Proclinical  Proclinical is a specialist employment agency and recruitment business, providing job opportunities within major pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device companies.  Proclinical Staffing is an equal opportunity employer.

column3: Designing and implementing information structures and navigation systems, including categorisation, labelling, indexing, and information hierarchy.
column13: Lime Recruitment is currently working with a large Queensland government department to recruit an Information Architect contract to 4/11/24 with 12 month extension based at Carseldine and working from home.  In this role you will:  Work across multiple architectural domains including business, information, data, application, integration, technology, security, and operational. Note, this role will be primarily focused on the business, information, data, and security domains. Design and implement information structures and navigation systems, such as categorisation, labelling, indexing, and information hierarchy for the ECM solution. Oversee the creation and management of metadata schemas and taxonomy development for better information retrieval and organisation for the ECM solution. Create clear and comprehensive documentation (for example information models/frameworks) that outlines the information architecture and provides guidance for future updates and development. Develop and execute detailed workplans with regular status and exception reporting. Ensure the overall direction and integrity of architectural products adhere to relevant Queensland Government and architecture strategies, roadmaps, principles, policies, and standards. Champion efforts to improve business performance through enterprise IM solutions and capabilities, such as master data management, metadata management, business intelligence, content management, data integration, and related information management or information infrastructure disciplines and components. Participate and present to Architecture Review Board (ARB) and Design Review Board (DRB) design reviews. Assure architectural artefacts as required.   You will have:  8+ year’s proven experience in providing advice, guidance, assurance, and delivery of information architectural designs for large enterprise solutions. Proficiency with developing greenfield target state information architecture designs including actionable insights and implementation plans to support the target state solution. Experience with information architecture best practices and methods including relevant Queensland Government architecture strategies, roadmaps, principles, target architecture, policies, and standards. Demonstrated communication and presentation capabilities, adept at simplifying complex architectural concepts for audiences without a technical background. Previous experience working on transformation projects related to information management, ECM solutions and/or electronic document and records management. Security architecture experience including cyber/information security. Previous experience working for Transport and Main Roads and/or in a similar regulatory environment.  Queensland based candidates only.  Why apply through Lime Recruitment?  Enjoy two pay runs per week without contractor fees. As a Queensland-owned agency, we offer personalised service and are a Tier 1 supplier to the Queensland Government. Awarded Australia’s top-performing small agency in 2021 and 2022, with a finalist spot in 2023. Partner with Lime for genuine, experienced, friendly recruiters dedicated to securing the best opportunities for you. Apply now or contact Cassandra Manthey on 0432 717 634 or cass@limejobs.com.au to find out more!

column1: Cyber Security Product Owner - Data Security
column3: Computer Systems Officer (CSO) - Level 5 Temporary Full-Time up to June 2026 Sydney Olympic Park About us The NSW Police Force (NSWPF) is one
column13: Computer Systems Officer (CSO) - Level 5 Temporary Full-Time up to June 2026 Sydney Olympic Park  About us  The NSW Police Force (NSWPF) is one of the largest police forces in the western world, with more than 20,000 employees, including more than 4,000 administrative employees who support the sworn officers that provide a range of law and order services 24 hours a day, seven days a week to the socially, geographically and culturally diverse community of NSW.  About the role  Cyber Crime is an ever increasing and evolving global threat to policing, government organisations and our citizens. The digital enablement of modern policing through next generation policing systems, wearable devices such as body worn video, and modern digital concepts about officer and citizen interconnectedness greatly expands the digital threat surface into the front line of policing. The Cyber Security Command has the broad remit to establish and implement the Cyber Security plan for NSW Police. Based out of new premises, we are now seeking experienced individuals to join our rapidly growing team.   As part of the new venture, we are now seeking an experienced Product Owner – Data Security to be responsible for the operational lifecycle for security technologies. This includes maintenance of confidentiality, integrity and availability of data in the ICT environment, especially focussed on encryption and key management technologies for data in transit and at rest, data classification, data labelling and data loss prevention technologies. The role will have 1 direct report.   The successful candidate will have the opportunity:   For training on cutting-edge security platforms. To work with an innovative team. Have the opportunity to express creative ideas; and Work for a great organisation who thrives on positive collaborative culture.   For more information on this role (e.g. essential requirements, key accountabilities and capabilities required for the role), click here to view the role description.  To be successful in this role, you will have:  Strong understanding of Cryptography Technology. Demonstrated and hands-on experience managing Cryptography Hardware and Software. Demonstrated and hands-on experience with Windows and Linux operating system. Demonstrated experience with mass deployment of XDR/EDR agents. Proven Experience with scripting/programming language will be an advantage – Python, PowerShell, Bash. Proven experience in operating and managing SIEM platform(Splunk,Cribl). Hands-on experience on Data Security Technologies(DLP/SASE). Strong experience with vulnerability management and attack surface management. Demonstrated and hands-on experience with Application Allowlisting Technologies; and Proven experience on implementing Security Framework (E8/ACSC ISM/NIST).  What we can offer you  At NSWPF our people have access to a range of benefits that help balance life at work and at home. Some of the benefits available when you join the NSWPF include:  competitive salary; flexible work options; opportunity to purchase leave; annual leave loading; corporate wellbeing programs including seminars and the Fitness Passport; free annual influenza vaccination; and salary packaging options via superannuation contributions or a novated vehicle lease.  How to Apply  This is a readvertised role. Previous applicants will need to reapply.  Applications can only be submitted electronically via the I Work for NSW website.  To be considered for this role, attach a cover letter (2 pages maximum) and an up-to-date resume that clearly details your skills & experience as relevant to this role.  Please do not attach copies of qualifications, certificates or documentation (other than what has been requested) - you can bring these if called for interview.  Please address each of the following Target Questions (600 word limit per question) in the text boxes provided in the online application or attach as a separate document.  Target Question 1:  How would you describe ZeroTrust in protecting data? What are the strategic and structural engineering approach you would apply to achieve ZeroTrust?  Target Question 2:  You have been engaged in a design of a new Web Application at a very early stage. What would be your approach to integrate security into the design so that security gets built into the application across all the data flows and interaction?   Your application must stand on its own merits, and the completeness and relevance of your application will determine if you proceed through to the selection process.  If you require any further information about this opportunity, please contact the hiring manager Nadarajah Bhavan via 0457 607 499.  To be eligible to apply for this role, you must meet one of the following statuses:   an Australian Citizen; a permanent resident of Australia; or a New Zealand citizen.  Prior to commencement, the successful candidate will be required to undergo a rigorous National Police (criminal history) Check and obtain and maintain a Security Clearance as determined by the NSW Police Force.  Our commitment to Diversity  The NSW Police Force is a proud employer of a diverse range of people. We are committed to reflecting the diverse community we serve and creating an inclusive and respectful workplace for all employees. Differences are embraced, contributions are valued, and everyone has a sense of connection and belonging.  We welcome people with diverse skills, experiences, perspectives and backgrounds and encourage applications from Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander peoples, and individuals who may identify as LGBTIQ, with disability, a culturally and linguistically diverse background, and people of all ages.  If you identify as a person with disability and require further information on the role or you require specific arrangements to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the HR Diversity Team by email at PCC-INCLUSION@police.nsw.gov.au.  If you identify as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander and would like assistance with your application, please contact the NSWPF Aboriginal Employment & Engagement team at PCC-AEET@police.nsw.gov.au.  This recruitment may be used to create a Talent Pool for similar future roles (ongoing or temporary) that may arise over the next 18 months.  For more information on applying for roles with the NSW Police Force click here  Thank you for your interest in this role. We look forward to receiving your application.

column3: Our client is a well-established, non-for-profit organization seeking an experienced Network Technician to assist in setting up multiple new sites.
column13: About the Company  u&u are thrilled to be partnering with a well-known and established non-for-profit organisation based in Melbourne's CBD. This organisation is dedicated to making a positive impact and is looking for a skilled Network Technician to join their team on a 6-month contracting basis, with the potential to extend or become permanent. If you're passionate about networking and want to contribute to a meaningful cause, we want to hear from you!  About the Role  In this autonomous role, you will set up networks across seven new sites in Victoria. Travel to locations such as Geelong, Launceston, Hobart, and Mildura is required, with all expenses covered, including a car. Strong experience with Aruba systems, thorough networking knowledge, and the ability to set up networks from scratch, including installing switches, are essential. Your ability to work independently and manage multiple sites is crucial.  Key Responsibilities:  Set up networks from scratch at new sites across Victoria; Install and configure Aruba systems and switches; Ensure reliable and efficient network performance; Travel to various sites, with all expenses paid; and Work autonomously to manage and complete tasks. Skills & Experience:  Proven experience with Aruba networks and a strong understanding of Aruba systems; Deep knowledge of network protocols and services (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, SNMP, etc.); Proficiency with network monitoring and management tools; Experience with Cisco systems and hardware; Expertise in installing and configuring network switches, including VLANs, STP, VTP, and EtherChannel; Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure; Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; and Comprehensive understanding of networking principles and autonomous setup capabilities. About You  You are a dedicated and self-motivated Network Technician with a passion for setting up and managing networks. You thrive in an autonomous role and are comfortable travelling to different locations to complete your work. Your strong technical skills, combined with your ability to work independently, make you an ideal fit for this role.   How to Apply  For more information or a confidential discussion please call Fabian Couturier at u&u on 03 9437 4823 or email Fabian.couturier@uandu.com quoting reference number 37815.  At u&u Recruitment Partners, we value diversity, equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disability. Should you require reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process, we encourage you to make a request via adjustments@uandu.com or phone the above-mentioned u&u consultant to discuss. In response to these requests, we will collaborate closely with you to implement the appropriate adjustments.  Additionally, for a barrier-free and inclusive online experience, you can access u&u’s opportunities using accessibility software Recite Me at https://www.uandu.com/jobs.  Please submit your resume in Word format only.

column3: 6 month temporary contract for a Project Support Officer with AV experience
column13: This challenging and rewarding role will work closely with both internal project managers and external suppliers to ensure that each installation meets requirements and agreed quality standards, and functions as specified on completion of the technology renewal project. This is an initial 6 month temporary contract with high likelihood of extension.   As the AV Project Officer, you will:  Assist in the preparation of technical documentation for upcoming projects based upon the established design briefs and the approved program plan. The documentation provides essential information as part of the Request for Quote provided to AV Suppliers. Review and endorse AV Supplier solution proposals, bills of materials, technical specifications, and layout plans to ensure project deliverables are consistent and to the required quality standard. Provide technical advice to AV Suppliers as the AV systems they have newly installed are commissioned and brought onto the IT Infrastructure. Undertake User Acceptance Testing of newly completed installations on behalf of the Audio Visual team, as required. Assist in the review of established AV designs, including researching alternative technologies that may deliver increased functionality to court users and/or reduce technology costs. Provide continuing market monitoring and analysis ensuring that relevant colleagues are notified of significant technological shifts within the AV spac Undertake investigations and identify solutions to new and emerging technical challenges using subject matter expertise to create recommendations and designs for approval. Ensure correct management and storage of financial and project documentation in accordance with government and local policies. Successfully undertake a range of assigned tasks in an environment of competing priorities, ensuring effective communications are maintained and expectations managed. Develop and maintain strong working relationships with other members of the Branch, external suppliers and vendors, and users. About you:  Work independently, completing workload within established timeframes and adjusting priorities quickly as circumstances dictate. Speak and negotiate effectively with persons of various social, cultural, economic and educational backgrounds. Work as part of a team, collaborating with colleagues to achieve shared goals. Read, comprehend and interpret technical and business documents. Write concise, logical and grammatically correct business documents. Contribute to workplace equity, diversity, respect and inclusion. Perform role in accordance with public service principles of integrity and impartiality, promoting the public good, commitment to the system of government, accountability and transparency While there are no mandatory qualifications for this role, practical experience, such as installation or engineering design, or qualifications in audio visual technology will be highly regarded.   Industry qualifications and/or experience in the following key technologies will also be highly regarded for this position  Cisco video conferencing hardware and software AMX control systems Biamp Digital Signal Processor configuration and design AMX SVSI Networked Video   Intrastate travel and after-hours work will be an occasional requirement of this position. Weekend work may also be required. For more information about this opportunity please click apply or reach out to Max on 0423 220 107 or at mpower@sharpandcarter.com.au

column3: Join RAC and work on some regulatory initiatives with the assistance of your team and leaders.
column13: As a Junior Project Manager you will work with a Leader to assist in managing the end-to-end delivery of operational or regulatory projects that address changes we are required to make.  What will you be doing?  Working with cross-functional teams across RAC to determine solutions and approaches to meet business requirements and objectives, including identifying project dependencies and resolving them. Managing the project schedule, scope, budget, issues, risks, and dependencies; overseeing the development and implementation of project artifacts, and coordinating with leaders to troubleshoot challenges Designing and developing strategies and processes in consultation with stakeholders to support project implementation, and reviewing and responding to relevant regulatory issues Working with the change team to ensure effective change management activities, including business engagement, readiness, go-live activities, communications, training, and transition plans Directing, monitoring, coordinating, and motivating the project team and service providers; managing regular project status reporting for the Steering Committee; and conducting post-implementation reviews and project closure activities      What are we looking for in you?  Qualifications in project management e.g. Prince2, Agile, MSP is highly desirable Tertiary qualification in business or a related discipline Experience in a project environment in an operational/service delivery environment Process-re-engineering and business improvement experience is desirable Experience in waterfall and agile project methodologies is highly desirable  What can we offer you?  Working in an environment that is embracing a continuous improvement culture using experimentation to support learning Gain exposure to an Insurance and financially regulated industry and organisation Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Building digital systems that will shape the future for the RAC and a better WA Gain RAC Staff Benefits including free Roadside Assistance and 25% discount on your Insurances, Social Club and access Fitness Passport for cheaper gym memberships  About RAC As an Equal Opportunity Employer, RAC values inclusivity and promotes a workplace that actively seeks to welcome contributions from all people. RAC is committed to flexibility. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact jason.crooks@rac.com.au. #LI-JC1

column3: Transforming Insurance Insights: Join as a Senior Business Analyst in a Global Financial Services Dynamic Team! Initial 12 month contract
column10: Day Rate Contract | Sydney Central & WFH
column13: Position: Senior Business Analyst - General Insurance  Location: Sydney, Australia (Hybrid - 2 days per week in the office) Duration: 12-Month Initial Contract Salary: $900 pd incl. super  Company: Leading Global Financial Services Organisation  Please note, only candidates with current Insurance exp. and good contract tenure will be contacted due to the volume of applicants.   About the Role: Join our dynamic team at a leading global insurer as a Senior Business Analyst. This is a fantastic opportunity to leverage your expertise and stakeholder management skills to drive process improvements and deliver valuable insights. This 12-month initial contract offers a hybrid work environment, with two days per week in the Sydney office.  Key Responsibilities:  Utilise comprehensive knowledge of the general insurance domain and business funtions, encompassing the end-to-end lifecycle of policies and claims. Work on technical, financial, and pricing models specific to the insurance sector. Pay attention to detail while addressing specific non-functional and functional requirements. Identify and resolve data-related issues that affect actuarial analysis and reporting. Highly skilled in process mapping/user stories  Collaborate closely with IT and business stakeholders to gather, analyse, and document data requirements related to general insurance. Assist in designing and implementing effective data collection and storage solutions. Be able to communicate with senior stakeholders and conduct workshops to senior teams  Work with data engineers to optimise data pipelines for insurance data analysis. Contribute to the development and maintenance of data governance frameworks and policies. Key Requirements:  7+ years exp. as a Business Analyst in the insurance services industry. Strong skills in process mapping and documentation. Must have long contract tenure and currently be working for a large financial organisation  Excellent stakeholder management and communication abilities. Hold PR or Citizenship hip for onboarding purposes  What they offer:  Competitive contract rates. A supportive and collaborative work environment. Opportunities for professional development and growth. Flexible hybrid working arrangement. Contact Information: Sophie Boddington - sophie@ibcrecruitment.com.au or click apply!

column13: 12 month contract initially $1300 per day incl. Superannuation Hybrid work out of Ipswich An urgent need has arisen to engage the services of a Project Director with exceptional project resource and project team management skills. This is a new end-user position. Start ASAP.  The primary role of the Project Director is to provide customer centric delivery, ensuring project outcomes are achieved and enterprise solutions are delivered that are responsive to customer needs.  Key Responsibilities:  Lead a team of project management resources in delivery key projects including all facets of HR, performance, reporting, coaching and mentoring. Ensure project outcomes are achieved and project management capability is maintained by leading, managing and directing multi-disciplinary project teams. Ensure internal and external stakeholders are informed and engaged throughout the project lifecycle by developing and maintaining effective working relationships. Manage projects by overseeing the monitoring and reporting of project related trends and performance against project plans and budgets.  Key Requirements:  PRINCE2 certification. Proven experience in high level leadership, conceptualisation and design of large scale, complex and high-risk projects. Demonstrable project management skills, with the ability to achieve successful project outcomes. Proven ability to lead, manage and mentor multiple multi-disciplinary project team. column3: The Fiona Stanley Hospital ICT team delivers on the vision of a modern technology-focused and integrated hospital for top-quality patient service.
column10: No contractor fees / two pay runs per week
column13: Come join us at Perth's most digitally advanced Hospital, where you can bring your passion for helping people to make a direct and positive impact to your community.  The Serco ICT Digital Team at Fiona Stanley Hospital  We are a dedicated team of over 100 IT professionals delivering comprehensive managed ICT & Digital services to the Fiona Stanley Hospital. We work with clinical and non-clinical stakeholders to plan, design, build, maintain, and support the digital solutions at Western Australia's largest and most digitally enabled public healthcare facility. In short, we take care of the technology so that health workers can focus on taking care of patients.   At Serco, we put people first and value a healthy work-life balance. We offer flexible work arrangements, and we do work that has purpose and meaning. We have a strong culture of reward and recognition and are committed to providing learning and career growth opportunities for our people. We seek and celebrate diversity and encourage applications from all backgrounds and cultures.   About the Role The ICT Security Specialist will design and evaluate the security systems that protect the organisation’s computer systems and data.  Reporting to the Security Team Lead, you will analyse IT specifications and overall security risk, implement appropriate security measures, and play a leadership role in any response to security breaches and incidents. This is a position of trust and responsibility and to support this we will conduct a thorough probity assessment, which includes national police check as an essential selection component for this role.  Serco requires employees in this role to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people. Please consider this requirement when submitting your application.    About You - your ideal skills & experience:  Detailed understanding of firewalls, proxies, SIEM, malicious code detection, and IDS/IPS concepts Experience with computer network and network access controls. Understanding of how identify ICT system vulnerabilities, and how to avoid them. Understanding of patch management with the ability to deploy patches in a timely manner while understanding and minimising business impact. Some experience performing risk assessments and providing recommendations for closing compliance gaps or compensating controls, articulating residual risk, and putting in place risk mitigation plans is desirable. Demonstrated experience in day-to-day operations of a hospital environment or an organisation with a similar focus. column13: IT ERP Project Manager - 12-month fixed-term contract (possible to extend beyond the 12-month period) - $125K base + super   Work for this reputable large organisation where you will get the chance to work within an innovative, transparent, and high performing team environment. This is a 12 month fixed-term contract job opportunity and will suit a IT ERP Project Manager who is seeking to take their role to the next level. Click APPLY Now. Highly flexible working arrangement Work closely with the Program Manager Competitive rate on offer for a mid level candidate  If you would like to know more, please contact Milly Kerei-Keepa on 0476865411 / milly.kerei-keepa@talentinternational.com or hit Apply Now

column3: Join a global company helping businesses achieve net zero. Back end focussed role working with a Javascript Tech Stack.
column13: What’s in it for you? Want to work in a global business where you will help businesses achieve net zero? Join an innovative team where you will take ownership of the back end/ API development using a Javascript Tech Stack.  This is a work from home (fully remote) 6 month contract position where you can work from anywhere within Australia.   What you’ll be doing: In this back end focused role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing APIs using NodeJS and NestJS. You will collaborate with cross functional teams across multiple timezones where you will clear and comprehensive API Specs + Docs (Open API).  You will work closely with a team of 11 local developers and 9 overseas developers and will be involved in planning and design sessions. You will be tasked with developing an API for customer integrations to the platform where you will ensure flexibility, performance, security, and scalability.   Experience required: You will have at least 3 years of experience in a similar development role where you worked with Node and Typescript. You will have solid previous experience in API design and maintenance. You will be a natural problem solver and a strong communicator able to deal with both internal and external stakeholders.  You will ideally be based in Newcastle, but if not, they are able to accommodate for work from home based out of Australia. Ideally, you will also have experience working with NestJS, but if not, we would still love to hear from you.   About the company: You will be joining a company on a mission to provide sustainable transport options with the end goal of reducing carbon emissions. With many well known local and international businesses already using the platform, they are helping organisations move to a net-zero future.   What’s next? This role is being recruited by NewyTechPeople. All applicants will receive a response.  The easiest way to register your interest is to apply using the link. If you’d like to have a chat before applying, please contact Kyle Chapman on 0401 398 797 or kyle@newytechpeople.com.au  #SCR-kyle-chapman

column3: Seeking an experienced Functional Analyst to assist our client with the implementation of a new case management system.
column13: PM-Partners group are a specialist Project Management Consultancy. We have a unique way of running projects and providing training and advice, so our clients get the best results with less cost and risk. Each year we deliver over $3B of projects, train over 10,000 people, and help some of Australia’s leading brands improve their PMOs.     PM-Partners is currently seeking an experienced Functional Analyst to assist our client with the implementation of a new case management system that will better enable access and efficiencies in services provided to our community.     In this role you will be responsible for several business, functional and data analysis activities including:  Business Workshop Material Business Process Flows Business Requirement Definition, Functional Design(s) specification Data and Security classification Requirement Traceability Matrix Document Epics, Features, User Stories in DevOps System Integration Specifications  Location: 3 Days on-site, Melbourne CBD / 2 Days WFH Flexibility  Duration: Initially 6 months with extensions to follow  Daily Rate: $750 including super      To be considered for this position you will have experience and strengths in the following:  5+ years proven experience in delivery as a Senior Business / Functional Analyst Experience in Agile delivery as a Business/ Functional Analyst (certifications preferred) Functional knowledge of PeopleSoft CRM  Experience in analysing, troubleshooting and finding resolutions for reported defects. Experience performing gap analyses of existing systems and software to identify areas of improvement. Experience in undertaking process re-engineering, including capturing business process as-is and to-be states in process flows. Experience in System Testing preparation and execution. Experience in data analysis and advanced Excel and SQL  Experience in System Solution and Integration analytical experience Experience working in both the public and private sectors Experience with negotiating with users, technical staff and product owners to achieve desired outcomes. Strong demonstrated ability to lead workshops and work directly with solution stakeholders Showcasing of system solution and assisting with User Acceptance Testing. Strong skills and experience with documenting business requirements and functional design through user stories, wireframes, screen mockups, etc. Work directly with and between stakeholders and solution development teams for requirements elicitation and refinement. Proven ability to lead the development of functional requirements, specifications, use cases, and business rules etc. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Industry standard BA and Project methodology certifications are highly desired  What we can offer you:  Culture: A fun, fast paced, collaborative delivery environment  People: A group of talented, experienced, and dedicated Consultants to work by your side with a dedicated Relationship Manager  Passion: Ability to band together when under pressure to deliver first class results to clients  Transparency: Open door policy  Professional Development: On the job development and access to certifications in our Training practice  Care and Support: On-going support and advice from experienced PM-Partners Consultants  Knowledge: Access to PM-Partners Delivery and Advisory practices     If you feel you meet our selection criteria and are looking to join a leading Project Management Consultancy, please submit your resume to Steve Brewer at PM-Partners via Seek application (preferable) or email – stevebr@pm-partners.com.au

column3: RAC has multiple regulatory & compliance projects requiring a Project Manager to help lead and shape with support from Leadership.
column10: $133 per hour inclusive of super or plus GST
column13: We are looking for a Project Manager to join us on a 12 month max term contract to support new regulatory changes we need to make as a business.  What will you be doing?  Reviewing and responding to relevant regulatory issues, providing advice and establishing processes when required and determining project resourcing requirements and managing development and implementation of project artefacts on a day to day basis Working with cross functional teams across RAC to determine solutions and an approach to meet business requirements and objectives whilst designing and developing strategies and processes, in consultation with stakeholders, which will support the implementation of the project Controlling and managing the project schedule, scope, budget, issues, risks and dependencies and where project dependencies are identified working with relevant departments to ensure plans can be carried out effectively and dependencies are resolved Proactively identifying risks to the delivery of project outcomes and developing and implementing mitigations required to ensure completion of project within agreed timeframes and budget Developing and managing regular project status reporting and presentations for the project Steering Committee, including recommendations to support effective decision-making by developing and maintaining strict project plans and reporting documentation as necessary to ensure timely communication and successful delivery of the project, including highlight and exception reports  What are we looking for in you?  Ability to effectively lead a project team and manage relationships with stakeholders at all levels in various forums Demonstrated experience in managing projects in an operational/service delivery environment is mandatory Process-re-engineering and business improvement experience is desirable Experience in waterfall and agile project methodologies is highly desirable Qualifications in project management e.g. Prince2, Agile, MSP is highly desirable  What can we offer you?  Working in an environment that is embracing a continuous improvement culture using experimentation to support learning Gain exposure to different business units and regaultory bodies Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Be part of a purpose led organisation that gives back to the WA community Gain RAC Staff Benefits including free Roadside Assistance and 25% discount on your Insurances, Social Club and access Fitness Passport for cheaper gym memberships  About RAC As an Equal Opportunity Employer, RAC values inclusivity and promotes a workplace that actively seeks to welcome contributions from all people. RAC is committed to flexibility. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact jason.crooks@rac.com.au. #LI-JC1

column3: Business Analyst / Data Modernisation / Data Maturity / Data Models / Data Visualisation
column13: About the Role:  We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join an Enterprise Data Group, focusing on enhancing data maturity through comprehensive data analysis, process improvement and systems optimisation. Working closely with and reporting to the Program Manager, this role will see you work on Data Maturity uplift projects, navigating across multiple business groups and technical teams within the Digital division and involves gathering business requirements related to data standards and guidelines, working closely with stakeholders to ensure successful project delivery.  Responsibilities:  Collaborate with key stakeholders and data analysts to gather requirements and convert them into user stories; Identify information sets, source data and applied business logic, then document these requirements; Work with technical data experts and business stakeholders to capture and document new data standards; Develop data visualisation mock-ups and reverse engineer requirements from existing solutions; and Assist project teams using contemporary tools like Jira and Confluence to deliver projects effectively. Skills and Experience:  Proven experience coordinating the delivery of data-driven solutions, focusing on data maturity enhancement across diverse organisations; Experience with regulated entities and an understanding of data management and compliance, including data classification and anonymisation; and Experience working on projects delivering corporate-level recommendations to Board and Executive management teams. Essential Criteria:  Demonstrated experience facilitating the delivery of data-driven solutions with a focus on data maturity uplift; Experience working with regulated entities, understanding data management and compliance requirements; Ability to develop and deliver presentations that clearly articulate issues and proposed solutions in a dynamic environment; Experience in project tools and applications such as JIRA, Confluence and SharePoint; and Understanding of Project Delivery life cycle and Agile methodology. For more information or a confidential discussion please call Jasmine Perkins at u&u on 07 3232 9146 or email jasmine.perkins@uandu.com quoting reference number 37521.  At u&u Recruitment Partners, we value diversity, equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disability.  Should you require reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process, we encourage you to make a request via adjustments@uandu.com or phone the above-mentioned u&u consultant to discuss. column3: Seeking an experienced Senior Project Officer to engage with stakeholders to deliver innovative programs supporting energy efficiency.
column13: This pay rate is inclusive of mandatory 25% casual loading  Our client is seeking an experienced Senior Project Officer to develop and implement programs and initiatives through engaging with stakeholders and delivery partners, building customer relationships, and administering partnership and delivery agreements and deeds.  You and your team will liaise closely with service providers, decision makers and other key project stakeholders to deliver innovative programs supporting energy efficiency, solar and battery uptake and decarbonisation for Queensland businesses and households.  Initial contract until June 2025| ASAP start Established program of work | Energy sector experience desirable Competitive hourly rate | Flexible work environment (up to 2 days p/week WFH)  What you will do...  Conduct high-level research, interpretation, analysis and review of regulatory and policy issues pertaining to program development/delivery activities. Prepare program material including technical reports, regulatory instruments, briefing material, media and communications, presentations, publications and correspondence. Undertake the development and implementation of program monitoring, analysis, evaluation and reporting to substantiate effective and efficient program governance and appropriate outcomes. Identify program risks and issues and develop and implement mitigation measures to effectively manage these and use sound judgement to escalate as appropriate. Communicate clearly, both verbally and in writing, tailoring messages to suit a variety of audiences. Manage relationships with a wide range of stakeholders at all levels to support the design and delivery of programs. This may include delivery partners, government agencies, stakeholder groups and members of the public. Apply critical thinking, problem-solving and analytical skills to complex matters. Plan, prioritise and manage multiple and competing activities within tight timeframes in a busy work environment as part of a team, or individually. Work flexibly and dynamically within a high performing and cohesive team responsible for delivering government energy programs, policy and initiatives. Embrace change and demonstrate a mindset of innovation and continuous improvement practices to ensure the ongoing development and implementation of enhanced administrative practices and processes Promote an effective working culture by capturing and sharing knowledge and supporting common expectations to develop a sense of collaboration among colleagues.  What you will bring…  Experience working in a fast-paced project/program environment. Government experience not necessary, and relevant private sector experience preferred. Prior experience with the energy (or similar) sector desirable, but not essential. Prioritises projects and tasks efficiently, in line with team commitments (Leads strategically) Shares and seeks creative ideas, suggestions and data to inform the delivery of services. High level of skill in operating in a demanding and dynamic work environment and dealing with conflicting priorities to achieve results.  In addition to the above, the client will also consider your ability to…  Gain insight into issues by analysing the available information in a critical manner. Share and seeks creative ideas, suggestions and data to inform the delivery of services. Accept decision making responsibility and demonstrates judgement about when to escalate issues. Communicate in a clear, succinct and deliberate manner, adjusting the message so that it resonates with different stakeholders. Demonstrate careful planning and organisation to achieve results. Promote personal responsibility for the realisation of a healthy workplace through regular communication, feedback and sharing of observations and outcomes. Act as a role model for the team by actively seeking feedback and communicating openly about learnings. Analyse information to proactively identify risks to the team's planning activities.  HOW TO APPLY:  Please submit your resume for consideration via the appropriate link. A cover letter demonstrating your relevant experience may also be reviewed.  Should you wish to discuss, please contact Jemma Walker at Jemma.Walker@hudson.com quoting reference number: 239677. Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

column13: Lime Recruitment is currently working with a large Queensland government department to recruit a Data Engineer contract to 30/12/2024 based in the Brisbane CBD and working from home.  Key responsibilities of this role:  The Data Engineer will help maintain the services and tools that enable delivery of consistent, reliable, fast, secure and compliant services. Approaches to data ingestion, data storage and processing Modelling data lake and data warehouse design Implementing and building data pipelines, data integration, data testing and orchestration Under the guidance of senior engineers, implement ways to improve the efficiency and reliability of data products and services Has a product quality and business agility mindset with a strong collaboration focus that enables continuous delivery of data services  Participate in product/project, teams to implement systems in line with detailed designs.  You will have:  Minimum of six (2) years’ experience in data engineering, data warehousing, data pipelines or BI reporting in a similar technical environment including demonstrable system design experience. Experience with cloud computing architectures and services e.g.: AWS High level experience of structured methods including process, object and data analysis and modelling. High level experience in the design, creation, monitoring and administration of data pipelines and associated standards and processes. Extensive experience with OO programming languages (e.g. Java, Python, R).  Queensland based candidates only.  Why apply through Lime Recruitment?  Enjoy two pay runs per week without contractor fees. As a Queensland-owned agency, we offer personalised service and are a Tier 1 supplier to the Queensland Government. Awarded Australia’s top-performing small agency in 2021 and 2022, with a finalist spot in 2023. column3: Perth CBD - Close to train station - Flexible Work Arrangements - Mining & Renewables - High-Impact Projects - Collaborative & Supportive Team -
column13: Job Title: Senior Project Manager   Location: Perth  About Us: Our client is a leading organisation in renewables industry, dedicated to excellence and innovation. We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Project Manager to join their dynamic team. This role is crucial for the successful execution of high-impact projects within the mining technology, HR/SAP systems etc.   Position Summary: We are looking for a Senior Project Manager with exceptional project and stakeholder management skills to oversee and drive projects. The ideal candidate will possess a strong track record of successfully managing complex projects with significant risk to the organisation, effectively navigating challenges, and working with difficult stakeholders to achieve outstanding results. Experience in the mining industry is highly desirable. This position is offered on a short to medium-term contract basis with the potential for a permanent role based on performance and project outcomes.  Key Responsibilities:  Lead and manage multiple high-risk projects within the mining technology, HR/SAP system domains from initiation to completion, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and budget. Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, milestones, resource allocation, and risk management strategies. Effectively communicate project goals, objectives, and expectations to stakeholders at all levels of the organization, ensuring alignment and buy-in. Proactively identify, assess, and mitigate project risks and issues, implementing corrective actions as necessary. Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders, managing expectations and addressing concerns promptly and professionally. Coordinate cross-functional teams, ensuring effective collaboration and efficient utilization of resources. Monitor project progress, track key performance indicators, and prepare detailed status reports for senior management and stakeholders. Foster a culture of continuous improvement, identifying opportunities to enhance project management processes and methodologies. Provide mentorship and guidance to junior project managers and team members, promoting professional growth and development.  Qualifications:  Proven experience as a Senior Project Manager, preferably in HR and/or SAP systems, with a minimum of 7-10 years of relevant experience. Strong expertise in project management methodologies, tools, and best practices (e.g., Agile, Waterfall, PMI). Demonstrated ability to manage high-risk projects and navigate complex organisational environments. Exceptional stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence and engage difficult stakeholders effectively. Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a strategic mindset. Project Management Professional (PMP) or equivalent certification is preferred. Experience with HR and SAP systems is advantageous but not critical. Experience in the mining industry is highly desirable.  Key Competencies:  Leadership and decision-making Risk management and mitigation Strategic planning and execution Change management Conflict resolution Time management and prioritization Adaptability and resilience  Why Join Us?  Opportunity to work on high-impact projects that drive organizational success. Collaborative and supportive work environment. Competitive salary and benefits package. Professional development and career growth opportunities. Potential for a permanent position based on performance and project outcomes.  If you are a results-oriented Senior Project Manager with a passion for excellence and a proven ability to manage high-risk projects and challenging stakeholders, we invite you to apply and join our client's team.  Interested? We'd love to hear from you.  If what you have read has piqued your interest, apply now or contact our Technical Consultant, hazel@digitalresources.com.au for further information.  We would still want to hear from you if you're enthusiastic about the position but unsure if you match the requirements. When a new opportunity arises, you will be given priority consideration once you join our talent network.     At this stage, our client can only consider those with Australian PR/Australian Citizenship in place and who are currently based in Western Australia.
