column3: 2-3 month contract for a mid-level Business Analyst working for an exciting consultancy. Sydney or Brisbane based with a good amount of remote working
column13: Business Analyst  Initial 2 month contract Up to $550p/day including super Sydney or Brisbane based, primarily remote Company overview  Our client are a consultancy firm specialising in providing strategic solutions to diverse industries. They pride themselves on their innovative approaches, deep industry knowledge, and commitment to delivering measurable results. Their team is composed of passionate professionals dedicated to driving success for their clients and they have an opening for a mid-level Business Analyst to join the ranks.  Role overview  We are seeking a dynamic and detail-oriented Mid-Level Business Analyst to join the team. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, excellent communication skills, and a proven track record in business analysis. This role requires a deep understanding of business processes, the ability to gather and interpret data, and the skills to translate findings into actionable insights. In addition, any experience around cyber would be a bonus as well as any NFP exposure.  Key Responsibilities:  Conduct detailed business analysis to identify opportunities for improvement and optimization. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their needs and requirements. Develop and document business processes, workflows, and system requirements. Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions. Prepare reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to clients and senior management. Support project management activities, including project planning, monitoring, and reporting. Facilitate workshops and meetings with clients to gather requirements and provide project updates. Assist in the development of business cases and feasibility studies for proposed initiatives. Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Finance, or a related field. 3-5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably within a consultancy environment. Strong analytical skills and the ability to work with complex data sets. Proficiency in business analysis tools and software (e.g., Microsoft Excel, SQL, BI tools). Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Experience with project management methodologies and tools is a plus. Professional certifications (e.g., CBAP, PMP) are advantageous but not required. What’s on Offer  The opportunity to work for an exciting consultancy on an initial 2-3 month contract covering annual leave with the potential to extend.  Click on the ‘APPLY’ button or email your CV to Lewis Ball on lewis.ball@profusiongroup.com  We are committed to providing a supportive culture and positively contributing towards creating diverse and inclusive workplaces for our candidates & clients. We invite candidates of all ages, genders, sexual orientation, cultural backgrounds, people with disability, neurodiverse individuals, and Indigenous Australians to apply.

column3: Seeking a Release Train Engineer to join a banking client that has experience with early stages of SAFe rollouts.
column13: PM-Partners group is a specialist Project Management Consultancy. We have a unique way of running projects and providing training and advice, so our clients get the best results with less cost and risk. Each year we deliver over $3B of projects, train over 10,000 people, and help some of Australia’s leading brands improve their PMOs.       My client, a leading financial services company, is embarking on an exciting journey to enhance their Agile practices and are seeking a skilled Release Train Engineer (RTE) to drive the transformation and elevate the Agile Release Train (ART) capabilities.     As a Release Train Engineer (RTE), you will play a critical role in facilitating and guiding their Agile Release Train (ART) through the early stages of a Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) rollout. Your expertise in stakeholder management, negotiation, and Agile methodologies will be pivotal in ensuring smooth and effective delivery of value across the organisation.     Key Responsibilities:  Lead and manage the Agile Release Train, ensuring alignment with SAFe principles and practices. Facilitate key ceremonies, including PI Planning, ART Syncs, and Inspect & Adapt sessions. Cultivate strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels. Collaborate with product owners, business leaders, and cross-functional teams to align on priorities, remove impediments, and drive consensus. Negotiate and resolve conflicts related to resource allocation, dependencies, and deliverable timelines. Balance competing demands to ensure optimal delivery and value realisation. Guide and support the early implementation of SAFe within the organisation. Assist in the establishment of ARTs, coach teams on SAFe practices, and drive the adoption of Agile principles. Promote a culture of continuous improvement by identifying and addressing areas for enhancement. Facilitate retrospectives and leverage feedback to refine processes and practices.  Key requirements:  Proven track record as a Release Train Engineer or in a similar role within a large-scale. Agile environment. Demonstrated experience standing up and managing a release train during the initial phases of a SAFe rollout. Exceptional stakeholder management and negotiation skills, with the ability to engage, influence, and drive outcomes across diverse teams and organisational levels. In-depth understanding of SAFe principles, practices, and frameworks. Relevant certifications (e.g., SAFe Release Train Engineer) are highly desirable. Strong background in Agile methodologies, including Scrum and Kanban. Experience with Agile tools and techniques. column3: Unleash Your Coding Prowess: Join Us as UAT Lead and Shape the Future!
column13: Role title: Senior UAT lead (Test lead)  Duration: 3 - 6 Months Contract   Location: Melbourne  DBiz Solution is a Transformational Partner. Digital transformation is intense. We’d like for you to have something to hold on to, whilst you set out bringing your ideas into existence. Beyond anything, we put humans first. This means solving real problems with real people and providing needs with real, working solutions.   DBiz leverages a wealth of experience building a variety of software to improve our client’s ability to respond to change and build tomorrow’s digital business. We’re quite proud of our track record. Having delivered over 150 projects for over 100 clients, we can honestly say we leave our clients happy and wanting more.   Using data, we aim to unlock value and create platforms/products at scale that can evolve with business strategies using our innovative Rapid Application Development methodologies.  The passion for creating an impact.  Our passion for creating an impact drives everything we do. We believe that technology has the power to transform businesses and improve lives, and it is our mission to harness this power to make a difference. We constantly strive to innovate and deliver solutions that not only meet our clients' needs but exceed their expectations, allowing them to achieve their goals and drive sustainable growth. Through our world-leading digital transformation strategies, we are always growing and improving. That means creating an environment where each and every one of us has the opportunity to strive together for excellence.  Your new role  We are seeking individuals who possess an unwavering determination to create a meaningful impact – not only for our valued customers, but also within our close-knit team and across DBiz.  In this exciting role as a senior developer, you will be planning, coordinating, and leading the UAT phase of software development projects. This role involves working closely with business stakeholders, project managers, and development teams to ensure the final product meets the business requirements and is ready for production.  What you'll require for success   Minimum of 5 years of experience in software testing, with at least 2 years in a UAT lead roles. Proven experience in leading UAT efforts for large-scale projects. Strong understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) and testing methodologies.  What you can expect in exchange  Unlock your potential with unparalleled opportunities for skill development, experience, and growth, paving the way for a truly rewarding career. Immerse yourself in engaging and meaningful work, where your contribution to our customers is valued and celebrated. Step into a contemporary, collaborative, and sustainable work environment in the heart of Melbourne, where innovative ideas thrive. Embrace an exciting journey of collaboration with diverse stakeholders and units within our organization, fostering remarkable synergy and success.  Be highly valued  Access to flexible working arrangements.  Learn from experienced professionals.   Great people to work with.  Investment in your learning and development.   How do I apply?   To apply for this opportunity please share your latest resume with rebeesh.raveendran@dbizsolution.com or you can reach him at 0420759806

Responsibilities  Provide workforce analytics and reports to executive and senior managers, enabling informed decision-making on workforce-related matters. Essential Criteria:  Strong experience in resource and workforce planning frameworks. Background in radio and telecommunications. Demonstrated expertise in project and program management. column3: Join our Agility team on a 12 month max term supporting our Data team.
column13: As an Agile Coach you will empower teams to deliver business outcomes that have an impact and delight members, and continuously find new ways of working to deliver value, increase business agility, uplift engagement, improve delivery flow, and manage uncertainty.  What will you be doing?  Providing true leadership to Agile teams with authenticity high energy and enthusiasm to support collaboration, the removal of impediments, self-management and cross functionality, so they deliver business outcomes that have an impact, and delight members and/or staff Leveraging a deep knowledge of Agile methods, acting as an Agile champion, contributing to expanding the understanding and practice of Agile values and principles and promoting the Agile mindset across teams Ensuring transparency, sustainable pace, inspection and adaption principles apply to delivery to support decision making guided by delivery levers and controls Collaborating with teams, sponsors, stakeholders and members to ensure the effective delivery of value aligned to strategic objectives that solve members' and organisational problems Developing greater team cohesiveness through coaching and supporting Product Owner(s) (or Platform Owners) in helping them understand their role and what the team needs from them  What are we looking for in you?  Scrum Master certification and foundational Agile Coaching practices is desirable (scrum.org and IC Agile preferred) Hands-on experience in guiding teams through Agile adoption, facilitating Agile ceremonies, and implementing Agile practices within a matrix organisation Strong communication and interpersonal skills are essential for effectively coaching and collaborating with teams, as well as the ability to adapt Agile principles to different organisational contexts An understanding of organisational dynamics, and continuous improvement is also crucial to support teams in their Agile journey and any experience with change management is highly desirable An understanding of product management, software delivery, IT Service Delivery and Service Transition process is desirable  What can we offer you?  Working in an environment that is embracing a continuous improvement culture using experimentation to support learning Time dedicated to your personal development time with access to training, development, and certification programs to ensure you can upskill - if you have a growth mindset RAC is the place for you Being part of empowered, cross-functional agile delivery teams that works with the business to build systems that solve problems that impact our members in WA Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Gain RAC Staff Benefits including free Roadside Assistance and 25% discount on your Insurances, Social Club and access Fitness Passport for cheaper gym memberships  About RAC As an Equal Opportunity Employer, RAC values inclusivity and promotes a workplace that actively seeks to welcome contributions from all people. RAC is committed to flexibility. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact jason.crooks@rac.com.au.

column3: Seeking an Agile Coach to steer a Scaled Agile Framework transformation from the ground up.
column13: PM-Partners group is a specialist Project Management Consultancy. We have a unique way of running projects and providing training and advice, so our clients get the best results with less cost and risk. Each year we deliver over $3B of projects, train over 10,000 people, and help some of Australia’s leading brands improve their PMOs.       My client, a leading Financial Services company, are embarking on an ambitious journey to implement the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) and need a talented Agile Coach to steer this transformation from the ground up.     As the Agile Coach, you will be at the forefront of guiding them through the initial stages of their SAFe rollout. Your primary focus will be on establishing Agile practices, fostering a collaborative culture, and ensuring the successful adoption of SAFe across the organisation. Your expertise in stakeholder management and negotiation will be critical in aligning various teams and driving the change agenda.     Key Responsibilities:  Lead and support the early phases of SAFe implementation. Guide the organisation in adopting SAFe principles and practices to enhance agility and efficiency. Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including senior leaders, team members, and cross-functional groups. Navigate complex dynamics to align priorities and secure buy-in. Provide hands-on coaching to teams and leaders on Agile methodologies and SAFe practices. Foster a culture of continuous improvement and agile mindset. Design and deliver training sessions and workshops to enhance Agile skills and knowledge across the organisation. Support teams in applying Agile principles to their daily work.  Key Requirements:  Proven experience as an Agile Coach or in a similar role, with a strong background in Agile methodologies and SAFe implementation. Exceptional stakeholder management and negotiation skills, with a demonstrated ability to influence and align diverse teams and leaders. Solid understanding of SAFe principles and practices. Relevant certifications (e.g., SAFe Program Consultant, SAFe Agile Coach) are highly desirable. Deep knowledge of Agile frameworks, including Scrum, Kanban, and Lean. Experience in coaching teams through Agile transformations. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex ideas clearly and effectively.  What we can offer you!   Culture: A fun, fast paced, collaborative delivery environment  People: A group of talented, experienced, and dedicated Consultants to work by your side with a dedicated Relationship Manager  Passion: Ability to band together when under pressure to deliver first class results to clients  Transparency: Open door policy  Professional Development: On the job development and access to certifications in our Training practice  Care and Support: On-going support and advice from experienced PM-Partners Consultants  Knowledge: Access to PM-Partners Delivery and Advisory practices   If you feel you meet our selection criteria, please submit your resume to Paul Woodhead at PM-Partners via LinkedIn or SEEK application or email –  paulw@pm-partners.com.au

column3: We are looking for a passionate Senior API Engineer, to build meaningful customer outcomes in a high energy purpose driven organisation!
column13: Will you actively create a healthier future for tomorrow?  At Medibank and ahm we're encouraged to think big. We have a clear purpose to impact better health outcomes for our customers, patients and our community.  We celebrate diversity of thought because we want to make better decisions for our customers. As we work towards our goal of better health for better lives, we value the knowledge and contribution of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders. We are working hard to create an inclusive workplace and develop Indigenous careers.  Enterprise Digital  We are building an expert team to deliver best in class solutions for our customers. Our mission is to "Create delightful experiences that help our customers achieve better health".  Want to meet the team and learn more about working with our digital and technology teams? Follow this link to learn more: https://digitalcareers.medibank.com.au  Your new role:  Are you a passionate API Engineer looking for an opportunity to build meaningful customer outcomes in a high energy team in a purpose driven organisation?  As a Senior API Engineer at Medibank you will be hands on in helping us build and manage the technology work in an agile squad within the API team and be responsible for setting, implementing and maintaining best practice across the agile delivery squads. Medibank operates in the AWS environment, and you will use a variety of technologies including code and build tools that support development of microservices.  This is an initial 6-month contract opportunity, with the possibility of extension or conversion to a permanent position. We are open to candidates Australia wide.  The role will primarily involve hands on development and delivering user stories within an agile squad. You will also provide technology mentoring to squad members as well as having the opportunity to work with stakeholders to develop and enhance our API capability for current and future needs.  Designing and building API's and Integration solutions for Medibank Digital Writing maintainable, secure, scalable, performant and well-tested code Provide guidance on the latest API technology advances to inform our product designs. Contribute towards Code reviews, Improvement of automation and any best practices that enables faster secure delivery of the initiatives. Participating in all aspects of agile project delivery (including planning and user story refinement) and interacting with all project stakeholders Deliver highly maintainable solutions, including meaningful error trapping and alerts Take an active role in mentoring less experienced Developers to develop a strong team, skills and culture around integration that crosses the development, support, infrastructure and data teams.  Must have skills:  Experience in and opinions on good and bad approaches to systems integration, software development, message-based middleware and SOA, APIs, API management, data modelling, legacy integration techniques inc DB staging tables and stored procedures. Expertise in many key technical aspects of integration such as how REST differs from SOAP, and pub-sub differs from request-reply, when to use message queuing vs not, and whether an ESB is a good thing. Experience with developing integration in many technologies and languages, including Java, GraphQL, Node.js, as well as scripting in Linux and other OSs using FTP/SFTP/etc. SpringBoot, Apache Camel, API & Microservices experience will be the key requirements. Experience in Amazon AWS - Message Streaming technologies, best practices Exposure to build and automation tools (Ant, Maven, Gradle, Jenkins, Bamboo). Experience with Agile Methodologies such as Scrum using JIRA, but also with more traditional structured approaches.  Desired skills:  Java 8 & above AWS experience with using a broad range of AWS technologies (e.g. EC2, RDS, ELB, S3, VPC, Glacier, IAM, CloudWatch, KMS) to develop and maintain an Amazon AWS based cloud solution, with an emphasis on best practice cloud security DevOps: Solid exposure to DevOps Engineer in a 24x7 uptime Amazon AWS environment, including automation with configuration management tools  Minimum Education/Professional Qualifications & Experience Required:  10 years' experience with API and integration software development Experience working in an Agile team environment Experience working within the AWS environment  A career with us  We believe work is something we do, not somewhere we go. Our modes of working - Collaboration, Connection and Concentration - help inform how your day is structured and where you choose to work will vary, depending on your role and requirements.  The wellbeing of our employees is our priority. We encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments or additional support you may require during the recruitment process, as well as how this role can be flexible for you. We encourage applications from candidates with a disability, if you require any adjustments or alternate formats of key information at any stage of the recruitment process, we welcome hearing from you via contractorengagement@medibank.com.au  To start small and impact bigger.

column3: Are you an experienced SAP FI Functional Analyst seeking your next role with the Federal Government?
column13: Our Federal Government client is seeking an SAP FI Functional Consultant for a 10 month contract with 2x12 months extension. The role is open for Melbourne, Canberra and Brisbane. This role is open for Australian Citizens with the ability to obtain a Baseline security clearance.  10 month contract with 2x12 months extension. Open for Australian Citizen with the ability to obtain a baseline. Paxus pays weekly.  SAP Functional Analysts are responsible for translating business needs into ICT system requirements and specifications for enhancements. It includes designing, analysing and documenting software systems to meet business expectations. They are responsible for writing functional specifications from the business requirements. SAP Functional Analysts promote and deliver flexible, quality service and products to improve customer experience, work under the limited direction of senior staff to deliver results and undertake complex work.  As the SAP FI Functional consultant you will:  Design, configure and build the SAP FI application; Document the application in Blueprints and Detailed Design Specifications; Perform ICT solution reviews for SAP FI solutions; Coach Services Australia resources to continue to build our expertise in the SAP FI environment; Perform unit testing of configuration and development changes utilising HPALM and provide technical support for SIT/UAT testing Participate in meetings and workshops with internal and external stakeholders  To be successful for this role you must:  Think strategically and align operational activity accordingly Grasp expectations and concerns, and negotiate quality outcomes Develop and manage a range of internal and external stakeholder relationships * Manage and resolve conflict using appropriate strategies Understand the audience and context, and effectively tailor communication Manage staff and competing priorities to achieve quality outcomes and project completion Assess risks and implement mitigation strategies Undertake objective, systematic analysis and draw accurate conclusions based on evidence Develop long term plans for the team and manage work in the context of business priorities Work highly independently under broad direction and act collaboratively  When inquiring about this role, please quote the job number #266577  To be considered for the role click the 'apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Irina Alrogi on +61 (0)2 6151 9203 or email: ialrogi@paxus.com.au and quote the above job reference number. column13: About us  IITS Consulting is looking for multiple roles to work with a large federal government department:  SAP Functional Analysts (ERP HR); SAP Functional Analysts (ERP FI);  SAP FI Functional Configuration and Business Analysts; and SAP Developers (IBM API Connect).     If interested in any of the above roles please contact us through our email (support@iits-consulting.com). In your email please mention the specific role above which is of interest to you. Once we receive your request will send you the job description and other details relevant to the role.     Benefits  Initial contract 10 months with option for another 2 x 12 month extensions. Flexible work arrangements. Location of work: ACT, QLD, VIC

column3: Pls call Renee Clayton on 0477 778 449. You will be responsible for overseeing the successful migration of data from sources systems into SAP
column13: Our Client is transforming its Enterprise Asset Management and Enterprise Resource Planning technology. The final solution will be designed and developed through series of releases across a multi-year program of work.     We require a Functional Analyst with experience in SAP Supply Chain Management to join the Data Migration Team. The role will be integral in ensuring a successful migration of data from legacy systems so SAP.     The Functional Data Analyst will work closely with Product Owners, Functional Specialists, Subject Matter Experts from the business and other members of the Data Migration team to ensure an effective design, build, and test of data migration processes.      The Functional Data Analyst will be responsible for overseeing the successful migration of data from sources systems into SAP through the following activities: -     Review of target data model designs to confirm required definitions and governance rules are documented to a sufficient level to support the migration design. Development of functional designs for migration of data through collaboration with Functional Specialists and Business SMEs. Providing functional support for Data Migration developers to ensure build of migration processes as designed. Supporting Business SMEs in preparing and validating data. Identifying dependencies between data migration activities as inputs to data migration planning. Providing functional input and support to Data Cleanse activities. Performing functional validations of data loads. Resolving assigned defects related to data migration activities, performing root cause analysis comparing source and target data, to reach an appropriate remediation or solution. Communicating issues and status formally and informally to the Data Lead and Project Management.   The Functional Data Analyst’s skills and experience must include:    Sound functional knowledge of SAP SCM data and processes, including integration to SCM, Finance and other modules. Proficiency in the SAP SCM data model, including tables and their relationships. Design and execution of data migration processes. Ability to build effective relationships with data team members, business SMEs and functional specialists. Development of concise, accurate and complete documentation. Essential Criteria  Proficient in SAP EAM data and processes: 5+ years’ functional experience in SAP SCM implementations and /or support. Experience working on large-scale SAP data migrations with core focus in Enterprise Asset Management. Sound understanding of SCM configuration and dependent master data. An eye for detail; ability to analyse and validate datasets against a target data model to identify issues with completeness or accuracy. Expertise in data migration activities; cleansing, mapping, validation, reconciliation and issue resolution Ability to communicate at technical and non-technical levels. Ability to meet deadlines in a high pressure, fast paced, environment, working independently and as part of a team. For more information, please call the Glen Fisk Recruitment Team.  Renee Clayton (renee@glenfisk.com.au) 0477 778 449 Kyle (Kyle.Buchanan@glenfisk.com.au) 0477 773 084 Lakshmi (Lakshmi.Dhanarajachar@glenfisk.com.au) 0490 506 923   Quoting reference number 672273  Alternatively, to submit an application, please click below. Please submit your resume in Word format only.
